Review: I booked a return flight through GoToGate for 13 April 2025 with Wizz Air. The travel document clearly stated a 01:40 departure from Jeddah to London. When I arrived at the airport, I was informed the flight had been moved to 12 April ‚Äî a day earlier ‚Äî and that I had missed it.Wizz Air advised that GoToGate requested the change.I was never informed.No email. No SMS. Nothing.GoToGate now claims they did notify me ‚Äî yet I have reviewed every single message, folder, and account. There is no evidence. I have asked them to provide proof, but so far, silence.This isn‚Äôt just a missed flight. It‚Äôs a breakdown in basic duty of care. When you operate in the travel industry, communication is everything. I was left stranded in another country because of GoToGate‚Äôs failure to notify me of a change they requested.I have since raised a dispute with my bank, but the burden should not fall on customers to chase answers after being let down.If you're considering booking through GoToGate ‚Äî I strongly urge you to reconsider.

Review: We cancelled our VietJet Air flight through Booking (managed by GoToGate), and a travel voucher of around ‚Ç¨360 was issued. We simply wanted to use that voucher to book two new flights (a 1-hour domestic flight and a 3-hour international flight), whose total cost was well within the value of the voucher.Yet GoToGate made the process completely impossible:	‚Ä¢	Refused to share the voucher with us directly	‚Ä¢	Forced us to go through their customer service for any rebooking	‚Ä¢	No transparency about the actual flight prices	‚Ä¢	They asked for over ‚Ç¨1,000 for flights that we could see cost no more than ‚Ç¨411 total without giving us the amount of the flight, only a link for us to pay extra Every exchange was confusing and contradictory. We received vague and often nonsensical answers. No breakdown of the costs. No clear communication.After over a month of going in circles, we were forced to buy new tickets on our own. We then requested a refund ‚Äî first they said it was in progress, then said it wasn‚Äôt possible, then told us again to use the voucher‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs never-ending nonsense.We are now demanding a full and immediate refund, because this entire situation was caused by their blatant mismanagement.GoToGate should be avoided at all costs. Their customer service is nonexistent, their practices are opaque, and the overall experience has been unacceptable.At this point, their behavior borders on illegality, and the way this company operates feels more like organized fraud than a serious travel agency.I had to post this again to insert my order number 40-674986360

Review: USLESS, POINTLESS, MIDDLE MAN COMPANY - AVOID! I'd give 0 stars if I could. I booked return flights to Ibiza with EasyJet via Go To Gate, 9mths in advance. With 3mths to go, EasyJet changed the flight times and departing airport. I told Go To Gate I could not accept the change (they were cutting my 3 day trip short by a whole day!) and wanted a full refund. They said it would be 10 working days. After 10 days they'd only refunded my outbound flight (¬£350). I called for an update and they said they were waiting for EasyJet to refund them and then I'd be refunded. I had to contact them a further 4 times over a 3 week period for the remining ¬£600 I was owed. Each time I was told that there was nobody in their refunds team that I could speak to and I'd have to just keep waiting. In the end I checked EasyJet's website and could see my inbound flights had been rebooked on the 9am flight I did not agree to! After 2 more calls to Go To Gate, and no resolution, I contacted EasyJet and they were able to cancel the booking and refund my money, within 30mins. Annoyingly the refund had to go via Go To Gate who then took a further 3 days to credit me. All in all I had to wait 1 month for what was supposed to be a 10 day refund, chase this AWFUL company several times and eventually do their job for them and contact the airline myself. If you're going to be a middle man company at least be good at it, otherwise you're just useless!

Review: I‚Äôm deeply disappointed by my recent experience with Gotogate and feel compelled to share this to help others avoid the same ordeal.On April 5 2025, I was scheduled to travel from Sydney to Dubai via Singapore with flights booked through Gotogate ‚Äî Scoot (TR3) from Sydney to Singapore and Emirates from Singapore to Dubai. Gotogate offered this itinerary under its Self-Transfer Guarantee, which claims to protect customers in case of missed connections.Scoot was delayed by over 90 minutes, landing in Singapore at 8:16 PM instead of the scheduled 7:00 PM. My connecting Emirates flight to Dubai was at 9:00 PM. Despite doing everything I could ‚Äî including booking a seat near the aircraft door to exit quickly ‚Äî I missed the flight due to immigration delays and baggage collection. I reached the Emirates counter at 9:20 PM, only to find the gate closed.With no assistance from Gotogate at that critical moment, I had no choice but to book another Emirates flight departing at 12:50 AM at huge amount of money.Despite Gotogate‚Äôs Self-Transfer Guarantee promising to assist in such cases, I‚Äôve been repeatedly told that I will only be refunded the original ticket price (a fraction of what I paid for the last-minute booking). I‚Äôve been passed around by multiple agents, with no meaningful resolutionThis has caused immense stress and financial loss. What‚Äôs even more frustrating is that I did everything by the book and trusted Gotogate‚Äôs guarantee ‚Äî only to be let down. This experience makes me question the credibility of their Self-Transfer policy, which now feels more like a marketing gimmick than a real customer safeguard.I sincerely urge Gotogate to do the right thing and refund the full cost of my rebooking as per their stated policy.To the Gotogate team: please escalate this to a senior manager who can act with fairness and integrity.To fellow travelers: be extremely cautious booking through Gotogate, especially when dealing with tight connections. Their guarantees may not protect you when it matters most.

Review: I‚Äôm writing this post to share my ongoing and extremely frustrating experience with @Gotogate and its parent company @Etraveli. I booked four flights for my girlfriend and me‚Äîthree of which were executed flawlessly. However, the fourth flight underwent an unexpected schedule change that would have delayed our arrival by a day.After contacting support about this change, I was informed that a same-day flight wasn‚Äôt available and that I needed to initiate a refund in order to even get an estimated refund amount. When I pointed out that this process was unacceptable, support agreed to open a request to inquire about the refund amount without immediately cancelling the flight. Despite this agreement‚Äîand with screenshots as proof‚Äîthey went ahead and initiated a refund, effectively cancelling my flight.For the past six weeks, I have been in continuous contact through calls and web chats. There was even a moment when it appeared we might reach a resolution, as I received an offer for an alternative flight. Unfortunately, my follow-up email was ignored, and I have written confirmation from support that no action was taken on my reply.With only two days remaining until my scheduled departure, I feel compelled to publicly share this experience. I hope that by bringing this issue to light, @Mathius Hedland and the leadership at Gotogate and Etraveli will take immediate action to improve their customer service and ensure that no one else experiences such unprofessional handling of their travel plans.UPDATE! They booked us a new flight and cancelled that too. 10 hours from the departure date the customer service representative tells us to contact the airline ourselves, whilst simultaneously admitting gotogates guilt. All recorded. If we did not call, because we no longer trust them, we would have got up at 5am tomorrow morning, got to the airport and been told that we weren't on the flight. Absolutely unbelievable.Update on gotogates reply:Yes the airline changed the schedule as I said in my situation above, but gotogate are the one that cancelled without my approval. They have said I had the flight rebooked and once again it was cancelled, if it existed at all. Talking to support again at 130am in the morning there is no flight for us and we have had to book our own. Instigating a refund and compensation procedures. I will be sure to review again once these are underway / complete.#CustomerExperience #TravelIssues #CustomerService

Review: I booked a group flight via Gotogate on Wizzair.The flight has been changed by the airline, and they have never contacted me to accept the changes or to cancel the flight.I couldn‚Äôt manage the flight booking to cancel or modify as I was not the booking owner.Kept trying to reach out & once, one of the agents gave me details of prices I could get to cancel the flight on their chat via a voucher which can be used in future booking of Wizzair flight tickets.On another day, another agent kept telling me to reach out to the airline to manage the booking, despite informing them that the airline doesn‚Äôt deal with bookings bought through a 3rd party.They kept insisting to tell me to try to call or chat with the airline without listening or giving solutions.They may be ignorant of how it works or they are in a position that they have already got the money & the customer puts their heads in between their legs.Very bad experience, and the end result is that I & all my relatives, friends, family members & acquaintances will never use this company for booking flights.I may have lost some money but I will make sure they lose more on the long run.They will lose the reputation of respecting their customers needs.

Stay away from this site. Finally one person said as passengers are at airport we have escalated the case and enquiring with airline to sort out.Later at 1 am on 11 april contacted but one lady said case will take time to solve. Then i had to book another flight (immedietely) to bring parents home. It costed me roughly 3260$.So, today is 12 april and am still waiting for an update from gotogate.com

Review: I am from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. I departed with China Eastern (Booked via Gotogate) to go to Budapest to visit my girlfriend, departed 13th Feb, landed at 14th Feb.Flights were:MU8592 (KUL-PVG)(Transfer at PVG)MU8639 (PVG-BUD)MU8640 (BUD-PVG)(Transfer at PVG)MU6021 (PVG-KUL)I was supposed to fly home, at 17th March, but Gotogate's system said and I quote: "Your booking has been changed, Please check your email to confirm your updated trip." and "Your reservation has been changed".I had NO email sent to me, still untill now, just nothing! I was denied at checkin due to this discrepency of information about the ticket, and they told me to contact Gotogate about what this could be, as my flight may have been moved to a different date.Called them, they said I wasn't moved to a different date, and to please call the airline. I called the airline, guess what? They told me "We cannot handle your booking, please contact your travel agency", and this was repeated back and forth passing responsibilities...back to back to back..for 10 days.I even sent both companies screenshots of the error, and finally at the 26th of March, I received a formal email from the Kuala Lumpur Office at China Eastern Airlines about my voluntary reschedule.They said and I quote:"Thank you for contacting China Eastern Airlines Kuala Lumpur Branch. We have received your complaint regarding your voluntary ticket change to the same flight on Apr 2nd. To proceed with your rebooking request, you need to come to our office in person so that we can verify your passport details and collect any applicable charges. This is because your ticket is issued via a third-party travel agency, and unfortunately, we are unable to proceed with this kind of request online at this moment. I understand that you are currently outside Malaysia. Givin this, we would suggest that you contact the travel agency directly to assist with your flight change request. Meanwhile, I have forwarded your complaint about the travel agency to our OTA team for review. Should you have any further queries, feel free to reply to this email."I would like to repeat, that email, was literally at the 26th of march. That's 9 days already, and no response, I gave a response via call, i was expected a response via call too, nothing. No call, no email.Contacted Gotogate at the 27th and finally they started "working" on my case. I have been promised a response within 24 hours...24 hours has passed, no response. I kept calling every single day, till now, no response...So I visited the ECC's office in budapest, to get some help possibly, I managed to talk to one of the higherups or employees? I dont know, she referred him as her boss or something?Yeah, I talked to him and explained my situation, even called gotogate in front of him and let him hear it and yeah... Dissapointing. He said there is unfortunately, nothing I can do now besides file a report that involves the law or something, but unfortunately I will still have to keep waiting. I didn't file that yet, because he told me if i want to file with ECC first then this case has to be going on for a month before I can file this claim, so I just waited...Called gotogate today and I just got a response, saying if I want to report this team and claim compensation for the mishandling of my case, I can file some report form with them...which may take a few days or even upto 2 weeks to receive a response! I did it, so. Yeah. I'm stuck here still. I even called my embassy but unfortunately, they cannot help, as they only assist in...i dont know what matters...they count my matter as a "personal matter" so it doesnt count...I have to go home...I have to attend multiple medical appointments/procedures, due to my mix of depression/anxiety/sleep issues/potential autism (as said by doctor, its possible, but not sure yet.) I have been taking antidepressants (Fluvox 100mg)  but they do nothing besides worsen the affects...so i stopped taking them and yeah, as expected I didn't receive any side effects cuz this literally didnt do anything for me. I have a kitten thats a few months old that I have to take care of...And I have more medical issues too which i need to get sorted out, cheilitis which is i dont know what kind, but normal medicines/treatments never worked so it requires further examination/testing, dandruff issues which some normal medicines/over the counter treatments/dandruff shampoos dont work that still need further examination and lately been having some heart irregularities sometimes...so yeah...I am not willing to use healthcare here, as it is significantly more expensive, and government healthcare is literally free in my home country, malaysia. covering everything if you're a citizen. And I do have some expert doctors that can help...only back at home....

In order to have enough time to handle your request, we kindly ask you to make your choice within 5 days or 5 days before your original departure date, whichever option comes first.If you wish to explore other flight options, please keep in mind that seat availability may change as your travel date approaches. If the suggested option doesn't meet your needs, please contact us as soon as possible so we can assist you further.However, kindly be aware that a service fee may apply.If you have already selected an option, your original departure date is within 72 hours but you haven't received a confirmation email yet, please contact us.As an intermediary travel partner, the airline provided us with the following 2 options for your booking:Rebook your flight(s)Find here the new flight option available for you, with no extra cost.If this alternative suits your needs, simply reply by clicking the link below, allowing us to rebook your ticket.Here what's changed in your bookingFri, 23 May - SA41Departing: Victoria Falls (VFA) at 14:15Arriving: Johannesburg (JNB) at 16:00Fri, 23 May - VS450Departing: Johannesburg (JNB) at 20:40Arriving: London Heathrow (LHR) at 06:45Sat, 24 May - BA1476Departing: London Heathrow (LHR) at 10:45Arriving: Glasgow (GLA) at 12:10If this option doesn't work for you, contact us to find an alternative with a different available flight. Please note that in this case, extra charges - such as service fee and /or a difference in fare or taxes - may apply.Click here to request a rebooking with the proposed optionRequest a refund for your orderWe can request a refund from the airline on your behalf. If approved, we will return the refunded amount to your original payment method.Our current average handling time for refunds after receiving funds from the airline is 6 days. We promptly submit claims to the airline(s) upon receiving your request.While most airlines process refunds in under 5 business days, the entire process can take 10-15 business days from the time you confirm cancellation until we process the payout.Please note that we have no control over the processing time by your payment provider or bank after refunding your account.Click here to request a refund1046-496-797 Confirmation of your selectionInboxGotogate  Sat 22 Feb, 10:35to meHi Hazel,Thank you for providing us with your preferred option.This is a no-reply email confirming your request has been received and added to our queue.What Happens NextOnce processed, you will receive a cancellation confirmation with instructions on how to track the status of your refund on the My Bookings page on our website.As soon as the airline confirms your refund eligibility or sends us the refund amount, we will issue it to your original form of payment.Kind regards,Gotogatethis is the email you sent me on the 22 feb after you cancelled my flights.  you did not authorize refund until the 21st mar after i made 3 webchats before i finally got refund authorized so i waited 5 weeks for refund instead of 10-15 days.  i have given you booking ref 4 times and you keep saying i haven't given a valid ref so i am putting it here again on the public board so don't bother replying that i shouldn't do this.  you ignore my emails so i have no choice but to communicate with you this way.

Review: In short, I have booked 4 flights with luggage included on one of them, got to the airport and, while dropping my luggage, was informed by the airline that no luggage was included (despite being charged for one and showing them at the counter the evidence of that). As a result, I was left with no option than to pay for the luggage at the counter (at a higher rate) and advised by the airline to reach back to Gotogate (who made the original booking with luggage). As a result, I went back to Gotogate for the refund. The mistake was immediately acknowledge but I only got refunded the value charged during the booking, rather than what I have paid in the counter due to Gotogate mistake. Again, the issue has been acknowledged but them I was told that nothing else could be done. In essence, the same as saying, we know that you have been a Booking.com (the provider originally used) customer for almost 20 years, we acknowledge we have messed up, caused a lot of inconvenience but rather prefer ignore all of that on the back of a 24 Euros difference (which for me, its fundamentally a matter of principle). On top of that their customer service was absolutely incapable of dealing with the issue as well. I thought was dealing with an AI agent. Not going to use this provider anymore.- Update -After this post, Gotogate reached out to me asking to re-submit the request so that it could be finally addressed. Silly me, I have decided to give them a final chance to make things right just to get an automated response 6 minutes later outlining that nothing can be done and the case has been closed again. Well done - enough said about this company.

Review: If I could give them -5 stars I would! Gotogate is the company that booking.com uses to handle issues with airline reservations. As a result of the Heathrow closure on the 21st of March 2025 China Eastern cancelled my flights to Shangai (PVG) and Tokyo. Upon contacting the airline directly,  they confirmed over the phone that booking.com was responsible for refunding fully the tickets however, gotogate has closed 3 support tickets stating that they have not been able to get in touch with the airline and shifting the responsibilities back to the airline. On my 4th attempt and after giving gotogate China Eastern's tel number and updating them that they were meant to be refunding me the money instead, they have let it open. It has been well over 2 weeks and I still have not signs of my refund or any update from gotogate on the matter. Booking.com shame on you, letting your customer down and cashless, not to mention unable to book anything else as a result.F.A.O: GOTOGATEBOOKING REFERENCE: 40607254336PS: There isn't a private section anywhere so my booking ref here.

Review: I had an extremely frustrating experience with Gotogate, and I strongly advise against booking with them.I purchased a flexible ticket in June 2024, expecting that I could change my flight if needed. When I requested a change in February 2025, it was processed, but then I noticed my middle name was missing on the ticket. I followed their process for a name correction and paid the required fee.After paying, Gotogate randomly demanded an additional payment without explanation. I challenged this, and after multiple calls and inconsistent responses from different agents, they finally confirmed my ticket was released without extra fees.Later, the airline changed my flight, and I had to adjust my return date. Gotogate confirmed my name correction and the new flight date multiple times. However, weeks passed, and every time I called, they gave me conflicting information or ignored my case.The worst part? After two months of waiting, I discovered that Gotogate never even submitted my name correction request to the airline! Their customer service lied to me multiple times, giving me false hope while wasting my time and causing me extreme stress.Now, they are offering me a partial refund but refusing to refund fees for services they never properly provided. I have all the proof of their misleading communication and will escalate this case legally.If you value honest customer service, transparency, and your peace of mind, DO NOT BOOK with Gotogate. This company misleads customers, delays resolutions, and refuses to take responsibility for their mistakes.

Review: Achtung ‚Äì Extrem unseri√∂s durch Booking & Gotogate!Ich habe √ºber Booking einen Flug gebucht (abgewickelt √ºber Gotogate), bezahlt ‚Äì doch die Tickets wurden nie ordnungsgem√§√ü ausgestellt. Am Flughafen wurde mir der Check-in verweigert. Stehe 4 Uhr nachts am Flughafen - Flug verpasst, Geld weg, Kundenservice l√ºgt, selbstst√§ndig neuen Flug f√ºr erheblich mehr Kosten gebucht. Was danach kam, war ein absoluter Albtraum: Der Kundenservice von Booking und Gotogate hat mich belogen, hingehalten und mit allen Mitteln versucht, mich von einer R√ºckerstattung und abzubringen. Offensichtliches Ziel: Zeit schinden, bis der Kunde aufgibt. Ein faires Verhalten? Fehlanzeige.Wichtiger Rat an alle Betroffenen:Lasst euch nichts am Telefon erz√§hlen ‚Äì besteht auf schriftliche Kommunikation. Sichert alle Beweise, kontaktiert sofort eure Bank f√ºr eine R√ºckbuchung und schaltet die Schlichtungsstelle f√ºr den √∂ffentlichen Verkehr ein. Ohne massiven Druck bekommt ihr keinen Cent zur√ºck. Wer kann, sollte auch rechtliche Schritte pr√ºfen ‚Äì freiwillig zahlen sie nichts.Fazit:Booking & Gotogate sind unzuverl√§ssig, intransparent und kundenfeindlich. H√§nde weg! Ich buche dort nie wieder ‚Äì und kann nur jeden davor warnen, den gleichen Fehler zu machen.English:I booked a flight via Booking (handled through Gotogate), paid in full ‚Äì but the tickets were never properly issued. At 4 AM I was standing at the airport, unable to check in. Flight missed, money gone. The customer service lied to me, and I had to book a new flight myself at significantly higher cost.What followed was an absolute nightmare: The customer service from Booking and Gotogate repeatedly lied, delayed responses, and clearly tried everything to avoid a refund. Their strategy is obvious ‚Äì stall until the customer gives up. Fair treatment? Absolutely not.Important advice for anyone affected:Don‚Äôt trust anything said over the phone ‚Äì demand written communication. Save all evidence, immediately contact your bank to initiate a chargeback, and get in touch with the public transport arbitration board. Without serious pressure, you won‚Äôt get a single cent back. If possible, consider legal action ‚Äì they won‚Äôt pay voluntarily.Conclusion:Booking & Gotogate are unreliable, opaque, and customer-hostile. Stay away! I will never book with them again ‚Äì and I strongly warn anyone not to make the same mistake.

Review: APPALLING customer service. Review: DO NOT USE! REMEMBER THAT THEY CAN AND WILL TAKE ALL OF YOUR MONEY IF THEY CAN. It is NOT WORTH the 25USD you save by buying on their website.Here's my experience. I booked flights from BOM to HKG return (total cost 7149HKD, plus premium support package 385HKD which waives any additional fees of mytrip.com). The airline cancellation fee per ticket was 549HKD.However, my visa or pre-arrival registration to Hong Kong got rejected. So I reached out to mytrip.com to cancel my tickets but also requested them to try and waive the 549HKD cancellation fee charged by Cathay because Cathay mentioned they offer full refund due to visa cancellation. mytrip.com's customer service in processing this was very inadequate and slow but they did do it and sent me a link (which weirdly said "medical certificate" proof) to send documents proof - which I did.A few weeks went by and nothing - they didnt even return the fare MINUS THE CANCELLATION FEE which I asked them to a few times and got completely useless customer support. Suddenly one day I find a status on their website on my order saying "Refund received from Cathay and sent to credit card". But i didnt see this on my credit card at all so I reached out to them after giving a week or so to see if it might reflect late. And they said "Oh your documents were not valid so we can't refund you". I'm like - What do u mean by "you can't refund me".Even if the documents are "not valid" (not sure why, coz I sent whatever I had - "pre-arrival registration unsuccessful" screenshot), I should at least and first get back the fare minus the cancellation fee. They claimed "Oh u asked for refund by special condition so no refund for you". By this time,I had wasted hours of my life on this, and didnt see the point of wasting hours more on this.There you go. I was never told at any point that there was any special condition. All I asked was waiver of cancellation fee and instead they took the entire fare on a flimsy pretence. So much for "premium support".Lesson learnt - No free lunch. If they're charging 25 USD less, it's because they reckon they have a chance at making away with 1000USD from you. Which is what they did.PS - They're fairly diabolical too. There's a small byline in their terms and conditions which says "Certain tickets are non-refundable". They use that to justify to American Express if you try to dispute their transaction even though clearly my ticket was a refundable one with a clear cancellation fee.Company operates in different names so the bad reviews are spread out. Gotogate-mytrip.com etc etc. Even though my experience was with my trip.com, at the backend the credit card company etc had gotogate. UPDATE: In response to below reply, just a reminder of the timelineS. I booked 30 December, I cancelled 9 Jan. And I‚Äôve been running around ever since to get my money back. Mytrip/Gotogate says through this review that they‚Äôll action by 2 June! Amazing! Once you‚Äôve handed the money over to them, it‚Äôs gone under any technicality they can find. I‚Äôve already covered above the nefarious tactics they use in chargeback dispute.

Review: I had an incredibly frustrating experience with this agency and will never use it again. It feels like I‚Äôve been scammed.  I booked a round-trip flight through this agency involving two different airlines and opted for baggage service (my mistake for not verifying the airlines' baggage charges in advance on their website).  The first airline was fine, even though the baggage fee was ¬£1 higher than booking directly with the airline‚Äîstill tolerable. However, for the return flight, I later discovered (while updating my documents on the airline‚Äôs website) that the ticket already included a 10kg baggage allowance. This meant I unnecessarily paid an additional baggage fee of ¬£74 (37*2).  When I contacted customer service to request a refund for this excess charge, they refused, claiming that the amount was applied as a ‚Äútotal markup fee‚Äù (whatever that means) and was non-refundable. Instead, they simply apologised for the inconvenience. What good are your apologies? I want my money back.  If the airline isn‚Äôt charging for baggage, why did you?  You might argue that I voluntarily selected the baggage option, but isn‚Äôt it your responsibility to align with the airline‚Äôs baggage services when offering these options? I chose your platform as an intermediary, expecting transparency and accuracy‚Äîyet this is how you operate?  I paid you specifically to facilitate the necessary requests to the airline on my behalf. Since the airline provides a complimentary 10kg baggage allowance, shouldn‚Äôt you refund that amount instead of keeping it and dismissing my claim under some vague ‚Äúmarkup fee‚Äù excuse? I paid for baggage, and even the receipt you provided clearly lists baggage under the charges.  Had there been an extra fee at the time of booking, you wouldn‚Äôt have hesitated to charge me. So why is it any different when I‚Äôve overpaid?  This is highly unethical and unprofessional. Stop imposing charges that don‚Äôt belong to you.  To make matters worse, even after paying the baggage fee, the airline‚Äôs system does not guarantee my baggage as cabin luggage. The airline‚Äôs website has an option to confirm cabin baggage, which costs only ¬£6 per bag (still optional), yet your platform charged significantly more. When I asked your representative how long it would take for my baggage status to update, they said there was no specific timeframe. How irresponsible!  You are leaving me no choice but to express my distress on social platforms, escalate this issue with consumer rights authorities, and pursue legal action if necessary.

Review: Extremely Poor Service ‚Äì Never Booking with Gotogate AgainI had one of the worst customer service experiences with Gotogate. On March 4, 2025, I received an email stating that my flight was cancelled, and I was invited to request a refund. I did so immediately and received confirmation that my request was being processed.Two weeks later, I suddenly received another email claiming that the flight was not cancelled, only rescheduled. This contradicts their earlier communication and caused serious confusion and financial loss, as I had already booked a new ticket based on the cancellation notice.I contacted Gotogate via chat multiple times. The support agents were either unwilling or unable to assist me. Several tried to dismiss my concerns, and the chat connection was repeatedly cut off during conversations. I had to explain the situation from the beginning over and over again.Even after a long discussion, they promised the refund would go through, but I still have no confirmation. They blame the airline (Arkia), but as a customer, my contract is with Gotogate.This company shows no responsibility, poor communication, and a complete lack of accountability. I strongly advise others to avoid Gotogate at all costs. I will never book through them again.Update:Gotogate has replied here, but their response was vague and not addressing the actual issue.They keep referring to a schedule change, while I have an official email from them dated March 4 stating that the flight was cancelled.I followed their instructions, requested a refund, and was told it was being processed. Weeks later, still no result, no timeline, and no clear communication ‚Äî just generic messages like ‚Äúwe‚Äôre working on it.‚ÄùEven in their public response, they used a strange reference to ‚Äúlodging needs‚Äù ‚Äî showing once again that my case isn‚Äôt being handled seriously.I‚Äôm still waiting for a proper resolution. For me, never again. There are plenty of companies to choose from.

Review: This company is a scam. Avoid them at all costs!I booked a flight via Booking.com with GoToGate for 30th March, and the payment was successfully deducted from my account. I received a confirmation code and PIN. However, when I checked later, my booking had mysteriously changed to 30th April, and a second unauthorised payment had been taken from my account!At first, I thought I had made a mistake, so I contacted customer service on 16th March. They told me I could change the booking by paying ¬£9.21, which I agreed to. Ten minutes later, I received an email saying, ‚ÄúSorry, we converted the incorrect currency. The actual fee is ¬£45.06.‚Äù Even though I had confirmed the price with the agent three times, they refused to honour their mistake.This wasn‚Äôt the only issue, I had also booked a hotel a day before, and they took two different payments but only confirmed one booking. I had to reclaim the money via my bank. At this point, I started to realise this was not my mistake, it was GoToGate‚Äôs system. Luckily, I had screenshots proving my original flight booking was for 30th March, not April!I called again on 17th March, asking to escalate my complaint. I was told a manager would call me back within 3 hours. No one called.I followed up three days later and was told a supervisor would call back. Again, no call.By 23rd March, I had been waiting a full week. I called again and was told supervisors must respond within 24 hours. When I asked why I hadn‚Äôt received a callback in seven days, they said:‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have a reason, I‚Äôm sorry. You just have to wait.‚ÄùThen, the agent cut my call off saying:‚ÄúI cannot offer you a solution, so I have to cut the phone off.‚ÄùThis is the most disgusting customer service I have ever experienced. They ignored my evidence, took my money without authorisation, refused to follow their own complaints procedure, and when I demanded answers, they cut me off.At every stage, they have shown a complete lack of accountability and only offer empty apologies instead of actual solutions. Instead of fixing their mistake, they expect me to pay more!DO NOT BOOK WITH GOTOGATE! If I do not get a resolution, I will escalate this to consumer protection agencies, my bank, and legal action. I will also be sharing my experience across all social media platforms to warn others!

Review: Beware!!! This agent will try to impose unnecessary charges. The airline cancelled our original direct flight and rebooked us on an flight 5 days after our original return date. We contacted the agent for alternatives who said that they would need to ask the airline for authorisation. After days of waiting, no response, so we contacted the airline. The airline informed us that we were allowed one free change, but as we booked through an agent, we would need to ask the agent to make this change. A response from the agent was finally received a day after our original return date to inform us that the change was not possible. Read the other bad reviews, they are all true. As a previous customer of this agent my hopes were initially high, but after this experience I have learned the hard way to expect no customer service if anything goes wrong. Update: 24/3/25: I was expecting a reply to that effect, clearly it is your standard reply against any negative feedback. You do have the booking code and so fully aware of what truly happened. My only intention of my review was to warn others of your company and obviously expect any compensation from Gotogate. Don't pretend that you care or that it's not the normal level of customer service. Review: I was looking for a ticket that is not too specific in terms of destination or price, but my most important point was the luggage, and more specifically the extra luggage because I needed to carry a lot of stuff.The ticket I found on Gotogate had an option to add an extra luggage for 12000 JPY, which I thought was a great deal, so I took the ticket and all went smoothly.A day later, I receive an email from someone in Gotogate telling me that the extra luggage was cancelled due to a "technical error" and that the amount was refunded and will be sent to my account within a few days, and throwing me at the air carrier asking me to reach out to them to get the extra luggage.Now that's neither professional nor fair the customer.If you have a technical error on your website, then it's your duty to coordinate between the customer and air carrier... additionally the price that was included in the booking (which is a kind of a contract) should be negotiated and only after the customer approves, the move to either cancel it or copay it or other options should be taken.Gotogate just dumped the shit on my head and asked me to accept their apologies and that they were sorry for the inconvenience....I call that a big pile of horse shite!I am stuck with a ticket that I am not finding interesting cuz I don't want to pay a hefty price for the extra luggage, if I knew that there will be a technical problem, I would have chosen another carrier or found alternatives... what am I gonna do with my extra luggage now! Inconvenience is a huge understatement Gotogate!!!Edit: (Reply to GotoGate answer to my comment):If you say so, then why keep the luggage allowance option on your system? We are in 2025 and having a synchronous update from/with the air carrier is an easy thing... why keep the option to add extra luggage there on your booking page if it doesn't work!It's unprofessional and completely misleading people and causing pain and frustration and additional burden and stress!! People are busy with their lives, and services like yours should be solving problems, not creating more of them.

Review: On 12 Jan 2025:  I purchased flights via Booking.com to the value of nearly AUD $2KCustomer reference/ Order number: [redacted]17 Jan 2025:  received an SMS to say that the 2 flights Melbourne (MEL) to Chiang Mai (CNX) had been cancelled. We did not receive an email about the cancellation and the Booking.com web page still shows the incorrect flight details as at 21 March 2025!An alternative was offered in the SMS that did not suit our needs. We never would have booked the flights if the one offered is the one that was presented on the booking site. I contacted Booking.com via the chat to discuss other options. Bookings.com use a third party called GotoGate, all chats and phone calls have been with GotoGate. Note GotoGate is owned by Etraveli Group.GotoGate could not offer any realistic alternatives and they said I could request a refund. 21 Jan 2025:  I requested a refund via the chat. I was informed by GotoGate that they will contact the airline and I would be refunded within 10-15 days. I was informed the amount of this portion of the flight was [redacted] that would be refunded. Since this date up until today 21 March 2025: I have contacted GotoGate numerous times via the chat function (and always requested a copy of the transcript, which may or may not be emailed to you once the chat ends) and also one phone call (which I recorded). In summary they repeat the script that they have requested the refund from the airline and that they are waiting on the airline and they have ‚Äòescalated‚Äô the matter. They cannot offer an explanation of what √©scalate‚Äô means or explain how they are following up. I have spent hours on the phone and chat function trying to follow this up and secure the refund for the flights they cancelled.GotoGate also advises us to check their booking site:  to see the refund status under "My Booking" tab with order number and registered email id. The Order number provided by GotoGate is [redacted] which displays as invalid on their own booking website. The GotoGate person on the phone then said to try this Order number [redacted] which also displays as invalid on their own site. The person on the phone could not explain why it was invalid just said to use those numbers!It was also suggested by GototGate that we follow up directly with Air Asia. So I did. Air Asia requires a booking number or PNR which consists of 6 characters. Gotogate does not provide this information to the customer. AirAsia also say if  you booked thru an agent you need to go thru the agent which is Booking.com.Now, after now reading reviews on the web I have no confidence in Booking.com/ Gotogate/ Etraveli Group ability to deliver any of the flights. I believe Booking.com selling flights (flights that never existed) is a scam as we are still waiting on a refund and have had no communication. Note also the positive reviews on this site are mainly 'invited'.27/3/2025: still waiting for a refund and the same lies and stalling occurring in the chat with conflicting messages. GIVE US OUR MONEY BACK Booking.com/ Gotogate/ Etraveli Group

Review: I booked a flight from Lisbon to London via GTG. I paid extra for checked baggage.Within hours, GTG cancelled our baggage. We did get a refund for the baggage, HOWEVER without baggage, the flight was useless to us.I contacted GTG to see about getting the checked baggage back. They said i could get a refund (less $66pp) or i could contact the airline to arrange baggage or do it at the airport (we all know that last option is super expensive).I said I'd contact the airline. The airline didn't respond to any of my emails.Went back to GTG to get the refund but was told that we were outside the "cancellation period - that was not mentioned in the first contact!I don't feel that the "cancellation period" should apply as the problem was caused by GTG and they will not refund any of our ticket costs. They are hiding behind their T&C's but I feel that the moral obligation rests with GTG to do the right thing and refund us our money.To reiterate: if we'd known the flight didn't allow for baggage, we'd not have booked that flight and GTG is NOT meeting their MORAL obligations!I'll not use GTG again, nor any other 3rd party booking agents.

Review: I was on vacation in Canada when my father died suddenly and unexpectedly. Because of this I needed to immediately fly back to my home country to my family and arrange my father‚Äôs funeral.My father needed to get an autopsy to know the cause of death and that‚Äôs why the funeral happened 4 days later.I had 2 flights booked via GotoGate and as soon as I knew I canceled both flights.Order number: 1008-588-665Order number: 1017-880-769The flights were canceled and the costumer service sent me a link to submit a form to ask for a refund for both flights, and I submitted both forms online on the same day. At this time I didn‚Äôt have the official international death certificate document of my father yet because I only got this document later because of the autopsy.I had to request the document and it took some time. I submitted the other documents requested online through the given link because I knew I only had 5 days to do this after I received the link to submit the official international death certificate document of my father. On the 4th of September I got an e-mail from Kalomoira K second line support Etraveli group, asking me to submit the official international death certificate of my father in English and that this document was required to be signed and stamped by a certified translator. On the same day I sent the official international death certificate document of my father back to Kalomoira K as a response to her e-mail (I have screen shots of the e-mails).On the 9th of September, Olga S second line support Etraveli group sent me an e-mail where she writes that she was unable to process my request with the information provided, and asked me to resubmit the request with a copy of the official international death certificate document of my father, and I answered back to her that I didn‚Äôt have another document and that what I attached on my e-mail on the 4th of September to Kalomoira K was already the only official paid signed and stamped international death certificate document of my father in English and other languages and that there is no other document.I booked 2 flights via Gotogate with the same airline company (WestJet), and got refund for one flight but not the other one. This was 7months ago. I did everything correctly and still they say i didn't submit the right documents, but i did submit the right documents for both flights because the reason of cancellation is the samen.

Review: The company is betting on all flights taking place so they don't have to do any extra work. As soon as your flight is cancelled by an airline - you are screwed, because the ONLY option they are going to offer you is refund. While under EU law the airline must offer the choice of rebook or refund, and the airlines do offer that, gotogate doesn't want to bother with rebooking you so they say "no options for rebook, we can only refund". Needless to add refund doesn't cover the cost of the new tickets. This is an unlawful practice to hide the choice from the customers who maybe don't know that they are legally entitled to have an option of rebooking, and I am surely reporting that to regulatory institutions and involving my legal insurance in the process of getting my new tickets booked as they should be. Update to respond to the reply:Changes are absolutely fine, but the airline ALWAYS offers a possibility of rebook. I also contacted KLM and they confirmed rebook is possible and its free, also for the agency doing it on my behalf. But gotogate refuses to offer this option, insisting on the refund, which I refuse.

Review: I purchased business class flights for my wife and myself via Booking.com on the 27/1/2025. We received the following message on the 28/1/2025 from Gotogate "Due to a technical error, we were unable to complete the purchase of seat for order number XXXX. Please note that your flight tickets are not affected by this error. To complete your request, please book your ancillary product on the airline‚Äôs website. We apologize for the inconvenience."The contact number provided by Booking.com is answered by Gotogate's call centre. On the 28/1/2025 I spoke to Krishan K who verbally confirmed we had business class seats on all legs of the itinerary. I pointed out that it was the ticketing agents legal responsibility to sort this issue out. He emailed with the following request, "As per telephonic conversation, kindly share confirmation regarding flight and contact us so that we can escalate the concern." I replied to this email on the 28/01/2025 providing the requested information, specifically that we had been booked in economy for the final leg.I again spoke with a Gotogate representative on 11/3/202. I shared that I hadn't had a response to my email and that on checking the airlines website, the booking class for the final leg of our itinerary hadn't changed. Sayed M shared that he couldn't see that I had previously contacted Gotogate and was unable to search the reference number provided in the email I had received from Gotogate following my initial telephone call. Sayed M verbally and via email confirmed all legs of the itinerary were booked in business class but that he was unable to confirm the requested seats in business class on the last leg of our itinerary. I requested that this issue be resolved within the next 48 hrs given the length of time since my original contact on the 28/1/2025.As of 20/3/2025 I haven't had a response from Gotogate and on checking the airlines website, the last leg remains booked in economy. When I spoke to the airlines customer service representative, not surprisingly he wasn't able to assist and referred me back to Gotogate. The airline representative shared that there had been a change to the departure time for the first leg of the itinerary which we hadn't been notified of by Gotogate.I rang Gotogate directly (+1 786 405 851) and waited 40 minutes despite the recording continually saying I was first in line and my call would be answered in 30 sec. I spoke to Jia P and she initially stated all seats for all legs of our itinerary were ticketed in business class. I shared that the last leg wasn't and that this was confirmed on both the airlines website and by the airlines representative to whom I spoke. Jia P then stated that the error in ticketing had arisen due to a schedule change. I strongly refuted this claim, pointing out that I had flagged this issue on the 28/1/2025, long before any "schedule change". Jia P then shared that she could see on the airlines website that we were booked in economy on the final leg of our itinerary and that she would escalate my complaint and that I would receive a response within 48 hrs. She also sent an email stating, "As we have already verified, we have already escalated this issue to our dedicated team and they will work on your request. I ask you to wait while our team contact the airline and checks this and gets back to you as soon as possible".I don't anticipate getting resolution from Gotogate to this issue within the next 48hrs given the lack of response to date! UPDATE 21/3/2025As noted below, Gotogate responded on this website and approximately 5 minutes later I received an email from a Gotogate representative, Nitesh M stating "he had tried calling me but was unable to connect". I had no missed calls and no voice messages were left!  Gotogate's response was from an email address that didn't allow me to reply directly to Nitesh M! The instructions were to contact them either by phone or chat.  The chat function had not worked all day and still wasn't working when I tried following receiving Nitesh M's email.  I finally was able to speak to Jasmine M approximately 30 minutes after receiving Nitesh M's email. Her response was that she was unable to assist, "We are sorry to inform you that we are now facing a system issue due to which we could not complete your request. Please contact us after couple of hours to investigate and help you with your request." Jasmine M recommended I send my complaint to privacy.etraveligroup.com.  I continue to be appalled at the customer support provided by Gotogate and their work practices appear to be designed to frustrate customers with the aim that customers will give up trying to have the complaint addressed.  I will not be deterred and will provide further updates

Review: they are the executing partner for booking.com flights. I recently had a deeply unsatisfactory experience trying to change flight dates through Booking.com. I reached out to customer support five separate times‚Äîthree by phone and twice via chat‚Äîto adjust my original flight booking to new dates.Initially, Booking.com quoted drastically inconsistent fees for the change:First chat: ‚Ç¨940 total (unreasonable and more expensive than simply booking new flights).Email follow-up: even higher fees (‚Ç¨564 for TAP Portugal, ‚Ç¨189 for EasyJet, totaling ‚Ç¨753).Later phone call: suddenly reduced to ‚Ç¨470, which I ultimately paid, despite official airline websites clearly showing the fees should total around ‚Ç¨300.Throughout the process, Booking.com's customer service was unprofessional and confusing:Representatives continuously provided different fee amounts without clear explanations.Requests to speak to a manager were repeatedly ignored.Representatives refused to provide a detailed breakdown of charges when asked, claiming they had already given all necessary information.Directions on how to file an official complaint were vague and unhelpful.After finally paying, the confusion continued. My reference number was not recognized, requiring yet another lengthy call with customer service. Even after this call, I discovered that only the departing flight had been changed‚Äînot the return flight. Upon contacting support again, I was told it would take several more hours to confirm this remaining change, further adding to the frustration and lack of transparency.Overall, this experience was extremely disappointing, unprofessional, and unnecessarily costly. I strongly discourage booking flights through Booking.com, as their handling of changes and customer support is unreliable and misleading.Edit: they mentioned that I "failed to add a reference code in the private part of this review". FYI, this is not possible to do.

Review: They are totally irresponsible with the order they made for me. Truly, they seem to just care about me buying flight tickets from them, and that they don't bother helping with any further matter. First, the airline (Malaysia Airlines/MAS, but the flight is managed by Air Canada) cancelled my outgoing trip and as a result they (gotogate) proposed an alternative trip more than 24 hours after the cancelled trip, despite being able to offer an alternative flight on the same day from their website. Of course they proposed to cancel the whole flight (outbound & return), but it was less than 2 weeks before the trip, everything is just too expensive to buy a new one. When I requested gotogate to only refund that part of the trip, gotogate wasn't able to get the airline to change the system, stating that it was all booked under one booking code (I don't know what they mean).Then I also requested to be moved to the nearest available flight from that airline, gotogate wasn't able to do it either citing that they have not received any reply from the airline. I tried calling the airline, they were able to change it, but citing that since I am not their customer, I should get gotogate to request the change first. The airline agent told me that I am not recommended to skip one part of the flight because that can invalidate the whole booking. This means that I have no choice to accept the alternative flight.After multiple calls and messages with gotogate, I am less than 48 hours before the trip, by which, they happily send me an email telling me that I am now allowed to contact the airline by myself and the get the change. I did call Air Canada, and it was done in less than 10 minutes.Good, now what I didn't realise is that the system is so screwed up, they managed to leave my booking on a wrong state in the system that when I tried to check in for return flight. I was told that the airline (Jetstar Airways, managed the first leg of the return trip) couldn't check me in, despite my name being in the system. I called AirCanada, and they claimed that it is goto gate, and when I called gotogate, they claimed that it is not their fault.As a result, I was forced to buy a expensive one-way ticket on the spot, in order to be able to take the next leg of the flight from Singapore. Nobody wants to take the blame. It is really a horrible experience with gotogate, there's no sympathy from them. I told them that they are selling me a ticket that cannot be used, and they told me that it is not their fault. Well, if you feel responsible as a merchant, then you should at least try to help me refund the part of the flight that I wasn't able to take just because someone that you contracted with couldn't get the system right.Truly horrible, I would leave gotogate MINUS 5 stars if I can. I don't recommend this agent even though you think you can get a good deal. If it is too cheap, then it's possible that they will rearrange your flight closer to the date, and you have no choice to accept a horrible alternative or "just cancel your flight" (mind you, it's 2 weeks before the departure).Terrible experience.Good luck with this agent.

Review: I booked a flight from Manila to El Nido with Gotogate for November 17th, 2024 (Booking number: 1023-250-074), but it was canceled due to a typhoon by the airline. Since then, I have been fighting to get my refund, but it has been a complete nightmare.I have contacted Gotogate four times to resolve the issue. The first two times, customer service promised to look into the problem because they couldn‚Äôt see the cancellation in their system. Instead of investigating properly, I received misleading emails claiming that I requested to cancel the booking myself (December 7th, 2024) or stating that there were no schedule changes associated with my booking (January 21st, 2025). This is completely false ‚Äî the flight was canceled by the airline on the day of travel!In February, I finally managed to get a response from the airline (AirSwift), confirming that they had already refunded the amount to Gotogate on February 1st, 2025, and that Gotogate was responsible for returning the money to me. I also found a Gotogate customer service email and contacted them directly on February 13th, 2025 ‚Äî no response to this day.One month later, I called Gotogate again and was finally transferred to a department that seemed to understand the problem. They promised to investigate and coordinate with the airline. Yet today (March 15th, 2025), I received an email claiming that they couldn‚Äôt access my booking on some ‚Äúwebsite‚Äù and that I should contact the airline myself. What kind of nonsense is this? Why would they be browsing the airline‚Äôs website looking for a cancellation from four months ago instead of directly contacting their business partner?If Gotogate insists on searching websites instead of calling the airline, they can easily find the cancellation notice on AirSwift‚Äôs official Facebook page. The post from November 16th, 2024, clearly lists the canceled flights due to the typhoon ‚Äî including mine!Gotogate is clearly deliberately making the process as difficult as possible, hoping that customers will give up on their refund claims. Review: Over 3 months ago, I booked flights from London to Japan through Gotogate (via Booking.com). The deal seemed great at the time, and I trusted the platform to handle such a long-haul booking. However, just a few weeks before my trip, I was informed that the second leg of my return flight had been cancelled.Instead of offering me an alternative flight, Booking.com redirected me to the associated platform, Gotogate, who simply told me my only option was to cancel and get a refund. This is completely unacceptable, especially since rebooking now would cost me nearly ¬£2,000, far more than my original ticket.What‚Äôs worse? I did my own research and found multiple alternative routes on Booking.com (via Gotogate) with the same airline that could get me home. But they made no effort to rebook me. They just want to wash their hands of the issue.A trustworthy travel agent should help customers find solutions, not just push them toward a refund that leaves them stranded with no reasonable replacement. If you‚Äôre considering booking through Gotogate via Booking.com, think twice. Because if something goes wrong, you‚Äôll be on your own.---My answer to their reply (below):Thank you for your response, but it misses the point entirely.The issue isn‚Äôt just that the airline made changes. It‚Äôs the fact that your service offered zero helpful solutions. When I contacted the airline directly, they were able to accommodate me on an alternative flight‚Äîsomething Gotogate didn‚Äôt even suggest or assist with.This begs the question: What exactly is the purpose of booking through an agency like Gotogate if, when something goes wrong, I‚Äôm left to sort it out on my own? Your role should be to advocate for and assist your customers, not simply pass on bad news and leave them stranded.This experience has made it very clear to me (and anyone reading this) that booking through Gotogate adds unnecessary complication without any real support when things go wrong. Extremely disappointing.

Review: If you value your time, money, and sanity, **NEVER** book a flight through GotoGate. This company is nothing more than a scam operation hiding behind fake positive reviews. They lure you in with seemingly cheap prices, but in reality, you‚Äôll end up paying FAR MORE than booking directly with the airline‚Äîand I learned this the hard way.  I booked a multi-flight from **Osaka to Istanbul** through these fraudsters, only to find myself stranded in **Dubai airport, out of pocket for extra costs, and stuck in a never-ending nightmare with their utterly useless customer service.**  #### **Deceptive Booking & "Guaranteed" Connection ‚Äì A Total LIE!**  GotoGate sold me an itinerary with an **impossible** connection time in Dubai‚Äî**1 hour and 30 minutes** to change terminals, exit the terminal, collect luggage, check in, go through security, and board a new flight. **IMPOSSIBLE!**  What they **failed** to mention was that my connecting flights were in **different terminals**, requiring **shuttle buses that take nearly an hour**. When my first flight landed slightly late, I had no chance of making the connection. By the time I arrived at the gate, the flight had ALREADY TAKEN OFF!  When I spoke to Dubai airport staff, they outright told me that **selling flight connections under 2 hours in Dubai is ILLEGAL.** This means **GotoGate is knowingly selling ILLEGAL and IMPOSSIBLE connections to unsuspecting travelers!**  #### **Customer Service? More Like a Robot Zoo!**  After missing my flight, I immediately contacted GotoGate‚Äôs so-called ‚Äúsupport team‚Äù (if you can even call it that). What followed was **a masterclass in incompetence, deception, and total disregard for customers.**  - I called **15+ times**, being **lied to over and over again** by different agents.  - Some guy named **Abdul** promised me a flight for 8:30 AM and that I‚Äôd get a confirmation within 1-2 hours. **LIE!** I stayed awake waiting for this confirmation‚Äî**it never came.**  - The next morning, a woman named **RTI** told me they were booking me a 1:30 PM flight and that I‚Äôd receive the ticket soon. **ANOTHER LIE!** I showed up at the airport‚Äî**no ticket, no booking, NOTHING.**  - The call center is outsourced to **India**, and the agents are **trained to sound like robots**, constantly repeating fake empathy scripts:    - *"I understand your frustration."*    - *"I'm sorry for the inconvenience."*    - *"Let me check with the concerned department."*    **STOP LYING AND DO YOUR JOB!**  Their agents have **zero power**, zero knowledge, and **zero intention of solving your problem**. They just keep you on the phone wasting your time while draining your phone credit. **My phone bill is now more expensive than the damn flight!**  #### **Extra Costs ‚Äì You‚Äôll Pay FAR MORE Than Expected**  Because of **GotoGate's scam tactics**, I ended up:  - Paying for **a hotel** in Dubai that I never planned for.  - Paying for **taxis** back and forth from the airport.  - Spending HOURS fighting with useless customer service.  - Losing **hundreds of euros** trying to rebook a flight.  What was supposed to be a **"cheap" ticket turned into the most EXPENSIVE and STRESSFUL travel experience of my life.**  #### **Final Warning ‚Äì GotoGate Will RUIN Your Trip!**  GotoGate is not just bad‚Äîit is **a criminal operation** that should be shut down. Their business model is based on deception, false guarantees, and zero accountability.  - **They sell impossible itineraries.**  - **They lie about rebooking you.**  - **Their customer support is USELESS.**  - **You WILL end up spending MORE money in the end.**  This company is **a disgrace to the travel industry**, and I **WILL TAKE THEM TO COURT** for their fraudulent business practices. I have already gathered all the necessary evidence, and I **WILL NOT STOP until this company is held accountable.**  **Save yourself the headache‚ÄîBOOK DIRECTLY WITH THE AIRLINE!**

Review: Booked a fight on Aerlingus in Jan 2025 which was canceled due to weather in Dublin (our mid stop on the way to Boston from Rome).  We had to book another flight in order to return home.  Called G2G as soon as we got back from the trip.  They told me the refund might take a couple weeks.  Then sent me an email with this statement:---------------------------------------------------Important Information:- Add-ons such as travel insurance may not be refundable.- The average handling time for refunds, after receiving funds from the airline, is 6 days.- While most airlines process refunds in under 5 business days, the entire process may take 10-15 business days from the time of cancellation until we process the payout.---------------------------------------------Well that statement is clearly false.  I've called a number of times and received assurances that the refund process was underway, without any details about the specific status.  It is now March 3.  I called today, explained my situation, and have been on hold for about an hour and a half so far.  It is clear they are either understaffed or do not want to talk to me.  It sure seems as though these folks are scamming their customers. Update: March 4, 2025Phoned GotoGate today and had my call dropped three ties. In the final call, I was put on hold for over three hours.  While on hold I called G2G on a separate phone and reached Ivan.  He seemed to be doing everything possible to help resolve my issue.  He is clearly an exemplary employee.  However, due to some sort of snafu with Aerlingus, an upfront payment of $200 was claimed to be required to free up my rebate.  Of course I was skeptical and demanded a letter from G2G detailing the charges purpose in an invoice, which I did receive.  I submitted payment, with trepidation.  We‚Äôll see.Hmmm.  It‚Äôs March 18, 2025.  Funny, I guess, still no refund.  Though I did get a ‚Äòno-reply‚Äô email from AerLingus saying they were working on it.  Are they?  The case seems clear to me; they cancelled the flight but do not want to refund the money.  What‚Äôs the delay?April 1, 2025: three emails promising a refund.  So far, just promises. April 6, 2025: So, the $200 went to a company called LOOKMYFLIGHT.  They sent me an email saying my refund was processed and would be refunded to my credit card.  That still hasn't happened.

Review: Disastrous handling of flight delays and cancellations. The call center professionals are kind, but the process is incredibly inefficient and time-consuming. The most "fun" part of the trip was when an airline cancelled one leg of my two-flight journey. I managed to reach the layover airport independently with another flight and informed Gotogate to reimburse me for the first flight but of course not the second. However, upon arrival, I discovered that Gotogate had cancelled both flights reservations, leaving me stranded.I contacted their support team, and the agent in the chat said the issue would be reviewed within 48 hours‚Äîthough I had to leave in four. He was not particularly useful. Thankfully, I called another agent, who initially almost made a serious mistake due to carelessness but ultimately managed to restore my booking, allowing me to take the flights.In short, I believe Gotogate should:1. Make better use of AI to ensure calls are directed to the appropriate personnel, avoiding unnecessary transfers between departments.2. Allow clients to make changes to their bookings instead of always having to contact the call centre.3. Ensure teams communicate effectively, as they hardly ever read previous conversations.All in all, it was a disastrously mismanaged experience.

Review: ***UPDATE:I did in fact stay in touch with them to see if they would finally sort my reimbursement out. No such luck. I received an email saying I was not eligible for the claim, even though they specifically say I bought the service through them. Now I have to hope the airline does something about it (again), but to be honest, it all seems like a long shot. You can't reply to that last email from GoToGate, because for them, the case is closed and that's it. So there you go. Unacceptable.I find it incredible that they can sell a service they're clearly not in a position to provide and then simply refuse to reimburse you for it. That surely qualifies as a scam, doesn't it?Anyway, like my tag line here says: AVOID!------------AVOID.In October last year I bought tickets through them to fly to Mexico in January. I paid to reserve a window seat with extra leg room, which was ¬£100 each way.When it was time to fly out, it turns out the seat I had reserved almost three months before was not respected, and I was assigned a middle seat without the extra leg room. I complained, of course, but with the flight full, the airline didn't do anything. From here, there are two main issues:1- I first tried to get a refund from the airline, which was not doable in the end because I bought the ticket through this third-party provider. But what I discovered is that the airline charged ¬£75 for the seat, not ¬£100, so GoToGate had charged an extra ¬£25 for the seat that the airline would not have been able to refund even if I had been able to do it through them. When you book the seats with GoToGate, it does NOT itemise that the cost is also from them, or how much is charged by each party. I had to go through many hoops to even get in touch with their customer service and find this out, and when I finally managed, the girl in the chat was quite rude and they didn't even provide me with an itemised bill for what I had paid for the tickets and seats so I could discuss it further with the airline (at that point, I was still hoping the airline would sort it out).2- Once the airline made it clear they could not sort it out because it was bought externally, I tried contacting GoToGate again, which this time I ended up doing over the phone, as the chat option was not available. I was told that the seat reservations are non-refundable. I obviously made a fuss, because paying for the seats is not mandatory, and if you're paying for a service they're not providing, they should refund you. There was a lot of back and forth there, and they now "might" look into my case, for which I have to fill out a form and send out who knows how much supporting evidence and simply hope for a good outcome.I've learned my lesson, though. Book directly through the airlines. Always. And avoid GoToGate. Always.

Review: This company is a scam. I booked flights from Athens to Istanbul on 2 June, only to find the confirmation came back as 27/5. When I contacted them they help desk to fix this they said I could change the date for $77 AUD. They flights cost 230 so thought ok, maybe I made a mistake. Transferred the money. Received confirmation email, flights still on 27/5. Was told they would update in an hour and I‚Äôd get an email. Got an email confirmation saying id need to pay a further $277 if I wanted to change the flights. So now I am thinking scam. Called them they help support desk. Booking.com is actually Gotogate. Apparently based in Stockholm. They tell me the flights have gone up so I need to pay the extra. I look on Pegasus who the flights are through. Flight is available for 58 euro. I tell the support person I am not will to give them a cent more and ask to escalate to the manager . He tries the same excuse. I demand my money is refunded for the extra and the flight changed. While he is writing an email saying he will do that I lookAt reviews on gotogate and find lots of the same stories so I demand a full refund and put in a dispute resolution through PayPal. He continues to say he can‚Äôt make a decision. So after lots of discussion I leave the call only with 2 emails saying the 77 will be refunded and the rest looked into. Do not book with this company or booking.com. This is üíØ a scam. I am convinced now they messed up the initial booking just to get me back and get more money from me, and then tried this again. Do not give them your money

Review: I used Go-Gate (via Booking.com) to book a flight from Europe to Africa. I made a change on my original booking (where i paid a change fee) and this is where the nightmare began. The night before my departure i found it strange that I couldnt check in. I then contacted Go-Gate only to be told that i must pay another ¬£800 to travel (not forgetting i had already been issued new tickets and paid a change fee)- which was strange as they issued me a new ticket and took payment for the change originally. After phoning close to 7 times and being told a supervisor will call me back with my family waiting at the airport - no one ever did. I spent hours on hold and calling back and I was told the issue was escalated, but no one ever contacted me back, despite multiple promises (and all calls are recorded to prove this). I must have been on hold to their call centre for hours and the customer service was very poor. Eventually i was told that it was Go-Gates error (recorded call) and a refund will be issued. Its been over 2 weeks now, and i am yet to receive a refund. In fact all i see on their website is that "the airline is determining the refund". To be clear this is not the airline's fault but Go Gates fault and i am expecting a full refund of my original ticket and my change fee - and any refund for me has nothing to do with the airline's policy as this was GoGates mistake. The customer service was poor to begin with, i have been waiting weeks for a refund - do you call that customer service? Horrible experience and as someone in customer service myself a case study of how not to engage customers that i will use.What was funny was GoGate said they cancelled the tickets, but i still got "CheckIn notifications" so after firstly not changing my ticket, they probably never cancelled the cancellation - craziest mess i have ever seen. I am expecting a full refund along with my change fee - let‚Äôs see if this at least can be done properly before they lose a customer.Update 19 March: it‚Äôs been over 6 weeks now, no refund, no communication, despite confirmation they would get back to me I have heard nothing

Review: Disappointing Experience with Booking.com, Emirates, and GotogateI recently encountered a major issue with my family‚Äôs flight booking (Reservation Code: ETPKV2, booked on January 15, 2025) that resulted in significant financial loss and emotional distress. During online check-in on January 19, 2025, I discovered our surname was mistakenly entered as ‚ÄúOezcam‚Äù instead of ‚Äú√ñz√ßam.‚Äù Despite multiple calls to both Emirates and Gotogate, each company blamed the other, and no corrective action was taken. Consequently, we were marked as ‚Äúno show,‚Äù and I was forced to repurchase tickets at an extra cost of approximately $6,300.I‚Äôm sharing this experience as a caution to all travelers: always double-check your booking details and be prepared for the possibility of poor customer support. Review: I booked flights through Booking.com, completely unaware that the actual agent handling my booking was GoToGate. The airline later made significant changes to my flights, switching them from direct to non-direct. As a result, I received an official email from the airline stating that I was entitled to a full refund. However, since I had booked through an agent, I was required to go through them to process it.That‚Äôs when the nightmare began.I first contacted Booking.com over a week ago, and I have since had multiple calls and chats, yet I am still no closer to getting any confirmation about my refund. Every call is met with vague, useless responses, and absolutely no progress is made.On one call, they had the audacity to instruct me to contact the airline because‚Äîaccording to them‚Äîthere was a ‚Äútechnical issue‚Äù between their system and the airline‚Äôs, preventing them from handling my refund. Of course, when I called the airline, they confirmed this was complete nonsense. The problem isn‚Äôt with the airline‚Äîit‚Äôs with Booking.com and GoToGate.I‚Äôve even followed up multiple times, and still, no confirmation of if or when I‚Äôll actually see my refund. At this point, it is blatantly obvious that they are deliberately stalling and avoiding their responsibility. The airline has already confirmed my entitlement to a full refund‚ÄîBooking.com (via GoToGate) simply refuses to process it.This is beyond incompetence‚Äîit‚Äôs outright unethical. Do yourself a favor and stay far away from these scam artists. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Review: I have been a loyal customer of gotogate.com for more than 5 years. I trust they will keep me inform in case of flight cancelation but never encounter any cancellation until my recent experience. Below is my chronology of event on 7th Feb 2025...7.50pm 7.2.2025 We connect to Tap Airline Flight TP87 Lisbon to Sao Paulo from Milan and upon arrival to Lisbon, we noticed on the screen this connecting flight TP87 is cancelled. Horrified and not knowing what to do, i and my son scheme the entire Lisbon airport to know what we supposed to do as we have a connecting flight at Sao Paulo airport to Santiago. No whatsapp nor emails from gotogate thus far.. We finally understood that we have to get out to the main terminal and search for Tap Airline counter for cancelation. Tap Airline ground staff rerouted our flight to Rio De Janeiro departing almost the same date and time as Sao Paulo. Due to this rerouting all the flights paid for Sao Paulo to Santiago is burned. We have to pay new flights connecting to Santiago from Rio De Janeiro. Tired, defeated and hungry, myself and my son have no choice but to relent our disappointment of gotogate as the Travel Agent we have trusted more than 5 years. Not only the enormous amount of money burned (original flight and buying new tickets) but in this case not a single email nor whatsapp from gotogate in regards to this flight cancelation. In fact they sent us a email linking us to Airhelp.com to get compensation...lol. Do not expect any assistance from gotogate as they just sell you metro/bus tickets and full stop!Have a heart gotogate, loyal customer is hard to come by these days...

Review: √ñI am writing to express my profound dissatisfaction with the service I received from Gotogate.co.uk. My experience has been nothing short of frustrating and disappointing.1. Lack of Support: When I encountered issues with my booking, I reached out for assistance, only to be met with unhelpful responses and long wait times. The customer service representatives seemed poorly trained and unable to provide any real solutions.2. Refund Issues: After facing unexpected circumstances that led to the cancellation of my flight, I was promised a refund. However, weeks have passed without any updates or the refund itself. The lack of communication has left me feeling abandoned and frustrated.3. Confusing Processes: The website is not user-friendly, making it difficult to find essential information regarding my booking and the refund process. This added to my stress during an already challenging time.4. Overall Experience: I had high hopes when I booked my travel through Gotogate, but the reality has been far from satisfactory. I would not recommend this service to anyone seeking reliable and supportive travel assistance.In conclusion, my experience with Gotogate.co.uk has been extremely disappointing, and I urge others to think twice before using their services. Save yourself the hassle and choose a more reputable travel agency.
