Review: Im not one to write reviews but the service i have received from gotogate over the last 8 months has been nothing but a disgrace. My flight was cancelled back in June 2024 to which I was informed id be refunded the fare so i could rebook another flight. Fast forward to February 21st 2025 (8 months later) & I have still yet to receive my refund. Over 25 phone calls between this company as well as countless live chats and still no refund. Each time i am told the same thing from the agent and do not seem to progress forward. The agents do not listen and just simply apologise for the inconvenience caused as opposed to creating a solution. When you asked to speak to a manager, they say it is not possible and promised that a manager will call back within 24 hours. just another one of their lies as no manager has ever tried to contact me.I will not be using this 3rd party company again as all it has been is grief and stress throughout and I shall ensure all of my family and friends do not use this company as I do not want them to go through the same rubbish I have with them.

Review: I booked a flight to India with Go To Gate. Unfortunately I was notified that the airline (KLM) had resceduled my flight.  Only after speaking directly to the airline did I find out it wasn't just a time reschedule it was actually a day later which GTG had failed to inform me, otherwise i would have responded sooner.  I ended up cancelling the first stage of my flight as this wasn't going to be suitable.  I opted to book the flight direct with an alternative airline and paid for this.  I have now been waiting 9 weeks for my refund and despite KLM confirming they have processed this, GTG still won't give me my refund saying the airline haven't paid them back yet. I have sent numerous emails and made a dozen phone calls and still cannot get my money back. This is a huge waste of my time as far as I'm concerned and ridiculous having to wait this long. They are quick to take the payment but when something happens they are not happy to refund so quickly.  I am very disappointed and would seriously doubt that I would ever book with them again.

Review: Updated Review Title: Terrible Experience ‚Äì Partial Tax ‚ÄúRefund‚Äù for Airline-Cancelled FlightI recently received a reply from GoToGate regarding my airline-cancelled flight. Their response claimed that the airline ‚Äúonly authorized a refund of the tax amount,‚Äù rather than the full fare. This is either complete nonsense or outright illegal. When an airline cancels a flight, EU Regulation 261/2004 clearly states travelers are entitled to a full refund, not just a reimbursement of taxes.Moreover, if the flight never happened, it‚Äôs puzzling how they justify refunding only ‚Äútaxes.‚Äù The entire amount should be returned‚Äîafter all, if the plane was canceled, what taxes are there to pay?This handling reinforces my view that GoToGate‚Äôs customer service and refund processes are both inadequate and potentially in violation of EU regulations. I‚Äôm continuing legal action to recover my full payment, but in the meantime, I strongly advise anyone considering GoToGate to look elsewhere. This experience has been a costly lesson I hope others can avoid.I Title: Terrible Experience - No Refund for Airline-Cancelled Flight a truly frustrating experience‚Ä¶I had a truly frustrating experience with GoToGate, and I feel compelled to warn other travelers. I booked a flight through GoToGate, and the airline canceled the flight ‚Äì not me. Under EU Regulation 261/2004, I am entitled to a full refund because the airline initiated the cancellation. However, GoToGate refused to provide the refund, claiming that my ticket was non-refundable.I‚Äôve been waiting for over a month, and despite numerous emails and attempts to contact them, I still haven't received my money back. Their customer service is unhelpful, sending generic responses and demanding consent to process my data before even addressing my issue. They also make it extremely difficult to reach a real person, with phone lines and chat options limited by location.To make matters worse, they claim they can only refund taxes, not the full amount ‚Äì which is completely against EU regulations for airline-initiated cancellations. This is unacceptable and feels like a scam.I urge others to avoid using GoToGate at all costs. If something goes wrong with your flight, don‚Äôt expect any support or a fair resolution. I will never use this company again, and I am now pursuing legal action to get my money back.

Review: I made the mistake of booking flights through booking.com. The flight element is powered by Go To Gate which I was not aware of at the time of booking. The integration does not work properly. When I booked I  was aware that I might need to add additional luggage etc, but assumed that I could do that at check in, direct with the airline. My booking on booking.com showed no luggage on the way out, and cabin bags on the way in - which was a little confusing, but anyway no problem, I logged into the airlines system, however it directed me back to booking.com, where I eventually found a phone number which is actually the phone number for Go To Gate. From there it just go worse and worse - it tuned out that what I could see on the screen on my booking.com account did not match with the information that Go To Gate had - one the way out I had no luggage, on the way back I had 2 x hold luggage and 2 x cabin bag per person! They tried to tell me that's what I had booked - who would book that?? To solve the issue I asked them to add cabin bags on the way out, and was prepared to pay. The phone payment appeared to be a scam to my bank so they held the payment. I was then sent a link to Go To Gate, with the luggage selected, although the person on the phone could not tell me exactly what luggage it was - just that it was 3 bags. I completed the payment. Once the phone call terminated, I was then able to explore the go to gate link in more detail - it turned out that I could have selected the cabin bags that I wanted, for less money than I paid, what I actually was sold was hold luggage. I have since complained to Go To Gate and asked them to amend the booking, they just sent standard 'we are looking into it' responses but haven't actually done anything, and appear to have no intention of doing anything given that its nearly time for the flight. I have managed to check in direct with the airline, and everything on that side seems to be OK, but I feel Id have been better off just booking direct with the airline or with other flight providers who do have working integrations with the airlines and their own platforms. My advice would be go elsewhere....... Thank you for your reply on trust pilot‚Ä¶.. if you were capable of offering the service you claim ‚ÄòI deserve‚Äô then you would not have sent 3 identical, clearly automated, replies to my emails chasing for help since you ripped me off‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Review: I booked flights through Gotogate and had an incredibly frustrating experience due to their serious booking errors and complete lack of customer support.My travel companion, was initially booked on the correct flights but in economy instead of premium economy, which we had paid for. When I contacted Gotogate to fix this, their agent eventually rebooked her, BUT on the wrong flights‚Äîboth outbound and return! This was a long-haul journey from Paris to Bangkok, making the mistake even more unacceptable.I immediately contacted Gotogate for help, but they were completely unresponsive. With our flight just one day away, I had no choice but to call Air France directly and pay ¬£289 out of pocket to correct Gotogate‚Äôs mistake.Gotogate caused this issue, yet they refuse to respond to my compensation request. I have submitted multiple complaints, but they ignore emails and offer zero customer support once they have your money.I paid ¬£1,940.99 in total for this trip, only to be left stranded fixing their errors. Avoid Gotogate at all costs! Review: I purchased plane tickets from the Booking.com portal, but it appears that Booking.com acts as a payment platform in this case, and the tickets were actually sold by Gotogate. The tickets were for my and my wife's trip to Vietnam with a connection in China in November last year. Unfortunately, the airline cancelled second flight (from China to Vietnam). I received confirmation from the airline stating that all unused flights are refundable due to the cancellation, but the refund must be requested via the travel agent who sold me the tickets.I requested a refund from Gotogate in November and received a confirmation email that the flights were entitled to a refund and that the refund would be provided within the next few weeks. However, three months later, I am still waiting. I have been on the chat with Gotogate support multiple times during these three months, and every time I am advised to wait another few weeks.Furthermore, I spoke with the airline, and they informed me they cannot see the refund request from Gotogate, and Gotogate support refuses to contact the airline to check why. While Gotogate might offer good prices, if something goes wrong, it is very unlikely you will get any support. I am extremely disappointed with their service and I will not be using Gotogate again in the future if this is not resolved ASAP.

They promised the refund in 15 days, yet once this date passed and I called them, I was told that they could not tell me when I would receive the refund and that they had not even contacted the airline to request a refund. As such I contacted the airline myself and the refund was issued to me via Go to Gate on the 11th February. Go to Gate were absolutely useless and had I not taken the initiative to contact Vueling myself, I have no idea if I ever would have received the refund, from other reviews I have read of people waiting years for a refund, I doubt I would have. Review: I recently had a horrible and fraudulent experience with Gotogate while trying to rebook my flight from Paris to Mauritius due to a family emergency. My original flight was on February 20, 2025, but I needed to change it to either February 17 or 18. Initially, I wanted to rebook directly through Air Mauritius, but when I contacted their Helpdesk, I was told that since I had booked through Gotogate, only Gotogate could handle the rebooking, and Air Mauritius was unable to assist me. This was the only reason I had to go through Gotogate in the first place, which turned out to be a huge mistake.When I checked Gotogate‚Äôs website, I saw that I could rebook for ¬£370 on February 18 at 18:10, but when I asked the agent, he refused to let me book it, claiming it was not available for rebooking. However, I could see that the exact same flight was available for rebooking on Air Mauritius‚Äô website, proving that the agent was lying. I believe that he did not let me book it as I had seen that the re-booking should cost ¬£370, and hence he would not be able to scam me. Instead, he found another option for February 17 and tried to charge me ¬£700, even though I later found out that the same flight was listed on Air Mauritius‚Äô website for ‚Ç¨489 (~¬£400).Adding to the scam, the airline's fare rules stated that changes for my flight (MK14) should cost ¬£166, yet the agent could not explain why they were charging me ¬£700. When I repeatedly asked for a breakdown of the costs and official documentation, he kept dodging my questions and instead repeated the same scripted responses without providing any valid justification. He initially said their service fee was ¬£35, yet suddenly, the total amount became ¬£700 without a clear explanation. At one point, he even quoted ‚Ç¨714, then switched it to GBP, clearly trying to manipulate the currency for extra profit. His behavior became unprofessional and condescending, as he took ages to respond, yet when I demanded clarification, he pressured me to make a decision within 3 minutes, claiming the chat was taking too long‚Äîeven though I had to wait 15+ minutes for each of his replies. His tone was sarcastic and dismissive, even addressing me in a belittling way: ‚ÄúI will repeat it once again for you, Ishika,‚Äù when all I was asking for was basic transparency on the price.After a two-hour back-and-forth, where I refused to pay without official documentation, the agent still refused to provide any proof of the charges. He abruptly ended the chat. The next day, when I tried to log in to my Gotogate account, I found that it had been blocked, likely in an attempt to erase evidence of the chat so that I couldn‚Äôt use it for complaints or legal action. However, they failed to cover their tracks because I took screenshots of the entire chat yesterday. I also have a picture of the exact same flight Gotogate tried to charge me ¬£700 for, clearly listed at ¬£400 on Air Mauritius‚Äô official website, proving that they were trying to scam me out of ¬£300. They lied about availability, inflated the price for their own profit, manipulated currency conversions, and refused to provide receipts or price breakdowns. Their rude and aggressive tactics, refusal to provide transparency, and deliberate attempt to erase evidence make them an extremely shady company. I will be taking action against them and reporting them to the relevant authorities. I strongly urge everyone to avoid Gotogate and always book directly with the airline to avoid being scammed.

Review: Terrible Customer Service and Endless Refund DelaysI‚Äôm not the type to leave bad reviews, but after my experience with Gotogate/Booking.com, I feel responsible for warning others. If you ever end up in a similar situation, be prepared for a nightmare.My flight was changed multiple times (not Gotogate‚Äôs fault), so I contacted them to find an alternative. They couldn‚Äôt provide one, which I completely understand. However, they explicitly told me that I could cancel my ticket and receive a full refund. Based on this assurance, I purchased a new ticket for ¬£500 on top of the original ¬£800 I had already spent, thinking I‚Äôd get my money back.A few days later, I received an email stating that I wasn‚Äôt entitled to a full refund, and that‚Äôs when the chaos started. It has now been over a month, and I‚Äôve been stuck in an endless loop of phone calls and emails with different agents giving me conflicting information, different refund amounts, and countless excuses. They keep postponing the process or refusing to clarify if I‚Äôll actually get my full refund.For such a large company, a refund should not take this long, especially when they were the ones who misled me in the first place. Because of this, I ended up spending way more money than planned‚Äîpaying for a new flight, hotel, and additional travel expenses. I‚Äôve spoken to four different agents just this week, and I still have no clear answer on when (or if) I‚Äôll see my refund.At this point, I‚Äôm joking that I‚Äôll probably receive it after getting married and having three kids! But seriously, this whole ordeal has been stressful, time-consuming, and costly.My advice?Book directly with the airline and avoid third-party services like Gotogate/Booking.com. As for me, I‚Äôll keep calling and emailing until I get my money back.

There was an easy solution available with a Thai flight Osaka to Bangkok to connect with my existing Bangkoknto London booking. However, Gotogate refused to do anything except book the same route 1 day later or cancel and refund. They referred me to Thai Airways. Review: For the past twenty years, I have primarily purchased airline tickets through Expedia.com or directly from major airlines. With so many online ticket sellers, it‚Äôs hard to know which ones are trustworthy. Initially, I was hesitant to use Gotogate due to some negative Google reviews, but my experience turned out to be exceptional.In November of last year, I booked an international ticket for my wife and me. Unfortunately, in January, my wife had to cancel her trip due to her mother‚Äôs declining health. Since the ticket was non-refundable, I reached out to Gotogate.com, hoping for a possible solution.From the customer service representative to their manager, everyone I interacted with was incredibly understanding and professional. While Gotogate cannot make final decisions regarding refunds, they acted as a dedicated middle service provider. They immediately reached out to Cathay Pacific Airways on my behalf and worked diligently to find a resolution. Within just a few days, they secured a very reasonable and satisfactory outcome. I was particularly impressed that Gotogate waived their service fees and handled all communications seamlessly.Their excellent communication skills and commitment to customer service truly stood out. Because of this positive experience, I am giving Gotogate.com the highest rating on Google Reviews. They proved to be a reliable and professional service provider, and I highly recommend them!

Review: I booked a Manila to Singapore flight with Philippine Airlines through Gotogate for ¬£143 (booking number 1045-907-145) including their so-called FlexiTicket, which supposedly allows easy flight changes for just the fare difference. When I requested to change my flight from 19th February to 24th February, I was quoted an outrageous ¬£131 fare difference per person. At first, I thought, maybe it's a peak season price, but after checking myself on Gotogate‚Äôs own website, I found the flight was half that price. They were deliberately inflating the cost and scamming me out of extra money.To make matters worse, I checked the flight price multiple times that day and even after they quoted me the double-inflated price, and it was STILL showing half the cost.......even on their own website! In reality, the flight was around ¬£55 per person, yet they tried to charge me nearly ¬£300 in total for two flights that should have cost just ¬£110! (the original FlexiTicket price plus the real cost of the new flight).Gotogate Lied & Refused to Change My FlightAfter three separate live chat conversations, they kept delaying, saying my request needed to be "escalated" to another team. 72 hours later, still no response, yet they are quick enough to reply in TrustPilot for a negative review.Today, when I checked again, I saw the flight was still available on their website, yet they told me on live chat that no flights existed! This proves they are intentionally lying to customers to block flight changes and force people into paying even more.Filing a Chargeback & Reporting ThemSince they are refusing to process my flight change, I am now:‚úîÔ∏è Filing a chargeback with my credit card provider for "services not provided."‚úîÔ∏è Reporting Gotogate to European Consumer Services for failing to honor a paid service.‚úîÔ∏è Leaving this review so others don‚Äôt fall for their scam.Their customer service is useless, their FlexiTicket is a lie, and they are blatantly misleading customers to squeeze more money out of them. Review: The thing about GoToGate, which is echoed all over this site, is that as long as your booking does NOT require human intervention you might be OK. However, the minute you have to go to that help desk to change anything like a flight re-schedule, you are going to find it a nightmare.They pick up the phone quickly, but that is the only thing that goes right. The actual call centre staff will not help you. Instead, they will string you along, giving you a different story each time ( one could call that deliberate lying ). Sure sir this will be sorted for you , please be patient while we sit back with your money and do nothing at all..... Probably about the worst call centre experience I have ever had.AVOID and book direct with the airline if there is the slightest chance you might want to change anything post the booking.

Review: This company provided the worst customer service experience I've ever encountered.While I initially booked flights through booking.com, I later discovered they use Gotogate for ticketing.  Two weeks ago, the airline cancelled our outbound flight and move us to the following day, a completely unusable option.  Despite available flights on the original date with codeshare airlines, Gotogate or Japan Airline failed to transfer us. Worse, during a phone call with their representative, incorrect dates were submitted to the airline, which Gotogate then denied, ultimately leading to the cancellation of my outbound flight.  I'm now thousands of pounds out of pocket with no outbound flight.  Gotogate simply blames the airline, while the airline claims they can't assist because the booking was made through an agency.  This endless cycle of blame highlights an outdated and inadequate process between Gotogate and the airlines for handling flight changes after a schedule alteration.  This has been, without a doubt, the most stressful and frustrating customer experience imaginable.

Review: Short story: I paid for a plane ticket, a name change, and for a new ticket to be issued. The new ticket was never issued, and I had to buy a new ticket worth twice the price at the airport on the day of the flight. I complained to the company the same day the issue happened and I have yet to receive feedback or a refund for what now appears to have been a fraudulent transaction. Details: I helped my two aunts to book tickets from Johannesburg to Barcelona in August of 2024 for a flight in December of 2024. One of the aunt's surname was mistakenly incorrectly spelled. I emailed Go-To-Gate to request a name change and paid GBP35. This request was reportedly denied by the airline, and I was refunded and advised to instead seek a complete rebooking of the ticket, with the initial cost of the flight recognised as credit. on 12 October, I phoned Go-to-Gate, and was connected to The Fly Ticket LTD who confirmed on the phone that they manage Go-To-Gate bookings, and could assist with a re-booking. I was eventually charged GBP 210 for the reissuance of the ticket, and sent confirmation. About 3 weeks later, I received a document with a new booking confirmation and e-ticket number that both reflected the name change. I was able to log into the booking on Lufthansa and verify that the name had indeed been changed on the booking - it was successfully changed, booking reference TNHK5N. On the day of the flight at the airport my aunt was informed that she was not able to check in because the name on the ticket did not match the passport. the Lufthansa airport system had not registered a name change despite the change reflecting on the website under the aforementioned booking. I called both Lufthansa and Go-To-Gate/FlyTicket for assistance before boarding. The two companies effectively argued that it was the other's responsibility to change the issuance of the corrected ticket - leaving my aunt as the customer effectively powerless and stranded. My aunt was forced to buy an entirely new ticket, which cost twice the amount of the original ticket. We immediately requested a refund  to be processed on the new ticket given it had to be forcibly bought in lieu of a solution between the agent and the airline. It is now February, 2 months later, after numerous phone calls and emails to enquire about the status of the refund, we have been given no formal paperwork confirming the escalation of the refund. I would caution anyone travelling not to use this service AT ALL - we seem to have been duped by systems that appeared completely legitimate but effectively made one fraudulent transaction, paying for a ticket which could not be used, and then forced to pay for another at 100% premium, with no acknowledgement of wrongdoing or commitment to rectify this on the part of Go-To-Gate, FlyTicket or Lufthansa whose systems showed a rectified ticket but who did not let my aunt fly after all.  There are some clear operational issues that have nothing to do with the customer, and neither of these parties are taking responsibility to support us. I would like immediate support on this issue and am looking to escalate to an ombud.

Review: A couple of months ago, I purchased two tickets for February 7, paying ‚Ç¨491 per ticket, plus an additional ‚Ç¨76 for the Flexible Re-plan option. The website clearly states that in case of a ticket change, I would only need to pay the price difference (if applicable), with no extra fees from Gotogate or the airline.Unfortunately, due to an unexpected medical condition affecting my wife, I had to reschedule our flight by a month. When I checked the website, the new ticket price was ‚Ç¨525, meaning I should have only needed to pay around ‚Ç¨70 extra (‚Ç¨30 per ticket), based on the terms stated online. However, when I proceeded with the change, I was shocked to find that Gotogate was asking for ‚Ç¨423.I contacted customer support and, after a long wait, was told that the minimum fee they could offer was ‚Ç¨400 (‚Ç¨200.30 per ticket). When I pointed out their own terms of service, they claimed that some information affecting the price is not visible on the website and is only accessible on their end. I requested to speak with a supervisor or manager, but they only provided a generic customer support number and an email.Frustrated, I checked the website again‚Äîjust an hour later‚Äîand suddenly the prices had changed again. This time, I was able to rebook my flight for an extra ‚Ç¨224 in total. The entire experience made it clear that the real criteria behind these charges are completely vague and invisible to customers!!!!!Lesson learned: There‚Äôs always a hidden price behind "cheaper" options, and it often comes in the form of stress, frustration, and unexpected costs.

Review: I had an absolutely terrible experience with Gotogate, and I want to warn others to avoid this company at all costs. I booked a flight to Brazil, and one of the main reasons I chose Gotogate was the inclusion of a checked baggage allowance. However, without my consent, Gotogate unilaterally canceled my baggage, completely changing the terms of my purchase.When I contacted their customer service, they told me to resolve the issue with LATAM. After multiple attempts, LATAM confirmed that they were unable to add the baggage to my reservation because the error had occurred on Gotogate‚Äôs end.Gotogate‚Äôs only proposed solution was for me to bring my luggage to the airport on the day of my flight and attempt to purchase baggage at check-in. This is completely unacceptable and highly risky. Buying baggage at the last minute could result in:Excessively high fees compared to pre-booking rates.Limited baggage availability, meaning I could be denied the ability to check my luggage altogether.Unnecessary stress and uncertainty right before my flight.Delays or missed flights, if baggage issues take too long to resolve.Despite trying to resolve this issue amicably, Gotogate has refused to take responsibility or offer a solution. Under Australian Consumer Law (ACL), customers have the right to a full refund when a service does not match what was contracted. Gotogate‚Äôs actions are a clear violation of consumer rights, and I demand a full refund for this unacceptable situation.I have already contacted the ACCC (Australian Competition and Consumer Commission) and other consumer protection authorities.Save yourself the stress and money‚ÄîDO NOT BOOK WITH GOTOGATE!

Review: We booked internal flights in Vietnam using Go to Gate. Our flights were cancelled and rebooked by VietJet due to a Typhoon, which obviously cannot be helped. Our flight was pushed back 2 days, but we found flights a day earlier so booked them and cancelled our flight with VietJet as we were outside of the 48 hour cancellation window. There was no notification from Booking.com or Go to Gate on the change of flight. We only saw it once we tried to check in the day before the flight.I have been chasing my refund since October. Go to Gate have responded a few times to say I need to speak with VietJet, but they are unable to look into it as my email address does not match the order. I am unable to contact VietJet directly because there is a Booking/Go to Gate email address on the order form, which was generated for the booking.I've pretty much given up any hope of getting my refund, but will never use any Booking or Go to Gate services again. The customer service has been absolutely shocking.

Review: Gotogate ticket service provider are scammer. I had a terrible experience with GoToGate and would not recommend them to anyone. I purchased an economy ticket in June 2024, through their platform to travel on a WestJet flight, but they downgraded me to an ultra-basic ticket without my knowledge or consent. As a result, I was unable to travel with my carry-on luggage and had to pay an additional fee just to bring it on board. To make matters worse, I was among the last passengers allowed to board the plane.When I first noticed this issue, I contacted a GoToGate agent/ customer service immediately, but they gave me the runaround. I reached out over six times, and each time I was told to call back. I actually escalated the problem to a supervisor and still didn‚Äôt get any resolution. Despite all my efforts for several months the problem was never resolved. This experience was incredibly frustrating, and I regret booking through GoToGate. Save yourself the trouble and book directly with the airline or through a more reliable agency. It may appear that you will be saving money using them but they will scam you.I reviewed your response Gotogate and I am fully aware that this is only a generic response. After calling your company several times from September 2024 until December 14, 2024, I received the same reply from all of your agents. I was even asked to fill out a refund request form but the money I used to pay for my check bags was not returned. GOTOGATE ARE SCAMMERS! I urge you do not use them.

Review: My experience with Booking and GoToGate has been extremely disappointing. I booked a flight through their platform, and the airline made significant changes to the itinerary that completely disrupted my plans. Instead of offering an effective solution or a fair refund, both companies simply adhered to rigid policies that clearly favor the airline and not the customer.What‚Äôs worse is that they make it seem as if the customer is the one canceling the reservation, when in reality, the changes are the airline's responsibility. This is not only frustrating but also leaves the customer feeling completely helpless. Additionally, their customer service is slow and not focused on resolving real issues.I do not recommend using these platforms to book flights. It‚Äôs clear that customer interests are not their priority, and this experience has left a bad impression that I will share widely to prevent others from going through the same.I won‚Äôt be trusting these services again. If you‚Äôre looking for fair treatment and quick solutions, I strongly advise seeking other alternatives.Answer your comments: Thank you for your response. While I understand that schedule changes are initiated by the airline and not the agency, I must emphasize that my dissatisfaction stems from how this situation was handled by your platform.When I first sought a refund due to the substantial schedule change, I was informed that the cancellation would be considered voluntary, which is entirely untrue. The change in itinerary was beyond my control and directly affected my travel plans, forcing me to incur additional expenses, including extended accommodations and costs associated with a layover exceeding 24 hours.Additionally, despite the inconvenience caused, the refund for the extra baggage I purchased was not initially acknowledged. This demonstrates a lack of fairness and consideration for the customer.What adds to my frustration is that, as an intermediary platform that profits from customers using your services, you declined to represent my interests in resolving this issue with the airline. Your role as an agency should include advocating for customers when such disruptions occur, yet this responsibility was not fulfilled.I hope you take this feedback seriously and reconsider how these situations are managed in the future to ensure better support for your customers.

Review: My airfare was cancelled in 9/7/2020 (4 years ago!) by the airline.  Gotogate WAS refunded by the Pegasus Airlines.It took them 4 years (!) to send me refund. I immediately called Gotogate and after struggling with their insane voicemail system by some miracle got to a live agent.  They promised to resend the refund link. Review: I had an extremely disappointing experience with Gotogate.com that I feel compelled to share. I purchased what was advertised as a 'flexible ticket' from London to Singapore. However, when I attempted to make a change to my booking, I was quoted ¬£2,000 for the modification fee. This fee seems excessive and defeats the purpose of a flexible ticket option, especially considering that a new one-way ticket for my desired date was available through another carrier for only ¬£700.The customer service experience was also problematic. The support team, while trying to assist, had significant communication difficulties which made resolving my issue more challenging. I spent considerable time trying to get clear answers about the high modification fee, but to no avail.Based on this experience, I cannot recommend booking through Gotogate.com. The 'flexible ticket' option appears to offer little actual flexibility given the extremely high modification costs, and I believe this should be made clearer to customers before purchase. I would strongly advise potential customers to carefully review all terms and conditions, particularly regarding ticket modifications, and to compare prices with direct bookings through airlines.

Review: I am writing this open letter to recount my recent experience with Gotoget, a company that has effectively scammed me out of USD 1,500. I feel compelled to share these details publicly to warn others and shed light on the company‚Äôs practices.Failure to Deliver on a Promised Phone CallAfter purchasing a flexible ticket, I contacted Gotoget on timefor a rebooking. They accepted and later told me rebooking and cancelling of the flexible ticket is not possible. I was shock of the sudden verbal change of policy.  When I complained further, they promised to investigate and get back to me. Despite repeated assurances that they would contact me by phone to confirm the details, I received no phone call and no assistance.Refusal to Rebook Despite ‚ÄúFlexible‚Äù TicketFrom the start, the ticket was flexible‚Äîmeaning it should be both rebookable and refundable. Yet, Gotoget abruptly claimed that their ‚Äúcompany policy‚Äù prohibits rebooking. This I feel someone is tryung to scam me here. This stance is not only unethical but also contradicts the very nature of a ‚Äúflexible‚Äù ticket.Unjust Rejection of a Refund RequestSince Gotoget failed to facilitate the rebooking, I then requested a refund‚Äîa perfectly reasonable request given the ticket‚Äôs stated flexibility. Instead of honoring this, Gotoget issued a blanket refusal, offering no viable explanation and leaving me with a loss of USD 1,500.Documented Evidence of Their Initial AgreementI possess written documentation indicating that Gotoget initially acknowledged my right to a rebook. Their sudden reversal seems designed to keep my money, violating the trust any customer would have in a service provider.Legal and Ethical ImplicationsI take legal obligations and ethical standards very seriously. It is deeply concerning that Gotoget‚Äôs policies and practices appear to be in conflict with both consumer protection laws and basic fairness. I am fully prepared to pursue legal avenues if they continue to withhold my rightful refund.Warning to the PublicMy intent in making this statement is to alert others who might consider doing business with Gotoget. The deceptive use of the term ‚Äúflexible ticket‚Äù and the subsequent refusal to rebook or refund is nothing short of scamming behavior.Gotoget has wrongfully retained USD 1,500 of my money by denying a rebook and refusing a refund. I urge this company to reverse its course immediately and uphold its contractual and ethical responsibilities.

Review: Never ever think of booking a plane ticket with GoToGate as they have the most useless customer support. After having mistyped one letter while booking a ticket, it's now been ten days that we have literally spent hours on the phone with them and the air company but GoToGate are unwilling to help us. We contacted them within minutes after having booked the tickets and at first, we paid the extra 50 euro fee to make the change. However, they refunded the money saying they cannot make the change as Luxair, the air company, doesn't allow them to do so. When calling Luxair, they weren't able to make the change either as the ticket was bought through GoToGate. Luxair wrote a note on their internal program clearly stating that the name should be changed and told they should be contacted again bt GTG. No matter how many time we called GTG afterwards, we always have the same answer "we cannot make the change as Luxair doesn't allow us". For god sake, how on earth isn't possible to delete a single letter on a booked ticket! Who has access to the system?Luxair cannot do it since we were stupid enough to buy a ticket on GTG, which now tells us to cancel the ticket and buy a new one. But we have two kids attached to the ticket, which means we are losing three tickets due to their incompetency. We have already spent over a hundred euros by calling helplines and the only solution is to cancel three tickets. Really, shame on you! You're a total disgrace to the travel industry.

Review: I purchased a ticket through Gotogate, and somehow‚Äîwhether it was their mistake or the website‚Äôs glitch‚Äî‚ÄòMs.‚Äô was mistakenly entered instead of ‚ÄòMr.‚Äô. I called their customer service, and instead of fixing it, they asked me to send my passport details, promising they‚Äôd make the update. I complied, thinking it would finally be resolved.Instead, they came back with a ridiculous response, saying I should check with the airline, as most airlines don‚Äôt care about titles. They essentially closed my ticket without making any real effort to fix it.Frustrated, I contacted the airline directly, but it took days for them to respond. When I finally got through, they told me titles are important, and that I‚Äôd need to go back to Gotogate to make the change.So, I called Gotogate again. A very annoyed customer service agent picked up, kept me on hold for ages, and finally came back to tell me I‚Äôd have to pay 110 AUD just to change the title. That includes both the airline‚Äôs fees and their service charge.My round-trip ticket from Nepal to Perth with a layover in Malaysia cost me 1500 AUD. Now they‚Äôre charging me over 110 AUD just to correct a simple mistake?I asked to escalate to a manager. Instead, they told me I‚Äôd have to wait for the manager to call me back‚Äîno timeframe given. It seems like they don‚Äôt even have the courtesy to transfer my call to someone who can actually help.This is such a ripoff. I paid 220 AUD for a ‚Äòflexible ticket add-on,‚Äô which I didn‚Äôt even realize had been added‚Äîmoney wasted on something that doesn‚Äôt seem to do anything at all other than empty my account.On top of that, they charge 110 AUD just to change my title. And I can‚Äôt even fix this directly with the airline because Gotogate has some shady contract with them, forcing me to pay this ridiculous fee just to get their commission.It‚Äôs clear‚ÄîGotogate is not here to help customers; they‚Äôre just here to rip people off. Absolutely infuriating.

Review: would not recommend this company. All the people writing positive reviews probably had no issues with flights. You only find out if a company is reputable when you have an issue and need to resolve it.  This is where Go to Gate proved to be terrible.My flight from Manchester to Stavanger was cancelled because of bad weather. I get it, it happens. There was no communication from Go to Gate except for an update status on the app which informed me the flight had been cancelled. I managed to get through to them the next day and they offered a refund on my outgoing flight. However they refused to refund my return flight from Stavanger to Manchester as this was still operating . . . even though they couldn't get me to Stavanger to catch it. The whole conversation with the customer service team was pure nonsense. I'm trying to get a refund through the airline . . .but this is proving difficult because I booked through Go to Gate. My advice would be that if you use this travel agent, you have to accept that if something goes wrong there wont be any support and you wont be getting a refund. I used booking.com and thought it was all ethical and above board, but its really not.

Review: The wrost service I have ever had in 54 years. I bought a ticket using skyscanner and completed the purchase with GoToGate. That was a huge mistake. Due to unforeseen circumstances I need to change the dates of my flight.. I spoke to 4 or 5 different people and they always say I will receive a call next day to resolve the situation, or an em-mail with 2 hours but nothing they said happened. Then I have to call again, and again. It's very unhelpful and stressful. On Saturday 28/12/2024 I was told I had to pay ¬£400 to change the dates. I paid and after 5 minutes I was told they cannot change the dates because LATAM did not accept your payment, and that it'll be refunded with 5 to 7 working days (let's see) and that I should call LATAM directly. I did. LATAM told me as I purchase the ticket with GoToGate, there is nothing they can do. I asked why they refused the payment, the LATAM girl chekced and said there is no record of any refused payment. Did the attendant lied? I was advised to contact GoToGate again, which I did and I was told I had to pay ¬£264 to change the dates. I did again. And the guy said he could not change the dates. Twice the same issue, they say how much I should pay, I pay and they said they could not change the dates. I asked to speak to a manager but they are always in a meeting. I was old to call in 30 minutes, he wa trying to get rid of me. I was fuming, nearly crying of anger and frustration. I was told it has been escalated to another team and that I should wait few days. I paid ¬£800 for my ticket, then ¬£400 + ¬£264 to change the dates, and the dates were not changed!

Review: I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever written a review of a company before, and I would give them -5 stars if I could. I have been left with no choice but to let everyone know: please avoid GoToGate at all costs.I am absolutely appalled and disgusted by this company. I had a flight booked from Edinburgh to Melbourne, but unfortunately, I was diagnosed with ovarian cancer and had to undergo emergency surgery to remove a cancerous mass. Due to the risks, my doctors advised me not to fly at the time.I contacted Qatar Airways, who facilitated my flight, and they graciously agreed to honour my ticket until April 2025. This was a lifeline for me, as I live and work in Australia, and my family is there. However, when I later contacted Qatar to rebook my flight, I was devastated to learn that GoToGate had requested a refund on my behalf without my authorisation and made changes to my booking, preventing Qatar from honouring the agreement.When I asked Qatar for help, they informed me that only GoToGate has the authority to make changes to my booking since I made the reservation through them. Despite this, GoToGate has refused to take responsibility and continues to send me generic, unhelpful emails. For two months, I have been fighting to get this resolved, only to be told that they will offer me a meager refund of 300 AUD (minus a cancellation fee!) if I ‚Äúaccept.‚Äù This is clearly a tactic to absolve themselves of accountability.I feel completely lied to and utterly heartbroken. Even with everything I‚Äôve been going through with ovarian cancer, they have shown no compassion or willingness to assist me.To make matters worse, after explaining my situation to a GoToGate team member, I was advised that I had called the wrong number. He then told me that I needed to ‚Äúgo in hard-on them and not give up.‚Äù If your own employees are advising you to take that approach, what does that say about the company?I cannot believe how negligent and dismissive this company is. Qatar Airways made it clear that GoToGate is the only party able to make changes to my booking, and yet they have completely abandoned me in this process.I am writing this review to warn others: please, please avoid GoToGate. I never thought something like this could happen to me, but it did. Don‚Äôt risk it. Find a reputable travel agent and spare yourself the stress, disappointment, and heartbreak I‚Äôve endured.Kerri

Review: Worst experience ever! We are a family of 5 ( with 2 kids and a little baby 8 months) and we have booked a trip last minute from Male to Saigon (our previous flight was delayed due to cyclone and we couldn't catch the connected flight home). We lost our money from the first ticket as domestic flight Maldivian airlines is not connected with Air Asia.  So we decided to buy 5 new tickets with this Go to gate as it was showing as the short and affordable one with only stop over in Cochin India. MALE- COCHIN - HCMC ( half with INDIGO and the rest VIETJET) but no mention that different airlines and 7 hrs stopover you can't board unless with VISA to India.  So we were not allowed to board by the Airline officer of Indigo Airlines and we were stuck in Male on Xmas eve.  We were desperate ! Imagine with 8 months old baby with milk running out, at airport, No food and two other kids hungry and tired. A nightmare ! Go to gate disregards any  responsibility and say its the airline company that must inform, when we don't have contact with the airline when we buy the ticket. Nevertheless if you selling the ticket with this conditions there should be some information but there was none  whatsoever on this transfer that needs a visa if stopover in INDIA even if only stopover. Unbelieble. As we booked the previous day and  last minute we were not able of course to do visa. But the money they can receive but not inform. Let's see how long it is going to take to have it refund if ever. If not refunded we will definitely start a lawsuit procedure as although third party you must have accurate information. Booking, kayak and sky scanner should not be associated with this kind of lack of care and no service. NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN..,   Update Jan 6 2025 - Airline INDIGO sent me a reply saying that they have reimburse our flight but so far we have not received any refund.Update - I finally got info through the chatbot of gotogate that  INDIGO airline reimbursed 29 EUROS when we paid 2700 euros. As the gotogate also charges 44 euros commission of handling fees our reimbursement is O ... Is this even acceptable ???  Update in reply to answer of Gotogate - We did check the visa requirements. It says no need if you are only stopping over for a few hours. it should be mentioned on your site and when purchasing your tickets is that this does not apply when different airline companies are involved as you must collect the luggage and redo check in... It is Go to Gate responsibility to inform... I would have never have bought the ticket if I had known that we could not fly.... Update Jan 17 - almost after one month of the non travel event we have not yet been reimbursed of nothing. The go to gate says that they have received 29 euros out of 2700 euros of reimbursement and as they change 40 eur of commission we get zero.... How can this even be possible ? We were sold a ticket that it was not executable as last minute ticket for other then Indians is not possible to stop over in India... No mention no reference no nothing and yet they have sold us this ticket...

Review: I booked a flight from TPE to MEL with Gotogate "help" and even paid for flexible tickets in case of some changes. I decided to save 30$ and didn't use the air company's website. Do not make this mistake. Gotogate might be good if everything goes smoothly. But in the cases like cancellation or any other changes - it will be a nightmare. It was the worst experience I had with the agent. My flight was cancelled and the air company changed my itinerary. Gotogate just said they cannot help "due to the tool limitations" (WTF?!) and I should deal with the air company by myself. I did it. Reasonably, the air company said you should go and ask the agent to deal with it. So I returned to Gotogate and they asked me to wait because "We will escalate your cancellation request to our support team." And I waited for almost a week with no answer. My flight is tomorrow and seems like I cannot return my tickets. Hope the story will end positively but I've already read reviews (pity, I didn't do it BEFORE the Gotogate booking was done). So, no big expectations about this. Just good luck to everyone else who uses Gotogate. Wish you won't book and just use another service.UPD. I contacted the support again - and they gave me the number to call for urgent needs +886255940484. And you know what? This number is not assigned to anyone, no response lol Nice "service"UPD on 30/12/2024. My flight was gone and Gotogate in their reply mentioned it was my fault I didn't provide in my feedback my booking number but used my name and surname - seems like so many people with my name and surname are going from Taipei to Melbourne. Good to know. But if it's hard to find the number in your system, here it is: A35FKJ. But after you get it you will blame me it's already too late to do something. Sure, it was my fault I asked for help (and I paid for it as an additional service) 5 days before the flight.UPD on 07/01/2025. For those who've read the whole review and are still interested in the end of the story - nobody from Gotogate has yet contacted me. I have not even received an apology. So that's the level of service they provide.

Review: Disappointing Experience ‚Äì Would Not Use AgainI had a frustrating and disappointing experience with GoToGate.co.uk and would not use them again, even if it worked in the end.Firstly, their website feels very outdated and cluttered. The chat feature is extremely difficult to locate, and even when you manage to find it, the service is incredibly slow. They take 10‚Äì15 minutes to reply, yet they disconnect you after being inactive for just 30 seconds. This lack of consistency adds unnecessary stress.The booking process is unnecessarily complicated. The site constantly bombards you with add-ons, and if you check one by mistake, you can‚Äôt move forward without confirming and paying for it. If you attempt to go back, the system forces you to restart the entire booking process from scratch.The site also repeatedly asks you to verify your email every single time you try to log in to check your booking. Even after verifying, it sometimes asks again, preventing you from accessing your booking details. This creates a very frustrating user experience.Making changes to flights is another ordeal. They impose high additional costs on top of the already expensive airline fees. Their support team is also unhelpful. They expect you to call them even if you‚Äôre abroad, but they lack an international helpline or local contact numbers for different countries. Email support is nonexistent, and the chat service is unreliable and shuts down quickly whenever it suits them.Overall, GoToGate.co.uk might have cheap flights, but the poor website functionality, hidden costs, and inadequate support make it an exhausting and stressful experience. You‚Äôre better off paying slightly more to book directly with the airline or through a more reliable platform.

Review: Terrible Experience with Go to Gate ‚Äì Refusal to Refund After Airline Changes My TicketI am extremely frustrated and disappointed with Go to Gate after they refused to refund my ticket, even though the airline confirmed that I am fully entitled to a full refund due to changes they made to my flight.Here‚Äôs what happened:1. The Airline Changes My Flight I originally booked a flight through Go to Gate, but the airline later made significant changes to my itinerary. They informed me that my flight had been altered, and they gave me the option to either accept the new flight or request a full refund. After reviewing the new schedule, I decided that the changes didn‚Äôt work for me, so I opted to request a full refund.2. The Airline Confirms I‚Äôm Entitled to a Refund After contacting the airline, they confirmed that, according to their policy, I was entitled to a full refund because the changes were made by them. They assured me that all I needed to do was reach out to Go to Gate to have them process the refund on my behalf. The airline also sent me written confirmation of this entitlement.3. Go to Gate Refuses to Process the Refund Despite the airline‚Äôs confirmation, Go to Gate has flatly refused to process my refund. Their customer service agents have been unhelpful, and they keep making excuses, claiming they need more time or that the airline hasn‚Äôt processed the refund yet‚Äîthis, despite the airline telling me I am already entitled to it. It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating that they are not taking responsibility for this situation.4. Misleading and Conflicting Information Every time I contact Go to Gate, I get different answers. One representative tells me that the refund will be processed soon, and another tells me that it‚Äôs not possible. They have even claimed that my ticket wasn‚Äôt eligible for a refund, which contradicts what the airline has told me multiple times. It feels like Go to Gate is intentionally stalling or trying to avoid issuing the refund.5. Poor Customer Support and Communication The customer service has been beyond frustrating. I‚Äôve waited for hours on the phone and sent numerous emails, but each time, the responses are vague or completely unhelpful. I‚Äôve had to chase them down repeatedly, and they don‚Äôt seem interested in resolving my issue. There‚Äôs a complete lack of transparency and accountability, and I feel completely ignored.6. Unacceptable Delay and No Clear Resolution It has been weeks now, and I am still waiting for my refund. Go to Gate keeps pushing the issue back with no clear resolution. Meanwhile, I have confirmation from the airline that I should be getting a full refund. Go to Gate‚Äôs refusal to cooperate and process this is not only frustrating but completely unfair.Conclusion: I am beyond disappointed with Go to Gate‚Äôs service. They are refusing to process a refund that I am clearly entitled to, based on changes made by the airline. Their customer service is unresponsive, and the entire experience has been a complete nightmare.I would strongly advise others to avoid Go to Gate at all costs. I‚Äôve been left in a difficult situation, and they are not willing to help in any meaningful way. I will not be booking with them again and will be sharing my experience with others to ensure no one else has to go through this. I‚Äôm now exploring other avenues to get my refund, but I shouldn‚Äôt have to be dealing with this in the first place.

Review: Having used G"G multiple times before, this time was totally unimpressive. Tried to book a ticket. Payment was made. That was  a bit more successful but the agent just kept saying that the matter was escalated to the concerned dept. This was not acceptable. After 6 hrs i decided to make a payment method report and reverse the charge. From the time of booking G2G only gave 12 hrs for a "free refund for cancellation but I was not prepared to wait any longer. Luckily as I was preparing to file the report I got emails from G2G advising of a "technical failure" and that the booking was cancelled and a refund was on its way. I then checked my account for the refund and it was already there. So at least that was a case of "panic over."Overall, this time and after making multiple bookings it looks like I will think twice about using G2G in future.Disappointing.

Review: I had booked a flight earlier with a cancellation cover which would give me 90% of the ticket cost (i.e., 90% of the base rate for the flight, not the whole cost). I got it as a voucher, and whenever I try to apply the voucher, the system always increased the price of the ticket by saying "the new price has increased by GBP X." This increased price is always close to or over what the voucher covered, essentially nullifying the voucher. What is the point of us paying for the cancellation cover to get a refund on the ticket, and not be useful? Such a scam system. This happened at least 10 times, and I tried applying it with a different airline as well. Same response every time: "the price just increased by GBP X." They asked me to try booking a few hours later. No difference. They asked me to book through a different device. No difference. They asked me to clear the history, cookies and cache. No difference. I tried through a different browser, different person's laptop, different chrome profile. No difference. The only thing left for me to do is to not apply the voucher, and then see if the "airline" increases the cost. If it doesn't (when I don't apply the voucher code), it will be proof positive that GoToGate runs scams like these concealed inside a "legit-looking" business. The customer service is awful, and keep repeating the same thing again and again. They can't block a ticket at that price and send it to me for me to pay it at that cost that was advertised.

Review: I am in utter shock and disbelief with how this company is able to still trade. I used them for my travel to Thailand and booked return flights through them. Within a week of me being there they told me the airline cancelled my flight home and they would need to rebook. I went through the process of rebooking through their online chat as I was anxious and worried that I would be left in Thailand with no way of getting home. I had to do this a further 3 times whilst I was away as the airline 'apparrently' kept cancelling my flights home. After the 3rd time I was cohearsed by their agent to take a full refund for the inconvenience 6 days before I was meant to fly home. They told me it would take 6-14 days for the refund to be processed back to my account and promised me this was a priority and matter of urgency due to the circumstances as I told them I would not be able to afford a flight home untill this is re-imbursed. It is now 23 days since the refund request was made and I have not received any further updates. I have now spent a whole week sleeping rough on the streets of Thailand with no money for food and everytime I contact them they give me the same generic crap that they seem to be telling everyone else that they have scammed. I paid through these guys for the service and due to my circumstances I am afraid I will die out here and they couldn't give a toss. They are happy to take the money but not refund or even offer some form of compensation so I can have a roof over my head and feed myself whilst I am here with no money due to their incompetence and lack of empathy or care for the customers they have stolen money from. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!

Review: I booked a flight through Booking.com, which unfortunately collaborates with Gotogate, a company I now consider nothing short of a scam. Everything seemed fine initially, but then the airline canceled my flight. Gotogate informed me that they had rebooked me on an earlier flight, which I could have chosen from the beginning if it suited my schedule (it didn‚Äôt).Since this was a European airline and the flight was within Europe, I contacted Gotogate to request a rescheduling to a later flight. Their response? They could only do it for a fee‚Äîdespite the fact that the original cancellation was entirely beyond my control.When I asked for a refund, I was told I would only get half of what I paid, as they deemed it a ‚Äúvoluntary cancellation.‚Äù I explained that under EU regulations (EU261), this isn‚Äôt how it works. The clueless call center agent insisted this was my only option, adding insult to injury by lying to me, claiming:	‚Ä¢	The flight was merely ‚Äúrescheduled‚Äù (it wasn‚Äôt‚Äîit was a different flight altogether).	‚Ä¢	The airline has a policy allowing them to act as they please if delays are less than 5 hours (utter nonsense).Clearly, their India-based call center staff is either uninformed or deliberately deceitful, as they seem to have no knowledge of EU passenger rights.In the end, I bypassed Gotogate entirely and called the airline directly. The airline resolved the issue in accordance with EU regulations, proving once again that Gotogate is completely useless.This was my first and last time using Gotogate. My advice? Stay far away from this company. They lie, charge made up fees, and show zero understanding or respect for consumer rights.

Review: "My experience with this company was absolutely disastrous, and I strongly urge anyone considering dealing with them to think twice. The company operates under multiple names, lacks transparency, and their customer service‚Äîbased in India‚Äîonly makes things worse instead of solving problems. After deducting the payment, they neither confirmed my booking nor sent the ticket, and every time I contacted them, I received the same unprofessional and frustrating excuses, claiming the airline hadn't confirmed the booking.When I directly asked them to either confirm the booking or refund my money, they kept stalling without giving a clear resolution, even though my travel date was fast approaching. To make matters worse, they warned me not to book another ticket on my own because they wouldn‚Äôt refund my money if I did so, leaving me in a very difficult position. As a result, I am now forced to pay a much higher amount to book a last-minute ticket due to their complete failure to confirm my trip.Dealing with this company is not just a waste of money but also an exhausting drain on time, effort, and patience. Review: If you are pregnant or have specific medical needs requiring a MEDIF form for your flight, do not purchase tickets through GoToGate. This platform provided me with one of the worst experiences I've ever had.I booked my tickets for a LOT airline flight through GoToGate and needed to add a MEDIF form to my reservation. Over two days (21.11.2024 and 22.11.2024), I was tossed back and forth between LOT Airlines and GoToGate, neither taking responsibility for processing my request. GoToGate claims on their website to assist with adding MEDIF forms for customers flying with non-low-cost airlines (which LOT clearly is), but this promise turned out to be empty.LOT Airlines informed me that since my ticket was purchased through a travel agent, it was GoToGate's responsibility to add the MEDIF form. However, GoToGate's support team completely failed to assist me. They wasted 48 hours of my time, causing immense stress and sleepless nights, all while avoiding their obligations. Instead of resolving my simple request‚Äîto add a MEDIF form in accordance with LOT's policies‚Äîthey simply told me to go to the airport with my documents, as they "couldn't" process the form.The customer service team offered no genuine help. They Googled irrelevant information, redirected me back to LOT, and clearly wanted to get rid of me. Their refusal to handle this straightforward request left me to deal with everything on my own, despite being pregnant and needing proper assistance.This ordeal caused me unnecessary stress and completely ruined my peace of mind. GoToGate failed in every aspect of customer service and showed no empathy or willingness to help a pregnant woman. I will never purchase tickets through this platform again and strongly urge others to avoid it‚Äîespecially if you require any kind of additional service. Instead of providing support, they create chaos and stress for their customers.

Review: I would give zero stars if possible. My upfront advice is to spend a few extra dollars and book directly with the airline - this company is not worth the struggle and ended up costing me $600. UPDATE: Update on my experience with GotoGate:After hours of messaging their support team, GotoGate refused to take accountability for the issue they caused with my booking. They offered only generic apologies, shifted responsibility to the airline, and insisted on unattainable documentation. Despite my demands, they refused to provide direct contact with a manager and vaguely promised a call from their internal team within 24‚Äì48 hours.24 hours later, I received an email essentially stating they couldn‚Äôt help me. The email provided no further contact information, and it came from an address that doesn‚Äôt accept responses‚Äîyet another dead end in this frustrating process.Adding insult to injury, their public response to my initial review claimed they couldn‚Äôt address the issue because I hadn‚Äôt shared my order number‚Äîignoring the fact that they already have all my information from our prior interactions.GotoGate‚Äôs behavior is emblematic of a company that prioritizes deflection and dead ends over resolution. Avoid them at all costs.Essentially, I booked a $600 flight with GotoGate, and had two legs of this flight that involved two different airlines. I am a frequent traveler, and can navigate myself exceptionally through all all the perils travel brings. About a week before my flight with GotoGate, I realized that my last name hadn‚Äôt made it on the second leg of my itinerary. I don‚Äôt know whose error this was, but it didn‚Äôt matter, as I knew to just call the airline to do a name edit. Both of the airlines that I called told me they were unable to edit my reservation because it was booked with GotoGate, and that I would need to contact them directly. Essentially, had I just booked with the airline it would have been an easy fix, but because GotoGate was involved, I had to go through them. Which was a nightmare. The only advice I received was ‚Äúcall the airline‚Äù, and when I explained I had called the airline, they just told me there was nothing they could do and I had to call the airline. I spoke to managers and multiple agents, and everyone told me there was nothing they could do. One agent told me it would take days to get the airlines approval to add my last name, so I wasn‚Äôt even worth it. One agent told me they could change two letters on my booking but not my whole last name. One agent said to email a copy of my passport and they would rush the request through to the airline to get the name edited. I did this, and the next day received an email saying they couldn‚Äôt change my name and I had to call the airline. With my departure date approaching, and not having any help or assistance, I was forced to buy an entirely new ticket on a different airline in order to make my trip. That ticket was $1200. When I called to demand a refund, or flight credit for the ticket I wasn‚Äôt able to use, they told me nothing could be done because ‚ÄúI had been instructed to contact the airline, via email‚Äù. A complete scam. Just spend the extra money and book with the airline.

Review: I had to cancel travel due to a death in my immediate family, and the Arline (TAP Portugal) mandated I contact the 3rd party (Go2Gate) for my refund. I contacted Go2Gate immediately in July 2024 and have been battling with them for going on 5 months via regular calls just to get a basic level of accurate information out of them as to when they‚Äôll process the refund for my airfare. This company has hideously poor customer service‚Ä¶they lie about resolution times, repeatedly spin you in circles saying ‚Äújust wait 24-48 hours‚Äù and offer blanketed apologies and platitudes without even remotely solving the issue. The cancellation was deemed by the airline as justifiable and deserves a refund; but instead of being able to grieve my parent‚Äôs death peacefully, I‚Äôm reduced to constantly calling this horrible company to claw back ¬£700. What a complete joke! *update* And, in reply to GotoGate, the booking reference was ‚Äú1018-645-676‚Äù.

Review: Gotogate took my money and left me stranded in Bangkok. I booked a cheap round trip flight using gotogate, clearly the first mistake, you get what you pay for. I needed to leave sooner than I expected so I contacted them to try to change the dates. It would have cost more than the full trip itself to change the dates and they told me it would also cost more to cancel than I would get in return for a refund. Instead, as the agent suggested, I booked a different one-way flight which cost less than the cost to change the dates. I went on my trip, arrived earlier than I would have and then heard nothing from gotogate. The App still showed that I had a return ticket and still notified me that I needed to get to the airport. When I arrived, I was informed by the airline staff that I did not have a ticket. They told me to contact my "agent". I talked to the chatbot of gotogate until I could get to a live agent. They told me that the flight was confirmed in their system and to go back to the airline to check in. The airline told me it was still not confirmed and told me to contact the airline directly. When I called them they told me no changes were possible other than booking a new flight and paying the cancellation fee. Gotogate was no help. They gave me no notice that this was the airline's policy and advised me to take this course where I ultimately had to book a same-day flight with another airline. They said they would contact me about the situation, but still have not reached out. I will likely never use gotogate or Eithad Airways ever again.

Review: GotoGate (through Booking.com) have been highly unprofessional and unethical in resolving my genuine request for a refund. It is now three months on and I am still battling a legitimate request for a refund for a Qantas flight I booked through booking.com, aka GotoGate. The OS flight in July was completely cancelled by the airline after a 48 hours delay, with customers told at 1:30am to make own arrangements to get home (stressful already). Being ping-ponged between booking.com and GotoGate (QANTAS gets its own 1 star review!) I was told in Sep by GtoG I would not be refunded without further explanation. After another dozen phone calls on numbers I had to dig up on their website, emails to addresses provided by the sales assistants that bounced (and one reply written in German) and promises my case has been escalated, I am still waiting; out of pocket for the new flight I had to book to get home, the original flight AND interest on my credit card for three months! I will take further action if I get knocked back again. This has been unnecessarily stressful, financially difficult and time wasting. Although some of the sales reps have been polite and empathetic, they do not provide any names of people or contacts to deal directly with one rep. I will avoid using GotoGate and Booking.com for any flights in future and never recommend to anyone. Now for my review on QANTAS.....

Review: Do not book with GotoGate, they are scammers.  I purchased a comfort flex ticket with Pegasus but when I received my ticket, it turned out to be the cheapest one which doesn't even allow checkin baggage.  I paid almost ¬£80 extra for the comfort flex option, which was supposed to include 20kg check in, 8kg cabin and a small bag.  It should have also included free changes and onboard food, all of which I didn't get.  After spending a week calling GotoGate, I just kept getting told someone will contact me, but obviously nobody did.  Eventually, when it came to checking in, I upgraded myself paying extra to check in my luggage.  I was told I can claim this back from GotoGate, and after trying for the last few weeks, they are just fobbing me off again, and have now closed my complaint with no resolution.  I wish I read the other reviews before using Booking.com or GotoGate.  Apparently they do this sort of thing all the time!Update:  Thanks for your response, but If you genuinely care, you can start by replying to me and giving me the refund you promised on the phone.  You have my details as you have been emailing me with generic responses.  As far as I'm concerned, the case is still open and I will be pursuing with the regulators until a full refund is given.  I have just found out you are not even ABTA approved, so it will be challenging.  I hope others can learn from my mistake.

Review: I had a flight booked through Gotogate in March 2020 which had to be cancelled because of the pandemic. I was unable to rebook the flight within a year because of the ongoing pandemic, and Air Canada therefore refunded the fare - almost ¬£400 - to Gotogate in March 2021 (as Air Canada confirmed to me on the phone). Despite my repeated calls and emails after that, Gotogate have never returned the money to me. Their 'customer care' is useless on the phone, and a brick wall by email. I have now tried a Subject Access Request to see their internal communications about the order, to be told by the parent company that they cannot access information from more than three years ago. I will never use them again, and recommend that no one else does either.Reply added after Gotogate's response: there seemed no point adding the booking code since, after extensive correspondence about my Subject Access Review, your parent company informed me that all information dating back more than three years had been 'obfuscated' and so couldn't be accessed. However, if that's not true, then the order code is L3C5P5, passenger name Ken Babstock (my husband), though I paid for the flight, a fact which you've repeatedly used to avoid talking to either of us. You have details for both of us, and a refund to either of us would always have been fine. I look forward to your response.Further edit: order code above, booking reference U9IN3A. You already have all this information, unless (as I've been told) it's been 'anonymised and obfuscated'.

Review: I canceled a flight due to the death of a family member almost a year ago. I was told that if I provided all of the necessary documentation, Gotogate would request a refund from the airline. Review: I booked a ticket from Amsterdam to Antalya via Istanbul. Return flight was also from Antalya to Amsterdam via Istanbul. Ajet changed the flight data and made it impossible to fly back home to Amsterdam. Gotogate informed me that they would request another flight on the next day, because flights on the day of the original return flight were all booked. That meant that I would lose a day of work on the next day, but I am not a difficult person. I thanked them for the effort and accepted the return flight on the next day. A week passed and I did not get any confirmation for my new return flight. I contacted Gotogate several times and they said they were still working on it and referred me back to Ajet. I contacted Ajet and they told me they can't do anything for me and referred me back to Gotogate. I contacted Gotogate and requested a refund so I could book another flight. They said they can't do refunds and referred me back to Ajet. I called Ajet and they said they can't do refunds for agency tickets. I understand operational changes can happen, but Gotogate is responsible for offering an alternative for the paying customer. And I also understand it takes time to book another flight, but if it takes Gotogate more than a week to rebook my flight, they are not good at their job. They kept telling me they haven't heard back from Ajet yet, but I spoke to Ajet several times on the phone. And I am not a superhero. I don't have magic fingers to dial a secret phone number to reach Ajet, so Gotogate can also contact them. Unfortunately, they have let me down and failed to provide the service I paid for. My flight leaves tomorrow and I have to pay double now because of Gotogate. Update: on the day of the flight I contacted Gotogate again asked them about the status of the change and they told the deadline for changes as passed and we cannot do anything for you anymore. On top of that they said I don't get a refund. I told them they requested the change longer than a week ago and I contacted them every day to acquire the status of the change. All they had to say was wait for confirmation and on the last day it was too late and I had to act sooner? Really????....Final Update: Please take note that the response of Gotogate was generic and even though I added a booking number they declined to give a content-related reply. Again, the airline changed the flight data and made it impossible to fly back home. Even though I requested a rebooking 8 days before the return flight, Gotogate did nothing to secure the tickets I paid for. If everything goes well Gotogate is a hero, but if problems arise outside of the customers fault, they refuse to help. Luckily my credit card company is more than willing to confront Gotogate with their handling of the situation. The payment will be blocked and Gotogate will have to answer for their incompetence in this matter.

Review: I had a profoundly disappointing experience with GoToGate. My family and I booked flights from Erbil to London with a layover in Istanbul through GoToGate for August 13, 2024. Due to scheduling issues, we were informed that the first leg of our flight (Erbil to Istanbul) needed to be rescheduled, which would result in us missing our connection in Istanbul. Following instructions from the airline (AJET), I attempted to amend the booking through GoToGate, expecting them to help us resolve the connection issue.GoToGate informed me that our flights could be rearranged to August 18, which, while inconvenient, was our only option. I agreed and waited for confirmation. Unfortunately, no confirmation arrived, despite my repeated calls to GoToGate two days before the flight, the day before, and even on the day itself. This left me and my four younger siblings (ages 18, 16, 15, and 10) in a difficult position, uncertain if we‚Äôd even be allowed on the flight. Ultimately, we missed the flight, and we were forced to remain in Erbil.For nine days following the missed flight, I called GoToGate and AJET daily, only to be passed back and forth between the two companies. Each claimed the other was responsible, and no one offered a solution. This lack of coordination, accountability, and respect for my time left us stranded, with no option but to book an entirely new flight at the last minute, costing an additional $2,000.Throughout this ordeal, GoToGate failed to provide any meaningful support or follow-through on their promises. The entire experience caused us significant financial and emotional distress. GoToGate‚Äôs lack of communication and refusal to take responsibility has severely damaged my trust in their services.Desired Outcome: I am seeking a full refund for the initial booking and compensation for the additional costs I incurred. This experience was entirely avoidable had GoToGate provided the level of service expected from a booking agent.I hope this review serves as a warning to future customers. If you value reliable customer service and a company that stands by its promises, I recommend booking elsewhere.
