Review: I made a search for a flight with Skyscanner, and from the results, I compared the prices against the airline prices.I found that gotogate offered the same itinerary for 840 CHF, while the airline offered it for 1050 CHF, so I went with gotogage.After I entered all the reservation information, and verified that indeed the price was the claimed 840 CHF, I entered my credit card information, and proceeded with the booking.The first booking attempt failed with a generic error message along the lines of "booking could not be completed". So I clicked a second time, and this time it went through.However, when I checked the receipt, I could see that I was charged instead 1070 CHF! At NO POINT this amount was displayed to me prior to executing the booking. In other words, they lured me in with a price of 842 CHF and charged me instead 1070 CHF.I contacted the customer service, as I was pretty sure this was a technical error that could be amended. Instead, even though the operator acknowledged that he could see everything that I was describing, he confirmed he could do nothing to amend the price. Instead, he offered to cancel the whole thing for a "small" fee of 75 CHF.I told him that they had no right to charge me ANYTHING for an obvious problem on their side, and he insisted he understood how I felt and that he could do nothing about it, leaving me with no option other than to suck it up.I asked to have the issue escalated, and to be involved in the escalation, but he said that he couldn't involve me because that is an internal matter. Internal? I am the damn final customer... how on Earth is that internal?So now I am left here, 200 bucks short, and with no one to be held accountable for this mess up. Saying that I am angry is an understatement. So to all potential customers: unless you're willing to lose money in unexpected ways, and to deal with a company with ZERO accountability, AVOID THIS LIKE THE PEST. Their business seems to revolve around scamming people, but where the scammed amount is low enough that they can get away with it.

Review: Reasons for my 1-star review are outlined below. I‚Äôve had a few dealings with Gotogate (3 flight bookings in the last 6 months), and found that the experience can range from smooth to extremely poor, depending on whether you need to make changes to your ticket. The cases are listed in order, from good to worst.First flight booked ‚Äì cheapest fare offered: This was a basic booking with no refunds or changes possible. I received my ticket immediately, great platform. There was no further interaction with them on this trip, and everything went well. Based on this initial experience, I was happy to book more flights with Gotogate‚Äîhence my next experiences.Flexible ticket extra not worth it: I paid ¬£70 for the "flexible ticket extra" option, anticipating that I might need to change my flight. However, when the time came, I was charged nearly three times my initial ticket price for the change. It would‚Äôve been better to book a flexible ticket directly with the airline‚Äîalmost the same ¬£70 difference from the basic fare.Refund for cancelled flight: Since paying three times the original ticket price made no sense, I asked to cancel the flight and was informed there would be a charge for that. So, I went directly to the airline‚Äôs website and canceled it there (for some reason, this was possible, but changing the flight with the airline wasn‚Äôt). The airline refunded ¬£136 after deducting their cancellation fee. After waiting two weeks with no refund, I contacted Gotogate to ask why they hadn‚Äôt released the amount refunded by the airline. They asked for a ¬£35 service fee from the ¬£136 refund, plus an additional ¬£50 with no valid explanation. After challenging this and speaking to another agent, they just stopped mentioning the ¬£50 fee without any explanation for why it was being requested in the first place. However, when I received the refund confirmation email, they had deducted ¬£40 instead of the ¬£35 service fee they originally quoted. Talk about business integrity?Adding my infant to another ticket: For the past week, I‚Äôve been trying to get Gotogate to add my infant to my existing ticket. Airlines require a child to be born before booking a flight for them, so the standard procedure is to add the infant to your existing ticket once they are born. This should be straightforward. The agent I spoke to when booking the ticket confirmed this wouldn‚Äôt be an issue, but I‚Äôve been waiting for 5 days, and it‚Äôs still unresolved.Based on these experiences, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend Gotogate, as I‚Äôm not convinced they are a trustworthy company.

Review: Updated// the response tells you everything. No request for further information and no direct email.------‚Äê--------I booked a flight through Booking.com, which uses Gotogate for their flight bookings. Unfortunately, I made a small mistake by misspelling a passenger's name by one letter. When I contacted Gotogate support, they assured me the correction would be handled. After following up multiple times, they claimed to have "escalated" the issue, though that didn't seem to result in any progress.I decided to call Vietnam Airlines directly, who confirmed that Gotogate had not been in touch with them. The airline also mentioned that Gotogate is pre-authorized to change up to three characters in a name correction without any approval. Despite informing Gotogate of this policy, they insisted they had escalated the issue even further. It has now been two weeks, and the name is still not corrected.My advice: book directly with the airline. They can make corrections and changes to your ticket immediately. Any small savings you might get by using an agent like Gotogate is not worth the hassle and delays when something goes wrong.

Review: As a partner with Booking.com, Don't & Don't ever book a flight with themBelieve it or not, this was the absolute worst experience of my life. Do yourself a favor‚Äîlearn from my mistake and NEVER book a flight with booking.com and their partner gotogateIf you ever need to reschedule, cancel, or request a refund‚Äîeven on a supposedly flexible ticket‚Äîprepare to lose your patience, time, and money. They will play endless games with you, trapping you in a frustrating cycle of non-communication. The only way to contact them is through a chat system, with no option for email or phone support. And their chat representatives have a single, rehearsed response: 'We will forward your request to the support team, and they will get back to you.' Spoiler alert: they never do.When you try to follow up, you're forced to explain your case all over again, only to be told to wait while they 'check your case'‚Äîand then, it‚Äôs back to square one. It's a nightmare that will leave you wondering whether to laugh or cry out of sheer frustration.I've been dealing with this for more than 10 days now, and in the end, I had no choice but to buy new tickets at a significant cost‚Äîmoney I shouldn't have had to spend if I hadn't made the mistake of booking with booking.com and their partner gotogate. Save yourself the heartache and avoid this company at all costs.Trust me, booking.com is a company that doesn‚Äôt respect its customers, and I will be reporting them to every relevant consumer protection agency I can find. Learn from my costly experience and stay far, far away from with booking.com and their partner gotogate."Please review their response below. It demonstrates a lack of care in addressing my case, leaving me solely responsible for all the associated losses."

Review: Scam. Never book through third party like this website. Always book directly with the airline. The third party like Gotogate, hides or tricks you into additional purchases, which are free/provided by the actual airline. When checking out, i also somehow got charged for a "Standard" premium support for another $30. When i go to cancel, because i later saw this website had bad reviews and sketchy service if there are issues with the flight delays/cancelations, the special kosher meal and the standard support is shown nonrefundable. I go to Air Portugal and instead get the same flight and the 'special' kosher meal is free included. So gotogate certainly stole $10 for a free meal. They also added another $30 for a useless/tricky 'standard' service. i want a $40 refund!

Review: I booked a flight with Gotogate over a year ago, and due to a change of the flight time, I was entitled to a full refund. Despite their initial approval of the refund, I am still waiting for my money after more than 11 months of frustrating delays, excuses, and complete neglect.Gotogate claims they have escalated the case to the airline, saying they can‚Äôt issue my refund because the airline has not refunded them yet. However, this is not my problem as a customer. I paid Gotogate not the airline, and it‚Äôs their responsibility to refund me, regardless of any delay on the airline‚Äôs part. It is shocking that Gotogate would expect me to wait indefinitely while they fail to resolve this with their airline partner.The handling of this case has been nothing short of appalling. I have contacted them multiple times and received nothing but vague responses, with no accountability or urgency to fix the situation. This is an extreme level of incompetence for a company entrusted with managing people‚Äôs travel plans and money.The lack of communication and total disregard for customer satisfaction has caused significant financial stress and wasted countless hours and days trying to resolve this. What should have been a simple refund process has turned into a never-ending nightmare with no resolution in sight.To anyone considering booking through Gotogate, I strongly advise you to stay away. If something goes wrong, don‚Äôt expect them to be responsive. And if you are entitled to a refund, be prepared for months (or even years) of waiting with no guarantees of getting your money back.I am now preparing to escalate this issue to consumer protection agencies and will take legal action if necessary. No one should have to go through what I‚Äôve experienced.  Gotogate needs to be held accountable for their severe mismanagement and failure to uphold their responsibilities to their customers.

Review: SCAM! Avoid GotoGate at all costs!We purchased a ticket from GotoGate along with trip cancellation insurance, thinking we were covered in case of emergency. When we had to cancel our trip, they sent us a link to the Manulife website to file a claim and gave us what we thought was the cancellation policy number. GotoGate refused to connect me to a manager to resolve the issue, and every agent I spoke to kept telling me to contact Manulife, essentially passing the buck. Review: I booked a solo trip to Greece with Gottogate. My first time using them. One leg of my flight was cancelled by the airline months in advance but I had to inform Gotogate of this change, as they never even knew about it...I simply found out through my own investigation. The process of rebooking me on another flight was put off for months, right up until the morning of my supposed flight. I must have spent 15hrs on hold/on the phone (long distance charges nonetheless) with Gotogate trying to sort it out. It should have been an easy fix and we had plenty of time. I called every week for two months, and then every day, and kept getting the same answer...."your file has been escalated to priority" and "someone will get back to you". No one EVER called me back. As they were finally rebooking me on my flight, I was watching the clock tick toward my flight's departure. The boarding pass printed just as my airplane was pulling out of the gate. So I missed that flight obviously. Then I was able to get rebooked on a later flight and the rest is worked out. But the level of stress I endured in those last few hours, days and weeks leading up to my trip was excessive and completely unnecessary. Everyone I spoke to at Gotogate seemed completely incompetent and evidenced this throughout my dealings with them. I should have looked up reviews first and that was my mistake. Never again will I book with them. I never leave negative reviews but my experience with this company was ridiculous. Hopefully this will save someone a load of grief.

Review: The company is horrible. Seriously. Stay away and ignore any supposed discount they may offer.Once they cancel your flight, fail to reply to your emails, force you to call a number in the US (no matter where you are in the world), and finally do not get you a ticket, you won't be thinking of the few dollars you might have saved by trusting these scammers.It's not just the fact that they could cancel your tickets - it can happen, after all - it's the terrible, borderline scammy customer service that is unbelievable!I was supposed to fly from Hanoi to Beijing. They canceled my flight and offered another one. I accepted. They then canceled again and asked me to call them (sic!) to explore options. I had to reach out to a number in the United States - because they have no chat or WhatsApp like 99% of other businesses do these days - only to be made to wait for days till they finally offered me a new flight.But hang on, did they actually book it or reply to the half dozen emails I sent them begging them to please go ahead and reserve a ticket for me?Of course not, I'm only a paying customer after all. What was I thinking!Seriously, stay away and you will not regret it. Never had such a bad experience in years and years of flying.

Review: Dear All,There's an airline policy that most passengers are unaware of, whereby a return flight ticket is automatically cancelled, if a passenger misses the first original flight. However, there's a EU Regulation 261/2004/The Air Passenger Rights and Air Travel Organisers' Licensing Regulations 2019, that requires the airline or the booking agency (booking.com in my case) to immediately inform the passenger in a timely manner regarding the automatic cancellation of the return ticket. My cancelled return ticket from British Airways cost me ¬£492.39, via booking.com.British Airways were indeed extremely diligent and professional in informing booking.com regarding my return flight ticket cancellation immediately after the 25-July-2024.However, booking.com failed to inform me (the passenger) about the return flight cancellation as required by law. I bought a new ticket and got to my original destination.Meanwhile, instead of booking.com informing me timely about the automatic return ticket cancellation (as required by law), they did the opposite, by sending me a check-in email 24 hours prior to boarding on my return flight ( which was automatically cancelled without my knowledge few days earlier) .On the day of my return flight (29-July-2024), when trying to manually check-in at the Heathrow airport (British Airways), I was told the original ticket was automatically cancelled five days earlier.Due to the fact I had already queued up for longer than two hours to get to the front of the British Airways desk/booth to check-in, and was already past 17:15, it wouldn‚Äôt have been prudent to leave my first place in the queue to buy a new ticket from a different airline without knowing for certain if I would have had to queue up again to check-in and potentially miss my last flight to my destination on the same day (29-July-2024).As a direct result of booking.com blunders, I was left with no other option but to purchase another British Airways ticket while I was still in front of the British Airways check-in desk. The total cost was additional ¬£536.49 .Had I known about my return flight ticket cancellation few days earlier as required by law, I would have bought a new ticket for less than ¬£200.00, and avoid all the stress caused on the day of boarding the plane.After requesting a refund and compensation for the above-mentioned ordeal caused by booking.com, they have refused to comply (this also includes Gotogate). Even after contacting senior employees such as, Mathias Hedlund (the CEO), Glenn Fogel, and other customer service members of staff from Gotogate.As result, I'm seeking legal action against booking.com and Gotogate.Finally, I would like to take this opportunity encourage everyone to avoid using bookng.com for travelling or accommodation, as they have proven to be extremely unprofessional and a bunch of scammers.Stay away from them at all costs.Kind RegardsJC

Review: This is the same dodgy scamming agency as many others, showing competitive prices, clearly stated as TOTAL COST, not estimates, then doubling them when it comes to booking. When challenged about that, they say "maybe the airline changed their prices"... yes, maybe such pseudo agencies should be banned once and for all from scamming people! I booked my flight directly with the airline and paid less than gotogate quoted me! DO NOT LET THEM SCAM YOU!You say I failed? Good joke, you show the price for a flight change, 231GBP, name it TOTAL COST, then when it comes to paying you ask for 461GBP and you say "MAYBE the airline charged more". No, dear gotogate, YOU failed. You use the same dodgy techniques as many other pseudo agencies, false prices to lure people in, then the real one, much higher, but you hope people will just go for it anyway to avoid extra hassle. Low, dirty and sad, really. Can't believe booking.com is embarrassing and disgracing itself partnering with such a "business". Review: Worst Travel Experience Ever - Do Not Use This Agency!I recently had an unbelievably bad experience with this travel agency, and I feel compelled to share it in hopes that others can avoid the same frustrations.It all started when I booked a flight from Amsterdam to Delhi with a stopover in Doha. I paid extra for a check-in service, which was supposed to handle my check-in process and send me my boarding passes 6 hours before the flight. However, the boarding passes were never sent, and I received no information about my trip or any alternative instructions if the passes couldn‚Äôt be delivered. As a result, I was denied boarding at the airport because I lacked a transit visa for India‚Äîan issue that could have been avoided had I been given proper documentation or even a simple warning about visa requirements.Adding to the frustration, when I called to cancel just my outbound flight due to the visa issue, they went ahead and cancelled my return flight as well‚Äîsomething I never authorized. I clearly requested the cancellation of the outbound leg only. This mistake caused me immense stress and extra financial costs.I tried to get compensation for this, but the agency refused. They didn‚Äôt offer any compensation and even refused to refund the taxes that should have been returned after the cancellation. Instead, they told me to contact the airline directly. However, the airline informed me that the travel agency had control over the tickets, meaning they couldn‚Äôt help me either.To make matters worse, the check-in service I paid for didn‚Äôt work at all, and I never received the boarding passes that could have prevented this whole situation. Because of their unauthorized cancellation of my return flight, I had to pay an additional ‚Ç¨500 to rebook my journey. All of this could have been avoided if they had simply sent the boarding passes as promised.On top of all this, their customer service is a nightmare. The agents, based in India, speak such unclear English that it was almost impossible to communicate with them. I spent an additional ‚Ç¨50 on calls to their customer service, as they only have a US-based phone number. The lack of effective communication and costly phone calls just added insult to injury.This whole ordeal was avoidable, but their failure to communicate, deliver services I paid for, and take responsibility made it the worst travel experience I‚Äôve ever had. Save yourself the headache and avoid this agency at all costs!---

Review: Decided to book through gotogate as the ticket was slightly cheaper than going directly with the airline. Due to a wedding, I needed the name on one of the three tickets changed. Then the whole ordeal started..I paid once 40 EUR, but Gotogate told me the airline needed the new passports as proof. The gotogate representative ensured me he will "freeze" the ticket until I can provide the documentation. Upon providing the documentation, I was asked to pay 50 EUR again to reopen the ticket. When asked why, I was forwarded to the terms and conditions but there is no price named there. So it feels super arbitrary why for the same ticket and same request I needed to pay two different prices, apart from the fact that I shouldnt need to pay in the first place as the representative assured me.And once they submitted all documentation, I hear nothing. They said it will take 2-3 days. Nothing. I contact them after 5 days, they say "any day now". Day 7, nothing. Day 10, nothing. Everytime I reach out, they say any day now and I can reach out to the airline. The airline obviously says I made the booking through a different company and it is their responsibility, rightfully so. On day 11 I hear tomorrow it will be done. Tomorrow comes, nothing, not even a message or information that they reached out and learned something or anything.I can only give the advice: From my perspective it seems that their relation to the airlines is non-existent. Something that through the airline directly should be done in a day or two, I reached almost two weeks before I gave up. Every time they said in the next days but to me it feels like they have no power to provide a customer support that is necessary for an agency.In the end I was forced to ask for the passanger ticket, for which I needed the name to be changed, to cancel the ticket and add it anew to the booking. Obviously, as I was informed, at full cost to myself.I can only warn anyone to always go directly with the airline. Gotogate seems to have no control or power to help their customers in need, and the strategy seems to be 'just let them wait' without giving any information. Moreover, they give you arbitrary durations when something will be solved, just to prolong it not stick to it. And in the end, when the customer is forced to take matters into their own hands, they squeeze them for any EUR they can find, seemingly making up the prices as they go. The whole experience left me speechless and I feel absolutely abused, and I hope that my experience is a warning to anyone thinking about booking through them. Don't. Today is the day I asked for going the route of adding the passenger anew and canceling the ticket in the wrong name. Let's see how long this will take and if it will ever be done in time.Update 13OCT2024 (two weeks until flight):Still not one inch of a progress. Nothing, not on the name change, not on the plan B of adding the passenger anew. Completely left hanging, just a generic response from the gotogate team. Be smarter than me, don't book with them. You will regret it. Their Wikipedia says it all, check it out

Review: 27/9/24: Imagine my dismay today when dropping my bag on the check-in conveyor belt in Penang and being told that I couldn't be ticketed because I didn't have a visa for India, enroute to Rome.  My GoToGate travel document specifically states: 'IMPORTANT: print out this travel document and bring it with you on your trip along with your valid passport'.  So that's just what I brought - no visa for India, as it clearly wasn't indicated.  And it's a minimum of three days to get one.  Livid.So now I'm out ~AU$1k for that flight, which unfortunately departed on time (so no flight credit available), and this afternoon I had to purchase new flights totaling ~AU$2k, but getting me to Rome two days later than planned, which of course stuffs up a number of other plans I had with my wife, who is already waiting for me there.In this case, I'm not sure if Air Asia stuffed up, or if GoToGate stuffed up, as I'm aware that airlines do have certain responsibilities around situations like this one, but as a relatively frequent international traveler, I'd expect that booking emails, including attached travel documents, would highlight the need for visas, front and centre; with all the AI we have at the moment, it should be pretty @#$%! easy to understand and communicate visa requirements in about 10 nanoseconds.  Maybe 20 nanoseconds, tops.So now I'm off to Rome via Kuala Lumpur, Kazakhstan and Doha over the next two days, AU$3k lighter in my pocket, thanks quite possibly in part to GoToGate.  Thanks a bunch.

Review: Dear GO TO GATE,Providing you with details for my bookings below - FYI It's been more than 24 hours and I had no phone call from booking.com or Go to Gate - with any possible resolution for this situation. Its been a week since initial complain and no one got back to me.Ticket for 21/09/24:1052 48 40 14 158Booking reference N X Y H H LOrder 40-528598673Ticket for 22.09.2024E-ticket number1052482718895Booking reference: SYBTZFOrder number is sameGo to gate is receiving this negative review due to being a Booking.com Affiliate.Never had any issues with booking.com until this time and this is enough to make me and my family take a decision to never use them again. EVER. I had a flight booked with possibility to change the date of the flight. I reached out to to customer service and asked them to bring the date forward. They changed the date, made me pay the difference and Go to Gate sent me the new link with new booking for amended date. At the airport I got boarding pass went through security and to the gate when we came to realise that boarding pass was printed out for the old date. Following multiple calls to booking.com flight service my ticket was raised and escalated but not resolved on the day. I ended up waiting at the airport for 8 hours and had to make a hotel reservation while they are still investigating what happened, instead of prioritising me as a customer that has been unable to fly and was not provided any resolution within 24 hours - all because booking.com has made a mistake. I will make a formal complain and make the escalation as much as possible. In the mean time I will make anyone I know aware to avoid booking.com like a plague - A multibillion company in revenue.At this point I am not sure if this was error made by go to gate but because of the delay that this has caused and the resolution that was not presented to me on the day Go to Gate is also responsible.

Review: Gotogate often offers competitive prices, frequently providing some of the lowest fares available. This is especially true when accessing their site through Google Flights links.However, there are several frustrating aspects to the booking process, which I really don't understand why they don't fix or eliminate:1. Price volatility: Prices tend to increase if you refresh or search directly on the site, refresh the page or take time to consider your options. This creates pressure to book quickly.2.Short booking window: You need to complete your booking within minutes (3 minutes it expired!) before the price expires, which can feel rushed and stressful.3.Excessive upselling: The checkout process includes numerous offers for insurance and other add-ons. We got used to it as consumers, but Gotogate's offers are really long! While these may benefit some travellers, the sheer volume of offers can be overwhelming and may take advantage of less experienced buyers.

Review: Disastrous Experience with Go to GateI had an incredibly frustrating experience with Go to Gate. I booked airline tickets through them and received a confirmation email. Just three hours later, I got another email saying that my tickets were canceled due to a "technical fault" and that the money had been refunded to my account without any consultation or prior notice. This caused significant inconvenience as I had already made non-refundable hotel reservations, applied for a visa, and submitted a leave application to my employer.The refund process is even more problematic. The money is expected to take 3-5 business days to return to my account, which may be further delayed by international transaction issues with credit cards. To make matters worse, when I tried to resolve the issue by calling their customer service, I was on hold for nearly three hours before the call was abruptly terminated.Throughout this ordeal, Go to Gate has not offered any apology or reimbursement for the trouble caused. Their customer service is severely lacking, and their handling of my situation has been unacceptable. I would strongly advise against using Go to Gate based on my experience. Their lack of transparency and inadequate support are deeply disappointing.

Review: Dear Sir/Madam,I and my wife booked a flight from Istanbul to Bali with Qatar Airways (22.09.2024 ‚Äì 02.10.2024), using Gotogate company as an agent. I booked this flight on 5 September 2024. But the next day (6 September) I learned about the medical condition of my wife (high-risk pregnancy) which makes us unfit to travel, and applied for cancellation of our booking to Gotogate by calling your customer service in T√ºrkiye.Your customer service confirmed that cancellation was within the 24-hour full refund period of Qatar Airways and the ticket price would be fully refunded. They told me that I needed to submit a medical record only to get refund for Gotogate's fees as well, which amounts to a fraction of our booking amount. I explicitly asked again whether my ticket fee would be fully refunded because of the 24-hour period regardless of the medical report, and they said ‚Äúyes‚Äù.I submitted the medical report on the next business day (9 September 2024) through your system. However, I received an e-mail from Gotogate a few days later (13 September 2024), saying that "according to the rules set out by the airline, it is not possible to request a refund against indicated reasons". I called the customer service again, and they told me that the booking was already cancelled, and I should be entitled to full refund of the ticket excluding Gotogate‚Äôs fees. But they also told me that the relevant department of Gotogate has not responded them, and I should wait for their response.On 16 September 2024, I received another email from Gotogate, which says ‚Äúthe airline has responded negatively to our refund request. The airline has stated that they have reviewed the certificate sent but that it is not suitable for refund according to their own policies. ‚Ä¶ Since the airline has rejected our request, we cannot take any further action on this file‚Äù. When I called Qatar Airways, they confirmed this decision, and explained that the refund request was not made in the first 24 hours. I called Gotogate customer service again and reminded them that my original request was regarding my right to the 24-hour refund period, and it was their fault if they did not exercise it. They said this would be directed to another department, and hopefully refund would be granted. Until this point, I talked to the same customer service representative in each of the calls mentioned above, who was aware of the situation and remembered our previous conversations.After not receiving further notifications, I called the customer service twice on 18 September 2024. This time different representatives answered my call and told me that my complaint is being investigated through examination of previous phone call records with the customer service. When I asked about when this investigation would be completed, they had no idea. However, this issue must be resolved before the end of business day on 19th September 2024, so that I have enough time to take other actions with Qatar Airways (re-booking, etc.) before the original date of flight.To sum up, it is Gotogate customer service team‚Äôs fault that they did not exercise the ‚Äúfirst 24-hour refund right‚Äù on our behalf, although I informed them timely. Denying my refund is not only unfair, but also conflicts the information provided to me by Gotogate customer service in several calls.I demand full refund of my payment before the end of business day on 19th September 2024. Otherwise I will have to escalate this issue with the Financial Ombudsman services in both T√ºrkiye and the UK (where I am a resident), Swedish Consumer Agency (where your company is headquartered), as well as my credit card provider chargeback service.Regards,Edit on 20 September 2024: I received an email from Gotogate customer service today, which says: ‚ÄúAccording to the call records you made to our customer service on September 6, 2024, it is understood that you decided to cancel due to GDPR after the officer told you that Qatar Airways did not have a cancellation policy within 24 hours. In fact, it is recorded that you also submitted the GDPR documents requested from you after the cancellation. ‚Ä¶ Since the airline rejected our request, we cannot take any further action on this file‚Äù.This statement does not reflect the truth at all, since the customer service expilicitly confirmed that Qatar Airways had a cancellation policy within 24 hours during our call on 6 September 2024. It is a shame that Gotogate is manipulating the truth, and providing wrong information about my previous call with their customer service. I will proceed with escalating this issue to Ombudsman services and consumer agencies, as well my credit card provider chargeback service. Bottomline: Avoid Gotogate company's services at all costs.

Review: I will NEVER BUY FLIGHTS FROM GOTOGATE nor BOOKING.COM again.The first experience will be my last experience, as it has been horrendous.I actually purchased the flights via Booking.com.My Booking.com reservation shows the fare which I purchased correctly, it also explains the entitlements of the fare I purchased correctly. GotoGate cannot support, and now try to defer me to a 3rd company, their parent etraveli.com.I received an email immediately post paying for the flights, it explained that a second email will be sent later with the details. 15 mins later the email was received but with the basic fare conditions, not with the additional fare conditions that I had purchased (and which my Booking.com reservation shows).I immediately contacted booking.com to question the issue via their online support chat.The online support chat could not reference anything with regards to my reservation, except basic flight information.Later I  know it was not booking.com's online support but booking.com directed it to GotoGate support.The support told me to write to GotoGate's email, sending bank statements to itemise what I had paid for. Yes my bank statements show how much I paid but not what it as I was paying for.I sent email(s) to GotoGate, with screenshots which I had taken while making the purchase, which showed the fares options offered, and the fare price which aligned with the amount I paid, and the fare's benefits on my booking.com reservation.  I sent a number of emails to GotoGate,  GotoGate did not respond nor acknowledge receipt of one single email.I tried online support to get an acknowledgement. One agent told me I had not sent any information in emails to GotoGate. I copied and pasted some contents from various, to show them. The agent disconnected when I asked them, why would they claim I had not sent any emails?I tried the phone support directed to from Booking.com.Another lie, it was not Booking.com but was GotoGate pretending to be Booking.comI learnt this after 3 weeks of calling, when agents changed how they answered the phone to "GotoGate in partnership with Booking.com".This explains a number of the issues. i.e. GotoGate staff cannot see what is on my reservation on booking.com. They ask you to send screenshots, then do not acknowledge receipt of any email, even when asked to acknowledge.One phone agent did acknowledge that they were receiving the emails and attachments, and then acknowledged an old email in writing when I asked.."GotoGate" staff when pretending to be Booking.com agents, said I that I should raise a complaint on booking.com.I did raise a complaint, only be to told by Booking.com, that complaints can only be raised for accommodation reservations, and there is not a system to raise complaints for flight reservations. Real Booking.com staff in email exchanges. told me to call booking.com phone numbers to try get help. All of the phone numbers provided were blocked by requiring a "Confirmation number" and PIN number. Flight bookings with Booking.com instead provide a "Customer reference" number and PIN, which do not allow phone support.  I  made a hotel reservation with booking.com, so I could get through the booking.com phone system. The Booking.com staff said the only option they had was to direct the call to their "supplier"(GotoGate) GotoGate managers were supposed to callback in 48 hours, but no manager called within 2 weeks.I requested a callback again. which has occurred.The "Manager" repeated the lie, that I had not sent GotoGate any information.Then told me Booking.com did not acknowledge, the conditions which I purchased. I could not believe the person, after the first lie. They provided a mechanism for me to upload all the information I had previously sent to make my claim.Shortly after uploading 15 attachments and explanations, I receive a boiler plate response."After careful review, we regret to inform you that we are unable to confirm any errors occurred on our side."I did not claim the errors occurred on their side, but had expressed I believed it was the fact that two systems were being used "Booking.com" and GotoGate.I tried to follow up to see if their careful review was capable of answering the 3 simple questions.I received a response to contact a 3rd company "etraveli.com"Booking.com sold the flights and provide zero sales support.GotoGate, pretends to be Booking.com but cannot support the booking as purchased, as they have different information.GotoGate's agents lie.The systems are not in place. Smaller flight resellers I have used can acknowledge and rectify issues like this in 5 minutes. Booking.com does not provide any service.GotoGate wastes time, does not investigate, does not respond, lies, say they are not to blame, so can't help.

Review: I booked a family trip through Gotogate on April 9th, 2024. Immediately after booking, I noticed one of the passengers was missing a last name. I contacted Gotogate right away, as this was still within the 24-hour cancellation window. They told me I needed to contact Emirates directly.After contacting Emirates, the confusion began. Emirates stated that they couldn't make the name change and that Gotogate needed to handle it. Over the past 5 months, I‚Äôve contacted both companies multiple times. Emirates has been consistent in stating that Gotogate is responsible for making the change. However, Gotogate kept giving me different reasons for why they couldn‚Äôt do it. First, they claimed they couldn‚Äôt reach me, then they said the change wasn‚Äôt allowed, followed by the excuse that the name change was too long (more than three letters). Lastly, they claimed they‚Äôd have to rebook the flight but said there was no availability, which I confirmed wasn‚Äôt true by checking Emirates' site in real time.Gotogate said they would escalate the issue, but I only received the same generic responses instructing me to contact Emirates. After 5 months of back-and-forth and countless hours on the phone, they still haven‚Äôt resolved the issue. This could have been fixed within the first 24 hours, but now I‚Äôm at risk of having to purchase a new ticket and pay the fare difference.I highly advise against using Gotogate. Once there‚Äôs a problem, they hide behind vague excuses, avoid accountability, and offer no real solutions. My reference number is 1005-081-706. Save yourself the frustration and book directly with the airline!

Review: I booked flights to and from Turkey with GTG. Paid for 4 x hand luggage in each. Flight out was fine. Flight return home was told by airline at boarding gate that we had to pay ‚Ç¨80 euros to take hand luggage on. Showed them the GTG booking confirmation. They said they go by what is on the system and no hand luggage showing. We had to pay the money and were told to speak to tour operator about their error and request a refund from them. Done this several times by phone and email. Each time they apologise on the phone, listen to the whole tale and promise me that someone will get back to me and deal with it. I have sent the invoice from the airline several times, after GTG request this by completing an online form. They even wrote an email to say they made an error by not putting the hand luggage in the system. I request a refund of the monies I paid unnecessarily to the airline. Then when some time passes and I request an update, I get an automated message saying my query cannot be registered as the e tracker reference they attach to my complaint has been finalised and closed. Each time I try email after that, same automated response. I have had three(!) e tracker references so far and found the latest one closed without even bothering to respond! Do not deal with this company, their customer service is appalling!! P.S GTG my booking reference is 1008-977-839 ( so you can‚Äôt reply and say you don‚Äôt know what the reference is!)

Review: I rarely write reviews but Gotogate is next level bad. I have spent over 300 minute on the phone, and over $100 in international calling charges and am yet to speak to a supervisor who can hear my request.In a nutshell, the airline has a policy listed on their website that sounds a little strange, but hey - it is listed on their website in plain language. The policy relates to adding an infant to a ticket, so the option of not fulfilling the policy obligation would result in me needing to leave my son in Europe while my wife and I returned home. So it is not a small issue, it actually renders the tickets unusable if not fulfilled. Immediately after booking (via chat), I asked Gotogate to confirm the policy with the airline. The said they would but then a few days later I got a NO reply email saying "Contacting the airline has been unsuccessful" so they can NOT confirm and suggested I try contact the airline directly. From here I guess you can see where this is going. I spent hours contacting the airline (with whom I have no relationship), for them to tell me that they can not speak with me as the ticket was booked through Gotogate, but "off the record" they believe the policy is wrong and asked I request Gotogate to contact them to rectify the problem. So back to Gotogate I go, and again try to explain the need for them to contact the airline. They again refuse, saying it is too hard, and that they are not permitted to contact the airline. They suggested the BEST option I have is to cancel the booking with NO REFUND (~$1500 loss). I explained to them how that wasn't an option for me and that the airline had suggested this was something they would be able to fix with them if contacted, OR process a refund if a solution is not found. Gotogate refused to contact. In their eyes, the policy issue was an airline issue that they didn't need to help with (the airline didn't see it that way). And that the refund request, even though resulting from a policy issue, was not exceptional enough to allow them to contact the airline to discuss, even though the airline had recommended that action. Sure I'm obviously dealing with someone not very empathetic or bright, I repeatedly request to have the case heard by a team leader/supervisor as I refuse to believe their company policy disallows the action in such exceptional circumstances (I mean, I'm not just asking for a refund on a no refund ticket - its more complex) and asked for a copy of their policy in the instance they can't escalate. Note: This was so I can provide it to my insurance company to seek compensation, to which Gotogate obviously declined. So this is where we are at... as I said earlier, I have called the call center many times, sat on hold for hundreds of minutes, only to have my call ended in some instances "cut out", or be told that a supervisor would call me back at a time of their choosing, (however, always outside of my available hours) - resulting is a death spiralling No Reply email asking me to call the call centre and speak to a supervisor again. The process continues over and over. As I mentioned, this is by far the worst travel-agent/customer experience I have ever had -  stay away at all costs.By contrast, I had the SAME issue with Trip.com, I sent them a screen shot of the policy and an email from the airline saying they could not honour it. They (Trip.com) processed a refund within 24 hours.Do yourself and the world a favour. Avoid these crooks and let companies like this go where they need to to die. They do not service anyone and instead erode the services of good actors who have to compete with them for a few pennies.

Review: It is my moral obligation to do whatever I can to let people know that this company is a scam.Etraveli Group owns MyTrip and Gotogate. this parent company will do whatever they can to scam you out of your money and will deny refund for any reason whatsoever. look at other reviews that say the same thing.Imagine in any circumstance that a company sells you a ticket to a service or product that never once existed and then they proceed to blame the original party that they supposedly booked through. They never intended on giving me this flight.The flight was from Sao Paulo (Campinas) to Dallas with a layover in Fort Lauderdale. When I spoke with the desk representative for Azul airlines they had my name under a flight that was on a day 2 days prior stopping in Manaus in the Amazon then after going to Fort lauderdale and then dallas. I have never confirmed this and they booked me on a series of strange flights that I never confirmed. They are now repeatedly telling me now for the 3rd time that they are refusing to refund my ticket as "per the airline's rules" the problem is that this is not the airline's fault this is fully the fault of MyTrip for booking me on a flight that never existed. This company is a complete scam and should not be allowed to operate. My advice. this company doesn't want you to know that you can easily book the same flights directly through the same airlines that they offer for the same competitive prices, by booking directly you will be treated like a human being and you will also have the opportunity to gain airline miles and to get further rights to cancellation and membership. Don't fall for the ease of these 3rd party scams. By never booking with this immoral corrupt company the company will go out of business.Edit: See below reply, MyTrip has REFUSED to give me a refund for something that is their fault. They have booked me on a nonexisting flight and are pretty much telling me I won't get a refund for something that is completely their fault. This is criminal. Do not spend your money with them.

Review: I bought flights through Booking.com, but at the end they received the payment, but the flights were booked by Gotogate. I wouldn't have bought it if I knew it was Gotogate. I was at the airport for the first leg of my travel. By the time of boarding, the airline cancelled the flight. Small airport, so you are not in a position that they will put you on a later flight... First info we received, you have to call the company as there's no personnel in the airport. To cut it short, I've been over 4h now trying to get the flights rebooked. Booking.com passes to Gotogate, they say I need to contact AirFrance, AirFrance says I need to contact the travel agent... Really? AirFrance says they have cancelled my check-in so the agent can make the changes. Contacted Gotogate again, they say that it can take up to 48 h to rebook flights?!?!?! And any changes in route or airline need to be approved by the airline?!?!? Then they said that the flight status is still not showing as cancelled???? I received a message from Booking.com saying my flight was cancelled few minutes after the announcement at the airport, so how come Gotogate doesn't know it was cancelled? What happens now? Not only I'm doomed to miss the flight connections, but I will also lose accommodation bookings. If I buy new tickets, I'm afraid it'll be double trouble as I'll never see any money back.

The same excuse was that they were waiting on the airline to process the refund. The proposed flight has been and gone. Still no refund.I've now been just told that I can't be refunded because I was classed as a "No show" by the airline. But they told me my flight was cancelled. What the...?! Review: Booked a flight from LGW to DLM months ago, and we are due to fly tomorrow and after many phone calls to GoToGate over the last few weeks, they STILL have not told us the airline we are flying with. Nor did they ever call back when promised.Our email confirmation states we are flying with ‚ÄòHahn Air Systems‚Äô. After a lot of Googling, I found that this is a German company that bulk buy tickets and sell them to different airlines. Hahn Air does not have a Terminal at LGW, so currently we have no idea where to go at Gatwick.I finally spoke with an agent this morning at GoToGate who after having me on hold for almost 10 minutes told me that we are flying with ‚ÄòXC Airlines‚Äô, but was still unable to tell me which Terminal we should go to. They did however, provide me with a Flight number. I go straight to the Gatwick website after the phone call, and find there is no ‚ÄòXC Airlines‚Äô‚Ä¶It was only from a reddit post that I learned ‚ÄòXC‚Äô is the code for Correndon Airlines.I then attempted to check-in online at Correndon Airlines, but they have no record of my Surname and the Flight number does not seem to exist, and because of this, they won‚Äôt allow me to fill in a support ticket. They have to have a record of who you are, to be able to help you‚Ä¶NIGHTMARE!! Finally I found a phone number for Correndon Airlines and spoke to a helpful lady, who after a few minutes was able to locate me on the system. She had asked me for a PNR number, which GoToGate should have provided me with, but they did not. In the end, it turns out the Flight Number that GoToGate gave me was incorrect!!!I hope this review helps someone else, so they don‚Äôt have to go through what I went through to get the correct information needed to actually be able to go on holiday.GoToGate are one of the most unprofessional outfits I have ever dealt with. They do not provide accurate information, and the fact they couldn‚Äôt even tell me who I was flying with is criminal, especially for a travel agency.In summary:Hahn Air is NOT an airline, it is a ticketing system.Correndon Airlines operates from the South Terminal, and only allows check-in 24hrs before departure.*Since writing this review, they have called me to tell me I am flying with Hahn Air (no I am not) and need to check-in using their website. This is a disgrace.

I requested booking.com to put in a request and they said goto gate will contact me again. I haven't heard anything since (it's now been a week and a half since the cancellation request) so I lost the money and decided to book a new flight myself. Review: When I booked my flights through Booking.com (see separate review) I had no idea that I would have to rely on GoToGate to get a refund that I am legally entitled to after Saudia Airlines (see separate review) cancelled my flights. I have an email from GTG dated 19th June 2024 that confirms the refund request. According to that email, the process could take up to 10-15 business days, yet here we are 30th August 2024 and I am still waiting.GTG blame the airline and state they can't give me my money back until the airline give it to them BUT when I bought the flights through Booking.com, the contract of sale lies with the company I paid and makes them responsible for the refund. This is a point that both Booking.com and GTG fail to grasp. GTG have told me so many different things that it's pot luck as to whether their response is even remotely related to the enquiry! I've been told they can't give a timescale because of the situation (no idea what that means). I've been told their concern team is working on it and I was then told that the refund is pending and there's nothing they can do until the airline authorises it. Yesterday the same person told me two completely different things in two separate emails. I have an email that states my refund is in the hands of the GTG refund team and not to worry as this is the last stage of the process. Yet when I asked for confirmation that finally the refund is with GTG, I was told once again that the concern team is working on it... what? As someone who doesn't work for GTG, I don't know what each team/department does so I requested confirmation and clarity, yet this morning received a generic, copy and paste response which doesn't provide any reassurances whatsoever!I have consulted a solicitor and read at length, the information on the Civil Aviation Authority website. GTG are clueless and having a chain of companies involved just to get what I am legally entitled to, is ridiculous. Booking.com pass the buck to GTG and GTG blame the airline. In the meantime, it is me, the customer who suffers. I will never use Booking.com again because of this situation.Update after response - The correct ref is: 40-430759764. After weeks of emails and phonecalls as detailed above, I fail to see what yet another call will do.

Review: Like child birth I soon forgot of the pain I encountered last time a used GO TO GATE to book a flight, why did I not pay a little extra and book direct!So long story short, airline cancelled route, I have requested a reroute with alternative airline, as per UK legislation, the airline is actually a partner airline of Saudi air whom the flights are booked with. Go to Gate will only offer to refund, albeit judging by the reviews they don‚Äôt seem to be honouring. I want rerouting as we have a family safari/beach holiday booked to Zanzibar, there are numerous airlines offering the same route, same days, similar times. Saudi air when I ring them do not seem to think that is an issue but cannot access Go to Gates system on which the original flights are booked and the agent must liaise with them on the via the agents help desk as they are unable to make any new bookings. Go to Gate are claiming Saudi air are refusing to do this (in breach of UK legislation), I have asked for written confirmation from them to confirm this as it contravenes what the airline is saying, they have refused to do so and are no longer replying to my emails. My flight from Uk needs to leave on 19th October to meet our safari provide early morning of 20th October (which I have prepaid a large deposit). Go to Gate have left me with no alternative to start a small claim action against them, very stressful when all we want is what we are entitled to rerouting on a partner airline of Saudi Air. This has now been going on since 21st July and it feels like they tried to ignore you, rebut in a hope you will go away. Sorry Go to gate my family holidays are precious, nor will I back down when a firm fails to provide the service and fufil its basic obligations  which it has been paid for and is require to by law.Boooking reference: 1003-508-690

Until these issues are addressed, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend Goto gate  to others. Transparent pricing is crucial for a trustworthy service, and I hope they improve this aspect of their business.

Review: Go to Gate are scam artists, dressed up as legitimate travel agents, but their policies are in place to trip you up at all points, avoid at all costs. They won't make changes for free, despite airline policy being free. They will keep you on hold, so you time out of the "full refundable cancellation" refund.... which of course...  costs ¬£35 per passenger. They even block you accessing mybookings via email link once you have 5 mins left to cancel. You can buy their premium support package for ¬£21.99 but they will still charge for any typo's in names, even 1 letter or claim the airline doesn't allow this, when the airline tell you to contact them! In any case, buy the premium package and then cancel the booking, it will only charge you ¬£21.99 vs the ¬£35.00 per passenger fee, IF ITS TOO LATE! If you haven't booked, its not too late, book direct with the carrier or to someone like Expedia and avoid this scammy cowboy outfit!

Review: I strongly advise against booking with GoToGate or any other companies under the Etraveli Group. If the airline makes any changes to your itinerary, GoToGate will make no effort to secure alternative flights for you. I spent dozens of hours communicating with GoToGate, and every time I was reassured that everything would be resolved and that I just needed to wait. Since you booked through an online travel agent, you can't make changes directly with the airline until 24 hours before your outbound flight. Fortunately, the airline was able to adjust my flight 24 hours before departure. Additionally, I paid GoToGate ‚Ç¨45 in service fees for alternative flights, but they provided no service. Even getting a refund for these service fees has been difficult, and I have yet to receive it.

Review: I have booked a flight that for some reason it's schedule changed beforehand. I've been told I was eligible for a refund. It's been 4 months+ and I feel that they are the biggest scam ever. Everytime I get promised something, the last once was last week where the customer agent told me he reached to his superiors and that someone will contact me this week with a sensible update. Guess what? No one did! I've reached out again today and all I get is a generic response: We understand it's been more than 30 days, the refund request has been sent and you have to wait :)Happy days! Review: I recently booked a flight and paid for extra insurance for a European flight through booking.com. The partner company for this flight was GO TO GATE. The flight was made up of two flights and unfortunately the first flight was delayed which meant I missed the connecting flight. I called booking.com on the day who were not that helpful with booking a new flight, so I had to book my own, and to make matters worse the new flight cost double the original flight.  I have now been corresponding with them for over 2 months to have my flight refunded as per the agreement. I have spent hours on the phone, been assured many times over that they were working on it and yes as per the agreement the flight will be refunded. Today I received an email to say the flight arrived on time?!?! Therefore no refund‚Ä¶which is in total contradiction to every other conversation I have had with them where they confirmed the flight was delayed and therefore impossible to make the other flight. They have given me the runaround in every instance, in one phone call they passed me onto 8 operators - sometimes back to the same person, made me fill out forms, promised they were actioning my refund and then sent a generic email to pretty much say we will not give you a refund! I will keep persisting with them and hopefully they honour their agreement.

Review: I'm usually a bit cautious with using these kind of companies and generally prefer to book directly with the airline, or using a reputable company like Flight Centre.However, flights have become very expensive and booking through GTG meant it was around ¬£500 cheaper for a return flight from London to Sydney, so I decided to give them a go.The overall experience was pretty smooth. However, a word of warning: when you think you are paying for seat reservations, you are not actually paying for seat reservations. You are paying an "admin fee" to GTG to send the airline your seat preference, with no guarantee that they will honour it.And so it was that having paid to have an aisle seat on all four legs of the journey, I only actually got an aisle seat on two.To me, this seems dishonest and misleading. They shouldn't be charging for something that they have no power to actually deliver, despite what the small print says. And this severely marred what was an otherwise good experience.

Review: The worse company I‚Äôve ever dealt with. I was attending a funeral and had to change a surname of one of the passengers. I contacted go to gate 8 days in advance, I was told to pay ¬£35 and the change would be done. I chased everyday up until the flight and was told over and over someone would call me and it was top priority. The day of the flight the change was still not done. On arrival, we received a email from GOTOGATE apologising for the delay and if we hadn‚Äôt been able to get the flight to respond back to the email and they‚Äôd sort something out. Of course this was another false promise, we emailed back and no response. We were due to fly back three days later so again we spent our whole trip away emailing, chasing and calling. We were PROMISED it had been escalated and they were waiting on the airline. Review: I would leave zero star if I could. I have had such a nightmare with Go to gate. Please stay away from this travel agent. THEY ARE A FRAUDULENT COMPANY.I purchased a scandinavian airline (SAS) ticket with Gotogate in January 2024 to go to New York in August. Unfortunately, my partner had a bereavement and can no longer travel with the kids and I. Because my 9 months old baby has a different surname to me, he was automatically assigned with my partner. I have been calling gotogate continuously since June to reassociate my baby to my ticket so I can travel with my 3 children since they advised this ticket can not be refunded. Each time I speak to Gotogate agents they say the airline has not authorised them to change the ticket. The airline has informed me that no authorisation is needed from them makes such a change and that SAS cannot make any changes to third party agent tickets. When I ask to speak to a gotogate supervisor, I'm told someone would ring me in 24 hours, yet noone does. So for over 2 months, I have been given the run around, when all I want to do is travel with my baby. A week ago, I had a 3 way call a customer representative of SAS and Akash G. From gotogate and he confirmed to me that he can see an authorisation for this change. However, when I rang again to check the progress of this request, I was informed that thw back office cannot make this change as the airline have not given authorisation.My flight is in 24 hours and gotogate sent me an email this morning from a no reply email account saying they cannot help me as the airline have denied authorisation. This is very unfair and I'm so anxious now because the only options gotogate is giving me now is to purchase a new ticket. This is such a SCAM.

Review: BEWAREGoToGate advertises itself as an online travel agency and seller of air travel. It basically acts as a middleman between customers and airlines. As such, there is a reasonable expectation from the customer that GoToGate will give airlines your contact information in case the airline needs to relay important information, or properly forward that information. In this case, I had booked a flight with Air Arabia through GoToGate that was rescheduled for two hours earlier. I was not properly notified by GoToGate and arrived too late for my flight. When I tried to receive a refund for their mistake, they refused, stating they properly sent the update and that I should take it up with the airline, Air Arabia. When I reached out to Air Arabia, they showed the email they sent and it was not to my email address! It looks like an email address internal to GoToGate that they use. However, they should have provided Air Arabia with my real email address if they cannot forward the emails from the airlines properly.Furthermore, I received TWO reminder/confirmation emails from GoToGate within two days of my flight with the incorrect time listed! If GoToGate is a travel agency and middleman between the customer and an airline, they should not send customers emails with incorrect flight times, which is incredibly confusing and caused me to miss my flight.In summary, GoToGate failed me on multiple fronts. First, they failed to forward a critical update from Air Arabia that my flight had been changed. They listed my email address to their internal email address so that Air Arabia emailed them instead of me and they failed to forward this message to me. Second, they sent me multiple emails days before my flight with the incorrect time, giving me a false sense of security that my flight was scheduled as expected. Don't use GoToGate

Review: My family had an emergency that required us to book tickets for a flight on the same day. After placing the order online, I didn't receive any confirmation number. Instead, GoToGate only sent an email that says the following:"Thank you for your order. Your booking request has been submitted and is being processed by our team. Your booking should be confirmed within a few minutes. In rare instances, it may take more than 12 hours due to some airlines' processes and technical requirements. For these cases, we appreciate your patience. Please be assured that we will update you as soon as possible and there is no need to reach out to us during this period. Once your booking is confirmed, you will receive a confirmation email with your order number, receipt, and trip details. Whether you paid by card or via bank transfer, the amount has already been reserved in your account. Please do not attempt to make a new reservation to avoid duplicate bookings. Kindly note that the customer support center cannot provide further details at this time. Kind regards, Gotogate"We were very anxious after the booking reference/confirmation email still hadn't arrived 2 hours later. I emailed them a couple times, but didn't get any reply. I then called all 3 numbers I could find online, but it was impossible to get through without a booking number. The website says to use the online chat, but there was no button for it. So basically, we were told to sit and wait indefinitely without any information.Due to the high anxiety and uncertainty (especially since GoToGate's email said it might take over 12 hours to confirm the tickets, which would've been after the flight took off!), I ended up buying tickets from the airline directly.A few hours later, the confirmation came from GoToGate, at which point I tried to get my money back. Fortunately, they did refund me the flight cost, but charged $44 per person as a cancellation fee. I insisted that be waived because I only cancelled due to the fact that they didn't provide the tickets in a timely fashion - but they refused.It is completely unacceptable that they won't speak to you unless you have your booking/order number. If I could've gotten ahold of someone to reassure me that the tickets would be issued in a timely fashion (so my family could plan their trip and not miss their flight), then I might not have needed to cancel!

Review: Beware, airlines change flights very often prior to the departure date. Go-To-Gate charges for helping you dealing with the route/time changes, but they will not contact the airline companies to actually sort the issue.They will charge you fraudulent additional fees, but will not help you handling the situation.In my case, after more than 10 calls, the go-to-gate call center staff explicitly told me they don't call the airline companies. They send useless emails that are never read by the airline companies. Therefore, you will spend extra money and yet travel on dates/times that are not the ones you expected.I called the airline (Azul +1 888 587 2985) myself and had everything sorted, except they need Go-to-gate confirmation by phone. All Go-to-gate has to do is to call the airline and confirm the change for no fees. It would take them 2 minutes of their time, but they refuse to help.They might offer good prices, but you will eventually end up paying a lot more (fraudulent fees, hotel bills, etc.). Be ready to flight on connections that make absolutely no sense, with unexpected overnight layovers.

Review: Booked a flight to Vietnam through this agency. There a few stops involved to get there and back. I received an email informing me that the last flight had changed times departing 7 hours later than the original time. This means we will be missing our next connection and we would be stranded in the Middle East Airport all night. I got in touch with costumer service and they are the most unhelpful, passing the ball between different departments and giving you wrong information until you can't take it anymore. The main excuse they used is that I had agreed to the change when all I was trying to do is say I didn't agree, but supposedly click the wrong link on the email they sent me which had very confusing wording. I called them right away but still they would not listen. Moral of the story being it might be a little cheaper to book your flights through them but if anything goes wrong you'll be very sorry you did as they will be wasting a lot of your time and you will potentially loose a lot of money plus messing your plans and schedule.

Review: Tragic and unnerving experience. We bought a three-leg itinerary on Gotogate: Italy-Thailand, Thailand-China and China-Italy. Tickets issued by Austrian Airlines, last two legs operated by AirChina. One month ago, etraveli (Gotogate's parent company) notified us that the first flight's schedule had been changed by 10 minutes. They didn't ask for our approval, as they should have, but that's all right. The problem is what happened to our booking after this schedule change.Three weeks ago we noticed that the Austrian Airlines app listed our booking as a one-way ticket to Thailand, with no sign of the other two legs. Thinking that was because AirChina operated the flights, we didn't initially worry. Still, out of caution, we called the Austrian call center to check if everything was ok. It wasn't. They said that for all they knew that was indeed a one-way booking and the tickets for the two other legs had not been issued. They said the problem had to be resolved by the agency that did the booking (Gotogate).Here the tragicomedy starts. Gotogate's English call center (that sometimes we waited over 2 hours to talk to) repeatedly assured us that everything was fine with our booking. All they did was send us the PNR over and over again, and tell us to speak to Austrian, AirChina or both. But Austrian kept confirming that those tickets did not exist, and AirChina said that those simply weren't their tickets to issue. One week ago, I was lucky enough to be transferred to the only competent person I've talked to so far, from the Italian call center. He took time to verify, by accessing the Austrian system (why no one else thought of doing that before?), and confirmed that Austrian had never issued the tickets for the second and third legs. He confirmed that we would not be able to check into those flights without a reissue and said that they would contact Austrian to sort everything out.I was relieved, but I was wrong. One week has passed by and the problem has not been solved. I have called Gotogate's call center (both in Italian and English) every day and every single time I have been told that Austrian Airlines has not replied to their request yet. First I was told that everything would be resolved by the 27th; today it's the 31st. Yesterday I was told that it would take "some time", but they never know how much time. Today I've been told that they would reissue the tickets "before the 22nd of August", which is the date of the 2nd leg of my itinerary. But I'm flying to Thailand on the 7th!! I don't know who's working on this problem. There's never been any transparency. Two days ago I was transferred to an office in India that was supposed to be dealing with the problem. The guy I talked to wasn't even aware that the problem existed and kept telling me our PNR was just fine. I wonder if they are trying to solve this problem at all.Now, picture what would have happened if we hadn't called the Austrian Airlines call center and if we had trusted the first calls with Gotogate's customer service. We arrive at Bangkok airport to take our flight to China, only to discover that our flight does not exist and that we're stuck in Bangkok. Or perhaps it's even worse: without a return ticket from Thailand, maybe we won't be able to enter Thailand in the first place. Are we going to be stuck at Bangkok airport like Tom Hanks in The Terminal? I have no idea, thanks to Gotogate's incompetence.Do yourself a favor and never, ever book with Gotogate. Side note: their "flexible" ticket is a joke. When we still believed that our tickets existed, we tried to ask to change the dates of two flights. Also in this case, we had to call multiple times (and wait hours on hold) only to be told that "the flights are full" and it was not possible to change. Not for free, not by paying an extra: simply impossible. That was a blatant lie because the airline is still selling seats on those flights at the same fare we bought. So the flexible ticket is a scam and you should never buy it. Sadly, that's the least of our problems at the moment.

Review: I booked a WestJet flight on booking.com in the U.K. (Gotogate actually are the ones selling the tickets on booking.com). The flight was from YYZ to YVR- YVR to PVR with an overnight layover of 12hrs in YVR for which I had booked a hotel room. WestJet changed the flight (without contacting me NOR being contacted by Gotogate. The new flight was YYZ- YEG- PCR with only a 4hr layover in the middle of the night, so it was not use to me. I contacted Gotogate asking to cancel the flight as I had that option. I was told by the operator that I had to contact Westjet which I did. I waited 2hr before speaking to an operator who told me that it was Gotogate who should deal directly with the cancellation and provide the refund. I contacted Gotogate at least 7 time to no avail. Their customer service keeps telling me that they have escalated the issue with Westjet, but still no response from Gotogate to refund the fare I paid for the flight. It is by far the most frustrating experience to deal with an inept customer service which keeps passing the ball between me Gotogate and Westjet. This has been going on for almost a month. I demand my refund immediately. Failing that I will contact U.K. Trading Standards.   I would like to receive my refund not some bot responses which are empty of meaning and do not resolve my complaint with Gotogate! üò§

Review: I am writing to express my utter dissatisfaction with the service provided by Go to Gate regarding a refund that was already approved by the airline.About a year ago, I booked a flight through Booking, which uses Go to Gate as a third-party service. A week ago, I received an email from the airline stating that, due to destination country restrictions, they would offer a refund for the ticket. Several days have passed, and all I get from Go to Gate is that the ticket is non-refundable, communicated through poorly translated emails.When I inform the operator that I have the airline's email confirming the refund, they simply respond that my case will be forwarded to the appropriate department. This has been going on for days without any resolution in sight.The customer service is abysmal. They are unable to provide a clear and precise timeline, and every time I contact them, I receive a different response. This is even more frustrating considering that the airline has already issued several refunds for tickets purchased directly from them.Overall, my experience with Go to Gate has been nothing short of stressful and disappointing. I urge anyone considering using their service to think twice.

Review: We booked tickets through Go To Gate in June for a departure on July 24th. Unfortunately, they provided incorrect information to the airline. We have been in contact with their customer service team for the past week, who assured us it would be handled as an emergency. Despite this, we have not received confirmation even five hours before our departure. When we called again, they suggested we contact the airline in China directly. This is unacceptable and highlights the agency's severe incompetence.We had to cancel the tickets and request a refund. This is a joke‚Äîit has ruined our planned holiday. All our schedules had to be changed, including hotels, car rentals, and other tickets. When we inquired about compensation, they informed us that we would not receive any for the hotel and car rental costs. That's unacceptable.We will be filing a formal complaint with the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) and Trading Standards. Such a poorly managed agency should not be allowed to continue operating. This has been an incredibly stressful and frustrating experience. We strongly advise others to avoid using Go To Gate.

Review: I had booked with go to gate three times now and all three times my tickets would get cancelled. Go to gate will then choose tickets themselves and give us complete random timings and dates of departure and arrival. They then have the audacity to blame the airlines and say the airlines have stopped the flights. This is not true because the airlines would still sell the same tickets at the same times. Review: I would say, stay completely away from gotogate. They con you. I have had such a bad experience, I still can't believe this has happened. I booked flights via go to gate which was a huge mistake. My flights got cancelled by wizz air. I contacted go to gate after waiting in the queue for over an hour, only for them to tell me to sort it out myself directly with wizzair. Which I then did. Wizz air refunded my money, however they sent it to go to gate. For 8 weeks I was so stressed wondering were the money had went as wizz air had said it had definitely been refunded. I contacted go to gate who apparently had my money for 2 months but didn't think to contact me or refund it to me.  They finally refunded it to my account but taking ¬£350 of my refunded money for a flight which was cancelled.. when questioned them they couldn't give me a reason why they take that money and said it would be ¬£175 which i was not happy about, then they said it would be escalated and I would receive an email. Nothing happened I received the email with the money they will refunding but no  explanation as to why they deducted, which was now ¬£350, especially because they had done absolutely nothing to help me when I went through the ordeal of my flights being cancelled. They did absolutely zero and still deducted the money! For what! Yes I have read terms and conditions, and I still was not clear why the money was deducted from my refund. So I contacted your customer service which mostly have queues of 18 place, I asked for an explanation, he said it has been escalated and you will receive an email, which I didn't receive. All I got was a final total of money no explanation of fees. However gotogate thankyou for your response. I was expecting this kind of response after reading the reviews. In fact gotogate need to read their own terms. The airline cancelled the flight not me. So why have you taken a fee when your terms say no fee is taken when airline cancels???
