I could not get her to understand that all I should have to pay was a $7.00 difference between the two fares.  I have given up now.  I have used gotogate a few times before with no problems, but this is the first time I tried to use a flexible ticket.  I will not use this site again.

Review: My experience with Gotogate has been nothing short of a nightmare. I booked a ticket from Ahmedabad to Brisbane through their platform, only to find out later that my flight from Ahmedabad to Ho Chi Minh City was not included in my itinerary. This meant I had to pay again for another ticket, essentially paying twice for the same leg of my journey. What's worse is that Gotogate had already charged me for the entire journey but failed to transfer the money to Vietjet, the airline operating the Ahmedabad to Ho Chi Minh City flight. As a result, I was left stranded without a valid ticket and had to scramble to find an alternative, costing me dearly in both time and money. I strongly advise anyone considering using Gotogate to book their flights to think twice. They are not just incompetent; they are deceitful. Review: I used Gotogate only because it appeared as an option on Google Flights. I selected the flight and proceeded to pay for it. Timed out and logged me out. Checked my email. No confirmation. So, I go ahead and put in the information again. I successfully purchased my tickets. Then, I found that I received two confirmations, and my credit card was charged twice. It's no big deal, I think. So, I proceeded to cancel my first reservation. I found that they charge $44 per ticket for cancellation. $44 per ticket for their website issue? Crazy! So I contacted their customer services. I was online for an hour just for a few back-and-forths. Their responses were extremely slow. Nothing helpful was provided. They kept telling me that they could give me an "exception" to cancel my reservation for a fee of $44. I told them that I could do it myself on their website. The agent even blamed me for "not contacting them before the confirmation."I ended up canceling the reservation and paying $88, and I'm coming here to tell you not to make the same mistake as I did‚ÄîI mean, try to use Gotogate's service. AVOID GOTOGATE!

Review: I had a flight booked to Mauritius in May 2020. Due to COVID the flight has been canceled. Since then, I have called multiple times to get my money back (over 1000 euros) and they always denied my request by saying that Air Mauritius is responsible. On the other hand, Air Mauritius is saying that it is GotoGate responsibility. Sometimes Gotogate would say that they are processing it to get rid of me but nothing is happening and it has been over four years!!! Please don't book with them as they are thieves They don't care about you or your problems and don't take responsibility for anything. If a problem occurs, even if it's not your fault, you will just spend hours on the phone with them for nothing. It's not worth the small amount of money that you would save. Instead be safe and book directly with the airline company or choose a more reliable travel agency.

Review: Scam Alert: Avoid Gotogate at All CostsI recently had a terrible experience with Gotogate that I feel compelled to share to warn others.Firstly, this company is not even registered in the UK as they claim. This should have been the first red flag, but unfortunately, I discovered this too late.Secondly, despite their promises, they do not process refunds. I encountered significant changes to my itinerary, which, according to their policy, should entitle me to a full refund. However, after numerous attempts to contact them, I have yet to see any of my money returned.Lastly, their customer service is a nightmare. They will put you on hold for hours, clearly hoping you will tire and hang up. Even if you call them again, the cycle repeats itself with you being placed on hold indefinitely.Gotogate is engaging in fraudulent activities, misleading customers, and failing to honor their commitments. I urge everyone to avoid this company and save themselves the frustration and financial loss.

Review: I would rate this company 0 if i could - SHOCKING experience leaving me with almost 500 GBP being stolen. This company website did not work the several times i tried to book, claimed that my booking had not gone through, and that payment was not authorised and not taken. So after many attempts i booked flights directly with the airline. I then noticed that GotoGate had in fact taken full payment, despite informing me that payment was not authorised and the booking had not gone through. Called their customer service within an hour of the funds being taken, to which they initially tried to claim that due to time zones 24 hours had passed and i could not cancel the flights (which i had never actually booked according to their website). This was ludicrous as clearly it had only been an hour since trying to book / funds being taken without authorisation.They then eventually agreed to cancel the flights, however wanted to take a 70 GBP "handling fee" - despite the fact this is not a cancellation its clearly money being taken for a service not provided.The customer service team kept trying to trick me into confirming that i had a contract and was therefore cancelling, and eventally hung up on me and would not agree to escalate to a manager. Incredibly deceptive practices. I have thoroughly read their T&C's, and if booking via the UK / EU then there is protection via the European Comission. If any other customers face the same issues with this company (im sure they will!) then please please please follow up, contact your credit card if you have protection on that side, and contact dispute resolution services. As this company is clearly breaching commerical practices and should not be stealing money like this.Terrible, untrustworthy scammers.

Review: I was fortunate enough to be able to booked a premium plus seat (very front of the plane) from Air Transat using GoToGate in August 2023 from Ft Lauderdale to Toronto. I had booked the wrong date however these seats allow for free flight info changes. Now I did book the wrong date and that's on me but I tried reaching out the day of the flight and by the time I was able to get ahold of someone the flight had departed and then I was told there was nothing that they could do. I normally get email notifications of flights departing and when to arrive etc. I didn't get any in this case. I only realized once I was confirming the flight with my ride that it was for that day (a few days before I actually intended to leave). My biggest issue is that GoToGate said they couldn't do anything I would have to reach out to Air transat and Air Transat said I would have to reach out to GoToGate because I bought the ticket through them. My advice buy the ticket directly from the airline. Biggest headache is when both companies lay you off to the other one to avoid having to help in any way.

Review: 1. I booked the ticket with Gotogate and the air company decided to move my flight by 5 hours. I learned about it from my friends, who were taking the same flight and thankfully used another service. I never got a notification from Gotogate even when I notified them about this fact.2. Customer support is very lacking. The company doesn't list an email anywhere. The only options are chat and phone calls. I waited for 3 hours to get support on Sunday.3. Hell started when I wanted to get a refund. The company doesn't have or provide any timelines. When I finally got some timeline, it was 5 working days for an air company to respond to their request. Well two weeks later and 4 attempts to contact customer support later, no updates were provided to me other than "our team is working on it" and I don't think it's even true. My friends got their refunds from other agencies in one week.I had to file a CC dispute with my bank and I missed the time window to book alternative tickets for a good price. I'm sure it's ok if everything is smooth. But in case of ANY troubles, Gotogate is an absolute hellhole and generally a very frustrating experience. It's the worst company in travel I have faced in many years.

Review: I recently had an incredibly disappointing experience with GoToGate that has left me questioning their commitment to customer service and environmental responsibility. My situation involved a simple request to change an itinerary for a WestJet flight, aiming to reduce unnecessary travel and carbon emissions.Lack of CooperationDespite my attempts to coordinate with the airline WestJet directly, I was told that changes to my booking must be made through GoToGate. When I reached out to GoToGate via their web chat, I was met with an absolute lack of cooperation. The agent informed me that they could not make any changes, effectively passing the responsibility back to WestJet. This back-and-forth left me in a frustrating loop with no resolution in sight.Negative Customer ExperienceThe handling of my request has resulted in a profoundly negative customer experience. My simple request to cancel the first leg of my trip from Vancouver to Calgary without any interest in recompense was not only dismissed but has also created unnecessary worry about the safety and convenience of my overall trip. This inflexibility is unacceptable for a company in the travel industry.Environmental ConcernsWhat‚Äôs even more alarming is the disregard for environmental impact. This situation forces me to fly from Calgary back to Vancouver just to board a flight to Calgary again. Leaving me in this situation, GoToGate is indirectly contributing to over 109 kg of additional CO2 emissions. This unnecessary pollution is entirely avoidable and contrary to the efforts we should all be making to protect our planet.Poor Customer ServiceAdding to the frustration, there have been times when I was placed in a web chat queue with over 300 other people. I spent hours waiting to speak with someone, only to receive unhelpful responses. This inefficient system only compounds the stress and disappointment of dealing with GoToGate.Still Time to ActThe flights in question are not until the 24th of July, and I have raised a formal complaint with GoToGate urging them to collaborate with WestJet to resolve this issue for me as their customer. There is still ample time for them to act and resolve this matter, yet so far, I have seen no effort on their part to do so.Overall, my experience with GoToGate has been extremely disappointing. Their lack of cooperation, poor customer service, and disregard for environmental concerns have left me deeply dissatisfied. I urge others to consider these issues when booking through GoToGate and hope the company takes immediate steps to improve their services and policies.---To update this, a few days later, I spoke with the WestJet Management team in person about this matter. The Management team also consulted with the WestJet internal resolution team, who handle ticketing. They showed compassion and genuinely wanted to help, but ultimately could not. Both teams concluded that the flight leg cancellation can only be done by GoToGate, the third-party booking agent. Unfortunately, GoToGate remains uncooperative.As a result, I am stuck having to unnecessarily buy another airline ticket and take three flights instead of one to return home, all because I booked through GoToGate instead of directly with the airline. Ask yourself if you're okay with this risk before deciding whether to use them.If not, book directly with the airline.

Review: Update:October 6: zero feedback from Gotogate.July 31: updating this review with the latest timeline. No news from Gotogate.Next update will be if they ever reply. Until then they‚Äôll keep their on-star review.July 29: sent receipts to Gotogate for the checked-in suitcase.July 28: flight to YYC OK. Still no news.July 24: flight to LAX OK.We were nice and took only one suitcase for the 4 of us although it was a bit tight‚Ä¶ and because we don‚Äôt know if we can trust them to actually pay for it.No news from Gotogate.July 22: replied to their email to let them know that we will be checking in a suitcase as we are not allowed to have carry-on even if we want to pay for it.Asked them to confirm they will indeed refund the extra cost and not only try to provide for the refund.July 21: received an email from GotogateI received a mail yesterday (July 22 - our flight is on Jul 24) from Gotogate telling me that we if WestJet don‚Äôt let us fly with a carry on, then to pay for the extra cost and keep the receipts, and then they ¬´¬†will be trying to provide for the refund¬†¬ª.I am therefore waiting to see how hard they will try to provide for the refund and will update my review and the rating accordingly.July 12: Gotogate replied to my review (see below)‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîAvoid them at all costs.Booked a flight from Calgary to Los Angeles with WestJet through gotogate.com for July 2024.We specifically chose tickets with carry-on luggage.We had 2 issues:1- My 4 year-old son was registered as Master xxx and as an adult. This prevents me from adding his details on the WestJet website as they're expecting him to be over 12 years old.The confirmation mail shows that I entered the info correctly, but it got changed somewhere after that.2- Despite specifically choosing the Econo tickets (no checked-in luggage, carry-on allowed), we discovered on WestJet.com that we had UltraBasic tickets meaning no carry-on.We travel with a 1 year-old baby, we need things on board.I've been trying to get that fixed for 2 hours by chat and by phone.The person on the phone was just rude and useless: she did nothing, said it will be OK, and that we just need to get to the airport early so they can fix it.I asked about the carry-on baggage, she just said it will be OK without anything to prove it.She then sent me a travel document by mail with the same issues on it.The persons I had on the chat were just equally useless. Nothing was modified for my son, despite them saying he had been switched to child.As for the carry-on baggage, one same person told me in the same conversation that they were not included, and then 16 minutes later after I insisted she said that they were included.When I asked her to confirm they were indeed included she just simply closed the chat.My understanding is that they just don't do anything and don't want to deal with any issue after you've paid for your tickets. I will never use them again.

Review: Gotogate made the booking with the airline with the wrong personal details (including booking one of the passengers - a child - as an adult) and failed to book the extra checked baggage for which I paid. When I contacted customer support via chat (the only contact method available, obviously), and after finally getting past the automated assistant, the person on the other side proved completely useless. They started by responding to my request for assistance with personal details from other customers, apologizing that that message was not for me and after that asking for 5 minutes to review my situation. After this, they sent a message saying that due to technical difficulties, they would not be able to resolve the issue and to try contacting them again later. After 'trying again later', a different customer support agent, reassured me that everything had been resolved. I then went back to the airline to check and surprise, surprise - nothing had been. Based on this experience, I can only recommend others stay away. Next time I need to make a booking, I most definitely will.

Review: I recently booked my travel tickets through Gotogate, and I regret to say that my experience has been profoundly disappointing. Just one day after my booking, I received a notification that my tickets had been cancelled due to technical issues. This abrupt cancellation has had a severely negative impact on my family and me, disrupting our meticulously planned trip.We had organised our travel itinerary with great care, and this cancellation not only derailed our plans but also caused significant distress, especially to my two children. The emotional toll of having our holiday plans suddenly fall apart is immense, and it has greatly affected our spirits.Moreover, the cost of our tickets was approximately ¬£3,000, a substantial amount that has yet to be refunded to my account. This financial uncertainty is incredibly stressful, as I am now unable to book alternative tickets. With prices fluctuating constantly, I am deeply concerned about whether I will be able to afford to rebook our flights at a reasonable rate.The lack of prompt refund and the inconvenience caused by this situation have left me utterly dissatisfied with Gotogate's services. The failure to deliver on their commitment and the subsequent impact on my family's well-being is unacceptable. I find it difficult to recommend this company to others based on my experience.Gotogate's handling of this matter has been far from satisfactory, and I hope this review serves as a caution to potential customers. My hope is that Gotogate improves their service and customer care to prevent such distressing incidents from occurring in the future.

Review: If I could give a minus rating I would. Go to gate is a scam, they lie and try to scam you without explaining anything. Once I paid that, they then sent me another link 10mins after to make another payment the same price as my original ticket to get another ticket which was ridiculous. I have been trying to understand and get a reasoning as to why I am being asked to pay nearly another ¬£1,000 to change my ticket but they don‚Äôt have a valid reason why. I have been trying to get this sorted for nearly two weeks but no luck. I am in constant battle just to change my flight to a later date. They are unprofessional and do not know what they‚Äôre talking about. They keep saying they‚Äôll sort it out but they never do. Review: Avoid them at all costs. They are scammers. I booked a flexible ticket with them, nearly costing me 3,500 USD. Then I canceled it, and they only refunded 90% of the ticket value, but the catch is they refunded it via a voucher. Later on, I wanted to use the voucher to book another trip, which was a cheap one. I was planning to use the voucher multiple times. So I applied 10% of the value of the voucher and then wanted to use it again, but it was impossible. I later found in their terms and conditions that you can only use the voucher once. This was not made clear at all, contrary to what you find in my vouchers that can be used multiple times. I requested to get my money back from their support, and they declined my request. So basically, I lost 3,000 USD in a second to these thieves. Please avoid them. They are scammers and thieves.Updates: I just read their response. Review: Do not ever use Go To Gate! I am a very experienced traveller (work and leisure) and they have comfortably given me the worst experience in my life. They owe me ¬£1,800 and have not refunded this money since Janaury - applaling and has put me in a precarious financial position. My flight was cancelled by the airline at short notice in January, shortly after booking. As GTG are an agent, they request monies back from the airline first before remitting refunds. I know this industry and I know that often, agents will either not remit funds to the airline or the ariline holds it in a restricted account until the flight has completed. I had to coordinate both the airline and GTG to ask about who had contacted who re: refunds. GTG constantly said they had asked the airline. The airline consistently said they had not heard anything. After 2 months of waiting, I raised a chargeback via my credit card. The chargeback was denied as GTG had said the service was provided! The flight was cancelled! I was then told I had to wait for the chargeback to lapse before they would refund which was 12th June. Since then I have repeatedly called to which I am told  that the refund is coming, 5 business days... I keep waiting, I call back and now I am told the airline still has the money! It's 5 months ago! I am told they have to follow policy, however, as your customer you have not once called me back or e-mailed me, nor have you offered any compensation nor have you even tried to resolve it. You could just pay me from your bank account, but you won't as it's not "policy".As an experienced traveller, you will never have my money again. Truly appalling and stay away!

Review: I wish I knew how to give this company zero stars.  They have lied to me for over five months about a refund they were supposed to be processing for a canceled flight in January.  I have twice heard back from the airline that the refund was provided in February, I have gotten at least 10 emails in them promising that they are working hard on this, will escalate it, and that I need to be patient.  As soon as you have problems with this company, fighting with the credit card company as the people in India are nothing but liars and totally incompetent in what is supposed to be a straightforward refund process. Review: This company has the worst customer service ever.I have booked a flight last year that I had to cancel (with more than 2 months of notice, so it was not last minute). Obviously, they did not refund me money but they provided a voucher which was worth 90% of the final price of the ticket. Cool, right? Yes. Expect that the voucher never worked. They sent me this voucher on June 2023 and I have tried to book a flight using the voucher since December 2023. I have tried multiple times, and there was always something wrong. They even cancelled the first voucher and provided a new one. Same story: everytime that I was on the booking page, the voucher wouldn't be applicable. I have contacted the customer service countless times and their answer was always: "Just go on the website and book the flight without adding anyting else." and I'm like: "Well, this is what I've been trying to do for the past few months aren't I"Then, the day before the expiry date of the voucher (so one year later) it seemed that the voucher worked! So I booked a flight, added the voucher in the space, proceeded to check out...but the voucher was not accepted. However, they did charge me anyway for the full price of the flight! So not only I've lost 200 euros worth of voucher, I got also charged 160 euros for the other flight! And when I pointed this out to the customer service and asking to have a refund at least for the second flight that I got unfairly charged for, their answer was: " We apologise for any inconvenience. However it is not possible to have a refund." Looked (and still does look) like a scam to me.Now I'm also in the process of postponing another flight that I have (unwisely) booked with them again. And I booked a flexible ticket just to be able to change the date without having to pay extra penalties.Unfortunately, getting in contact with the customer service is the most complicated thing ever: they either send you "no-reply emails" or they suggest you to use the live chat in their website in which you either have to deal with an IA or if you are lucky, after a really long wait, are put in contact with an agent who's usually completely helpless and just redirects you somewhere else. I just have to hope that I will not lose more money this time again.Bottom line is: the web is plenty with online travel agencies and cheap flights websites. You'd better book yours somewhere else and stay away from this one.

Review: I booked flights to Vietnam through GotoGate. We're suppose to leave in a week. The flights will be operated by 3 different carriers. On Tuesday I got a mail saying my flights are cancelled by the airline and I got an option to rebook (actually, to be fair the new route wasn't a bad option at all). I did go for the option to rebook and were now Friday and I'm  still waiting for the rebooking. But because of the rebooking (which may or may noy happen) we will be entering Vietnam in a different airport so we need new visa's and the clock is ticking. GotoGate just keeps saying I need to be patient (I called and I mailed)To make things more complicated: the 3 airlines keep saying my original flights are still ok and our tickets are confirmed. I can see the flights in all 3 apps and in the GotoGate app. GotoGate doesn't give an explanation for this.I have no idea which visa we'll be needing, at what time we need to be at the airport and which flight route we will be taking if any... Just to say: I need clarification NOW and they're not giving it to me. Update: After calling and mailing again and again someone at Go To Gate finally figured out what had happened: our flights were never cancelled (even if I got a mail saying they were) but due to a change of the second leg of the journey the tranist to part 3 was too close. So now we just changed the last flight by half an hour and we should be fine. But all in all very stressfull and it only got resolved because I called and mailed over and over again as they we're just about to cancel everything (because of the alternative route actually not being an option), so the man on the phone told me.

Review: After waiting over a year for a refund, I can relate to each of the recent reviews on Trustpilot: "Cheating company", "It has now been a year that I had", "Waiting for supervisor contact", "Stay away it's a scam", "Consistent lying...." I experienced these also.I had a flight booked from Geneva to Vancouver in Premium Economy in May 23. Gotogate downgraded me to economy. I have spent the last 13 months trying to get a refund for the difference. The staff are liars. "I will resolve this for you", they don't. "I will call you back", they don't. Every call ends in "I have referred this to my back office team" - I am not sure a team exists as there is no resolution. Eventually they tried a low ball offer, which, when I called them out on it, they blamed on currency conversion. Seeing as neither ¬£, $, ‚Ç¨ or CHF are a factor of 4 from either other, I think this is another lie. They made another offer, which they reneged on. They refuse to share their workings over the fare difference. Unless you want to travel in a lower class than you paid for, and spend 13 months trying to resolve, I would recommend against booking with gotogate. Each review seems to get the same copy paste response from them. I think there are some items above that they can improve on.

Review: When I wanted to make changes to my flight booked through Booking.com, I was referred to Gotogate, which works in cooperation with Booking.com. When calling the Gotogate hotline, I was immediately offered the 'fare difference' for the change‚Äîover 2000 euros.After I pointed out that online the new flight was actually cheaper than the previous purchase price and that I actually had expected a refund, I was told that unfortunately, that is the price, 'calculated by the system.' There was nothing they could do. I was advised to try the change again later, as prices change frequently.On a later attempt, they again offered a hefty additional charge, even though the price for the same ticket had dropped online.After my second attempt and refusal to go ahead, I found the booking code issued by the airline in my emails (not to be confused with the booking number of Gotogate). With the airline booking code, I was able to manage the flight booking directly with United. And see... the change was at least free. For me, it is clear: UNFAIR PRICE CHARGES FOR FLIGHT CHANGES. AVOID GOTOGATE AND BOOKING.COM FOR FLIGHT BOOKINGS! BOOK DIRECTLY WITH THE AIRLINES! If you already fell into the trap (like me), get the airline booking code and change at the airline website directly.

Review: I am very disappointed with the service from this company. I've booked with them for many years and when you have no issues, you're fine; but if you have issues, it will be an issue. On March 12, 2024, I attempted to book a flight for two people to Berlin. Due to a payment error on their website, I ended up with two bookings within minutes and was charged twice. Unfortunately, I did not screenshot their error message. Despite immediate contact with customer service, who acknowledged the issue and assured a cancellation of the first booking and a refund, I only received a partial refund. CHF 80 was not refunded, supposedly due to the airline.Key issues:1. Their website allowed a second booking despite a payment error.2. I received a partial refund, which implicitly acknowledges their fault.3. I did not book the same flight twice on purpose. Who on earth would do that. The double booking happened due to a technical error on their end.4. I should not bear the cost of their technical issues.I have quite politely (!) contacted their customer service three times via email with no response, asking for a statement as to why I, as a customer, have to pay for their technical issues. This issue has been ongoing for over 3 months. I don't think I will ever hear back. Always screenshot errors!

Review: Yesterday experienced terrible service. Was given the best price via Kayak and then proceed to book a multi-city trip with Emirates. After submitting credit card details, a 'Payment Error' was given. I spoke to Customer Services who said that I should wait 2 hours and call back if no confirmation email was received and also I should check my card company to see if money had been deducted. This I did and on the second call it was confirmed the transaction timed out. So 2 hours wasted while the prices kept increasing. They said try again (with a different browser) which I did with resulting in the same effect. After waiting another 2 or 3 hours I spoke to them who repeated what was said previously. They also said it COULD BE one of THREE ISSUES : 1) 'The prices have changed', 2) 'a card company issue', 3) 'a connection issue' with the airline. BUT the point is that THEY COULD NOT advise what it could be. This means their systems do not have the simple ability to provide an audit trail to help identify what the problem is and therefore what to change the next time. In fact when trying to find my transaction they requested personal information PLUS THE TOTAL COST OF THE PACKAGE, which I did not originally note down. They then identified the transaction via a different method which was more inconvenient to them. How is the customer supposed to know that if there is an issue they will need the total cost, and in fact why does is this required when passenger name and other details are available ??? The people are trying to be helpful BUT their system is NOT CUSTOMER FOCUSSED. In the end I booked the flights directly with an airline successfully.

Review: On June 9, 2023, I purchased flights for myself and my children from Osaka to Rome through the gotogate.it website (airline: China Eastern), with a departure date of July 22, 2023. On July 8, 2023, my father suddenly passed away, and I had to return to Italy early. As a result, I had to cancel my flight and purchase a new one departing as soon as possible. Therefore, I needed a refund, if not full, at least partial, for my flight.Gotogate assistance informed me that, given the circumstances, I can request a full or nearly full refund. I provided Gotogate with my father's death certificate in English as requested, and they told me to wait for the airline to process the refund.I contacted Gotogate several times via their website chat and by phone, and they told me that they had not yet heard from the airline. On November 9, 2023, I personally contacted the airline, and they told me they had not received any refund request from Gotogate (the request most be submitted through the BSP system). I immediately informed Gotogate of this, and they said they would take care of it. On November 29, 2023, I contacted the airline again, and they still had not received anything. So, on the same day, I sent an email to Gotogate support, urging them to submit the request to the airline and process the refund as soon as possible. Also, on the same day, I contacted Gotogate via their chat, explaining the issue and asking for proof that they had submitted the request to the airline, but they said they couldn't provide it and would send it as soon as possible. They also responded to the email asking for more time.At this point, I decided to give them time, but nothing has been done after six months. The airline even contacted me to inform me that the ticket was about to expire for any changes and purchases. Additionally, the booking has been canceled on the Gotogate website.I have all the proof with email and chat.It is better to buy tickets directly from the airlines even if they cost a bit more. This is the second time I have had problems with travel agencies. Truly a terrible experience.

Review: Horrible Experience - Canceled Flight and No RefundI booked a flight with Gotogate for September 12, 2023, with confirmation code NSSVAY. They should not be allowed to operate with such unethical and deceitful practices.I will be sharing my experience across all social media platforms to warn others about this scam company. Two years later, they contacted me via email, offering less than 25% of the original amount and claiming the refund wasn't possible because my original payment method (a debit card) had expired. They asked me to choose a new refund method, but when I tried to access the gotogate.hyperwallet.com account, it wouldn't accept my phone number or email address. When I sought support, for multiple times, I waited over 40 minutes on the chat, and the support agent was unhelpful, simply advising me to wait for another email, and this has been going for 3 weeks now, after the 2 years of requesting the refund.

Review: (Edit after gotogate replied to my review): no, in fact I will share how incredibly unprofessional gotogate is to anyone who is trying to use your services. I already had my expectation for the level of the service before it got obliterated by your support in this matter and ignorance in the reply, and BEFORE you guys charged me for the flight that I couldn‚Äôt even go to. The reply was incredibly dismissive and doesn‚Äôt return my $304 for the service that was not provided. I‚Äôll change my review after my $304 (that I couldn't use) will be refunded in full to my bank account. Gotogate is an absolute waste of a company.I attempted to book tickets through Gotogate due to their competitive pricing and the appropriate tickets for the layovers we needed. However, the booking process was problematic. They issued two separate tickets, as two different (unrelated) trips to each other, instead of a two-planes for one trip. During the process with the first ticket the website was completely unresponsive after completing the fields of information correctly, and after buying the first ticket, we tried to secure the second ticket with the correct layover was unavailable, rendering the first ticket useless and costing us $300. They then denied our claim for a refund, asserting they had provided the necessary service, despite effectively scamming us with a ticket that lacked a connecting flight to our destination.

Review: This case has been utterly unacceptable. Never have I experienced such poor customer service and a company that deliberately tries to hustle its customers.Brief Background:I was denied boarding my flight as the airline informed me that, due to some new visa regulations in China, I could not board. However, the airline assured me that I was entitled to a full refund. When I contacted Flybillet (owned by GoToGate) for the first time, I was told that there was nothing Flybillet could do, as it was related to visa regulations. I informed them that the airline had told me I was entitled to a refund from the airline. Despite this, Flybillet denied that they could do anything. As this did not align with the information from the airline, I called back and demanded they investigate the matter further. After 45 minutes of back-and-forth, during which they repeatedly tried to offer me a cancellation that would only refund 90 EUR of my 500 EUR, they agreed to investigate further, but only if I got the airline to state in writing that they would speak with Flybillet.I contacted the airline, which said that since Flybillet had purchased the ticket, they could only discuss the matter with the ticket purchaser. However, the airline informed me that they had made a note on my e-ticket stating that I was entitled to full compensation. I called Flybillet back and relayed this information, and they said they would proceed with it.After a month, Flybillet called back to inform me that they would not be able to refund my ticket and could only offer me the 90 EUR remaining after canceling the ticket, claiming the airline would not permit the refund. I refused to accept this, as I had received confirmation from the airline that I was entitled to a refund. It did not appear that they had contacted the airline, so I asked them to contact the airline again and provide me with a written rejection. This resulted in Flybillet contacting me after 5 weeks with information that the airline had approved a full refund of 500 EUR, as they had stated all along.One can therefore conclude that Flybillet repeatedly tried to cheat me out of my money, misinform me, avoid paying what was rightfully mine, and failed to do their job. Never have I experienced anything like this. So if you ever find yourself in the same situation, do not let Flybillet deceive you. Keep fighting. Now, it is just a matter of waiting to see if I receive my money...

Even after waiting an additional week, there was still no sign of the refund.Customer Service Challenges: Contacting Gotogate's customer service has been a nightmare. Long hold times, dropped calls, and vague responses from representatives have made it impossible to get a clear status update on my refund.Conflicting Information: Different representatives provided conflicting information about the refund status, adding to my frustration and confusion.Escalation Attempts: Attempts to escalate the issue to a supervisor or manager were ignored or denied, leaving me without any effective resolution.Financial Impact: The missing refund has caused significant financial strain, especially since I had to book a replacement flight through another provider.Lack of Accountability: Despite their policies and assurances, Gotogate has not taken responsibility for processing my refund. The lack of clear communication and accountability has made the entire process unnecessarily difficult and frustrating.Conclusion:This experience with Gotogate has been incredibly disappointing. Despite their claims, I have yet to receive my refund. I urge Gotogate to address this issue promptly and ensure that customers are treated fairly and transparently.PS: If you refund money, then I will update my review in here!!!!!!!Order Number: 1005-368-079They are still playing by replying with jokes. Previously, they told me that when the refund is complete, I will get an email. Now, they want my bank statement, which is a joke. Additionaly, they are posting a lot of fake 5+ which is fake! So, do not believe any positive comment!

Review: I had a return flight with 3 legs that I needed to change. 1st attempt: I used the live chat, thought I had it resolved in about 20 minutes. Several hours later I received an option where the 3rd flight departed before the 2nd one arrived. 2nd attempt, got back on livechat, had about 40 minutes on waiting before being disconnected. 3rd attempt, again about 40 minutes waiting before being disconnected. 4th attempt, got through after about 30 mins, several hours later I received 2 emails with the same incorrect 3rd flight. 5th attempt, about one hour waiting, get through to someone with very poor English, but this can be worked around, but this person genuinely seemed to have a very hard time grasping that the 3rd flight left before the 2nd arrived. Said he could see that his colleagues had sent me an option so he thought it was resolved. That was the limit of the computational capacity. He eventually tells me that he will refer me to another department who will get back to me. I‚Äôm 3 days in at this point, with the flights getting more expensive daily.  I wait another 3 days and hear nothing. I give up and contact the airlines directly to change the flights myself, 2 of them I can, the 3rd one I can‚Äôt, it‚Äôs locked and only they can do it. So I simply buy a new flight. A week after I get an email saying they have been trying to contact me by phone. I never received any calls. 6th attempt: I try to just get confirmation of what is booked to make sure there are no surprises. 30 mins waiting, the person I‚Äôm online with can‚Äôt give me any confirmation, needs 5 minutes to process my query. I ask could he please simply tell me what is currently booked, not sure why there needs to be an investigation. After 5 minutes he tells me he needs another 5 minutes, after 10 minutes he tells me he needs to transfer me. I wait for 40 minutes then give up. For as long as I live I will tell anyone who will listen to never use gotogate

Review: Reason for complaint: invalidity of the 4 tickets at check-in, attributable to gotogate.fr.Flight: Basel -->frankfurt --> BEIJING --> GUANGZHOUTo explain, I arrived at Basel Mulhouse airport at 6 a.m., before the scheduled departure time of 11:15 a.m. , along with three other passengers. However, the agent at the airport check-in desk informed us that the four passengers, including me, were unable to check in or board the plane due to a problem with their tickets. This problem could not be resolved on the spot, as we were told that an error had been made in issuing the tickets with Air China, for which your department was responsible. We were perfectly prepared to undertake the trip, with valid passports, proof of exit (for air and rail), and luggage that complied with size and weight requirements.As a result, the four passengers mentioned were prevented from boarding the plane on the planned date. That same day, I spent over 10 hours on the phone with your customer service department trying to resolve the problem. This resulted in an additional charge on my phone bill to contact Air China. Despite my efforts, no satisfactory solution was found by your customer service department. At my own expense, I had to make changes to the tickets, for more than 3000‚Ç¨, in order to obtain four new one-way tickets.However, even after purchasing new tickets from your customer service department, we continued to experience problems. I was forced to stay at the airport overnight in order to keep up to date with the airport service.Here are the problems encountered during check-in the next day with new tickets:- Passenger 1: no ticket issued for this person- Passenger 2: no ticket issued for this person- Passenger 3: ticket with error- Passenger 4: this person has a ticket, but his name appears 2 times on the tickets (his ticket and that of passenger 3) when checking in at the airport.We had to contact Air China in China to solve the problem. However, each time we tried, Air China's customer service department informed us that a malfunction had occurred, attributable to your department's poor processing of airline tickets. After 5 hours of phone calls with your customer service department and Air China's, we were able to find a temporary solution with the tickets provided by GoToGate.However, to my astonishment and displeasure, on landing in Frankfurt, I discovered that Passenger 1's ticket was limited to Frankfurt and did not include the journey to Guangzhou. Similarly, Passenger 2 was unable to fly from Frankfurt to Beijing. Furthermore, Frankfurt airport staff informed us that the Beijing-Guangzhou flight was also incorrect, as it took place on 16/04/2024 at 05:15 (local time) instead of 17/04/2024 at 05:15 (local time). We were forced to buy new tickets from Air China for more than 800‚Ç¨ per ticket. I am outraged and consider this situation to be totally unacceptable in terms of the service provided.In addition, we had to spend the night on the ground in the airport for lack of transport and hotel reservations for the night. The moral and financial damage is considerable. Our professional schedule in China has been totally disrupted, and we have missed some of the trade shows we had planned to visit.I am deeply disappointed with the level of service provided by GoToGate and hope for a fair resolution to compensate for the inconvenience caused. I urge GoToGate to address these issues promptly and take responsibility for the disruptions caused to their customers. In the event of a compensation, I will be able to change my mind.

Review: We booked a return flight via booking.comThe flight was unfortunately cancelled due to a strike.We then had to buy last minute tickets but were told not to worry we would receive the money back from the original flight.So we have now been waiting since the flight was cancelled in February 2024 for the refund (now April 29 2024)The last update was February 8th and it says that Go to Gate contacted the airline. Since then we have had nothing, no refund, just lies.After innumerable phone calls (one positive- they do answer the phone!) but by the 10th call you finally realise there is no personal service here. The calls are scripted and the same conversation is had every time with many apologies for the delay, told to wait a bit longer etc. I can actually now predict what they will say. You have hope at first but over the months you realise its all a total pretence.In the mean time I have personally been in touch with the airline and in the last three months, and I have this in writing, they say they have had nothing from Go to Gate. Our ticket is still showing as Open on their system which means that they can do nothing and will do nothing, as why would they if they haven't had anything from Go to Gate? If they had, there would be some movement now. But they have not had anything. I have it in writing.I have sent a copy of this to Go to Gate many times but no one responds. You just get a variation on the same reply telling you exactly what they said on the phone...over and over again.Then try to get on to booking.com to get help from them is even worse. You have to put your customer ref no before an email or into their phone system and does it work? No.So you are sent round and round in circles.Every time someone says they will help at Go to Gate- they will escalate it to the concerned team, but it's absolute rubbish because when you phone the following week absolutely nothing has been done and no one helps you.Its so frustrating as we are totally entitled to a refund. It is our money.I will 100% never book anything with Booking.com again or recommend anything to do with them to anyone.PS if anyone from go to gate decides to respond to this, I have added the reference code!!!!writing after Go got Gate responded- please note that on other reviews when they respond they say that they would have helped but the reviewer did not put their reference number.I did put our reference number but please note that they have not offered to help in anyway!!!It is now May 12th 2024 and they still have not issued a refund!!!!!

Review: GotoGate has been my worst nightmare. My recent experience with them was nothing short of a disaster. It all started when my luggage got delayed, causing me immense inconvenience and stress. To make matters worse, I missed my connection due to the self-transfer process, which GotoGate supposedly facilitates. But the real nightmare began when I requested a refund, as per their own policy. Despite their website clearly stating that refunds are available under such circumstances, they outright denied my request. Their excuse? They couldn't find my flight or had no control over my booking. This is utter nonsense and a blatant disregard for their own policies.The level of incompetence and lack of accountability displayed by GotoGate is appalling. Their customer service is non-existent, and their refusal to honor their own refund policy is outrageous. This has been the worst customer experience I've ever had with an airline or booking service.I urge anyone considering booking with GotoGate to think twice. Save yourself the headache and frustration. As for me, I demand a resolution to this matter. GotoGate, please follow up with me promptly to solve this issue.

Review: I booked a return flight with Booking.com back in December 2023 for internal flights in Thailand in March 2024. The booking was handled by Gotogate although the payment was taken by Booking.com. in late Feb, the airline, Nok Air, cancelled the outbound flight. As our journey was time sensitive, we had to book with another airline. Nok Air and Gotogate subsequently told me that they could not refund the outbound leg only, and could only refund if I cancelled the return leg. This I did. Nok Air confirmed on March 3rd that a refund had been processed to Gotogate and would be refunded to me within 45 days. Now, almost 60 days later, I have no refund, and both Booking.com and Gotogate do not seem to understand the issue, sending the same standard email as they did two months ago. Disgraceful and unacceptable from both Booking.com and Gotogate. I am now investigating alternative steps to ensure I receive the refund to which I am entitled.

Review: I am adding to a review I left earlier this year as I have just discovered some extra information that I was not aware of. After GoToGate had unilaterally tried to cancel our flight home from New Zealand, without offering us any alternative (which they could quite simply have done) I ended up making lots of calls to them to try and sort it out. These calls were from Australia and NZ, but to what looked like a London number (although clearly none of the staff were in London but were somewhere in South Asia). They consistently refused to call me back or to provide an alternative way of getting in touch - WhatsApp, Zoom, Skype etc - that would have reduced the number of international phone calls I was having to make. I have just discovered what my phone bill was - and it is utterly shocking. It was hundreds of UK ¬£s. I can't possibly have run up a bill that big without the phone number being a premium rate line - of which there is absolutely no warning. It's just one more sign of their utterly rubbish customer service and it just adds to the feeling that this is a very sketchy company. It might be fine if nothing goes wrong - but as soon as it does, you are in trouble.

When I requested the refund from booking.com (and their contractors, gotogate.com), they only gave me a part-refund, claiming that the prepaid baggage was non-refundable -- even though Cebu Pacific confirmed to me that the full amount (including baggage) is definitely refundable, and confirmation that Cebu Pacific had already refunded the full amount (including baggage).That makes booking.com and gotogate.com liars and thieves.

Review: Despite meticulously proofreading all names and details, a simple typo in the last names of two passengers slipped through, only to be discovered when confirmation emails arrived. Not only was I expected to pay for their error, but I also felt a complete lack of willingness to accommodate my request, despite my loyalty as a customer and willingness to meet them halfway by paying an airline admin charge.Instead of promptly rectifying the mistake, I received a call informing me of additional fees required for the correction. Their solution? I was instructed to upload passport copies to facilitate the necessary changes. However, what followed was even more infuriating.This, despite the fact that the error stemmed from their own oversight. I requested the agent to reconsider these charges, as it's patently unfair to burden the customer for this. Yet I was willing to meet them halfway and negotiate To add insult to injury, I was told that an email would be sent explaining how I could raise a complaint against this issueg. However, to date, no such email has materialized. It seems that GOTOGATE  not only failed to resolve the issue but has also completely ignored my concerns and shown a lack of empathy towards customers.It's disheartening to witness a company prioritize penny-pinching over genuine customer satisfaction. Not only was I expected to pay for their error, but I also felt a complete lack of willingness to accommodate my request, despite my loyalty as a customer and willingness to meet them halfway by paying an airline admin charge.Save yourself the frustration and choose an airline that values its customers' satisfaction over squeezing every last penny out of them.I know writing this review won't solve my issue as the attitude suggests of the company (ignore and move on, this is not their headache stance) but at least it will warn others of potential such reoccurrence.I have been waiting for several days to hear back from Gotogate regarding a typo issue, but I have not received any response yet. During my last call with their advisor, they assured me that everything would be sent to me via email. However, I have not received any communication from them. It is evident that Gotogate is more concerned about avoiding negative reviews rather than resolving customer issues. It is disappointing to see where their priorities lie.

Review: I booked my flights for July 13-July 20 and when I checked my booking, the flights were both for July 13.  I immediately called the 'help' line and sadly, no one can actually assist you.  My case was 'escalated' to a 'supervisor' on April 19 and I have called back twice and my case is still 'escalated'.  Something went wrong from when I booked and I got my flight info.  NO ONE flies into Croatia and then takes a return flight an hour later.  It is obvious something went wrong and I can't get any help to fix this matter.  I shouldn't have to pay the 100 euro change fee for something that I didn't do.  I just want my flights to be correct.  Looks like I will be forced to pay for the correct date since there is no customer service that can help a customer.  The 3 people I have spoken too have been polite but all they could do is repeat that the case has been escalated and that the 'supervisors', who only work M-F, are busy because of Iran/Israel flight cancellations.  I understand that is important but I think my issue deserves better than waiting 4 days (so far) for a resolution.  If the customer service people can't help us, then what is their purpose.    **update**. As you can see from the reply, there is no help being provided and I have been told that the mistake is all mine. Great. So my trip to Croatia will not be happening and I will never use this ‚Äòservice‚Äô again.

ploy to keep your money. i then booked another flight on the correct days, trusting this would be above board. i contacted them a few times and was told to wait to the 10th of April. nothing happened, Review: I booked a flexi ticket.  I requested my flight be changed in plenty of time.  They could not help due to a technical error.  I sent around 30 chats on their chat system there was an error with this too.  The chats kept closing or sometimes it wouldn't open at all.  I tried to call and the line was dead.  When they finally managed to respond around a week later they told me it was too late to change my flight and I lost my money.  I have sent around ten email complaints and the people at customer services can't find my booking or history and don't understand the simple issue.  I have wasted my time and a lot of money.  They send template responses that make no sense.  They cannot seem to check the chat history or the email history to see there is a chain of events and proof I tried to cancel in time.  They claim they sent me an email I do not have in my inbox or junk. It feels crazy.  I think they are pretending to not understand in order to not compensate me for the flight I would have cancelled in time for a refund as per their T&C's.  It is appalling.  Please be warned.  DO NOT USE.Re Go To Gate‚Äôs response- the order number is 1004-932-280. I have contacted customer services by email 11 times and referenced the number and countless number of chats in their chat system so this reply makes no sense. I have received an email and it‚Äôs clear they still do not understand the simple issue or have checked the history of chats and emails and booking details. This company is a scam.

Review: Gotogate have been handling my customer service issue on behalf of Booking.com. I paid for seat reservations on a flight to Japan due to a medical issue- my friend needed an aisle seat. My reservation was processed by my friend‚Äôs wasn‚Äôt, meaning my friend had to sit next to a window for 17 hours. I asked for a refund and was told the fee was ‚Äúnon-refundable‚Äù. The terms and conditions do not say this. When I challenged ir, I was told it was the airline‚Äôs fault and to complain to them. After the airline investigated, they found that Booking.com had not sent through the reservation. I have just emailed Gotogate yet again and they said that they ‚Äúcannot find my booking on the system‚Äù. The whole experience has been intensely frustrating. Requests for their complaints policy or escalation have been ignored. I have opened a case with Trading Standards and will be pursuing a refund through my credit card instead. UPDATE (10/06/2024): GoToGate emailed to confirm that the fault lay in their system and have refunded the money. However, this does nothing to address the stressful and wholly unnecessary process of having to fight for a refund for something I did not receive. Instead of accepting responsibility, GoToGate said the fault lay elsewhere and did everything they could not to investigate or remedy the issue. I will be sharing this update with Trading Standards.

Review: Booking.comGotoGateAirAsiaI have not received a refund due for cancelled AirAsia flights booked through Booking.com. The airline rescheduled our return flight by 5 hours, and as we could no longer take the flight Booking.com cancelled our tickets and said that I would receive a full refund. This was when the nightmare began, as I was then informed that the refund request had been rejected, and as their booking partner GotoGate (I was unaware that they used a third party to make the booking) was unable to contact the airline directly I had to do this myself; which I did. AirAsia confirmed that the flights were fully refundable, due to the airline rescheduling the flight by more than 3 hours, but I could not request this myself as it was booked by an ‚Äúagency‚Äù. I sent copies of the online chat to prove this to both Booking and GotoGate, and have spent the last month contacting them to try to resolve this, each time informing them that the airline will not deal with me as the request must come from Booking.com or GotoGate, and each time being told that I had to contact the airline directly. I have even resorted to emailing Paul Downham VP of customer services in Amsterdam, which got me nowhere. This has been extremely stressful and upsetting, and must be resolved. It is a lot of money that I am owed, and following the assurance that the flights were fully refundable, I have spent the same again booking alternative flights.Who do I turn to??

Review: Would rate 0 stars if I could!This has been the worst travel experience of my life! DO NOT USE GOTOGATE or BOOKING.COM!I booked an international flight through booking.com as I had heard they were a large and reproable 3rd party booking company. Things seemed good, the airfares seemed to good to be true (because they were!) $1860 for international flights from Aus to Jap, Can and back to Aus. Made an online account with booking.com, entered my details, Full name, passport details and "display name" for website use. Done. I didn't notice at the time that the booking.c0m/gotogate system used my "display name" for my booking name. The "display name" was litterally the name used on the website when I logged in, my full name listed on the saved passport section of the website wasn't used in the final ticket! I discovered this about a month later and contacted booking.c0m/gotogate to get this rectified ASAP, my trip was in 19 days so I needed it done with some urgency! I got a response email: "Thank you for reaching out to us regarding your request to correct the name on your reservation. We understand the importance of having accurate information, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused."They asked for my passport details and mentioned it would be take roughly 72 hours to correct their mistake.16 days later! I received an email at 6pm at night on a Sunday with an alternatim:"We have received your request that you wish to change the name of a ticket in your reservation. We always need to follow the airline rules for the ticket that you have booked through us.According to the rules set out by the airline it is possible to change the name with their fee of 76.09 AUD. Also, there is a difference in the fare applicable at the moment of 1846.30 AUD. So total cost for name correction is 1922.39 AUD.If you want to change the name, you first have to pay the amendment fee. Follow this link to get to the payment page for your order:Please note that the link is only valid 2024-01-28 until 21:00 PM."They gave me a 3 hour window to pay more than the initial ticket cost to "change the name".I rang and spoke to customer service and disputed the payment as this mistake was theirs and not mine I should not have to pay the "difference in fee", but due to the short nature of the window of payment I would have to pay it if I wished to travel at all (a month of snowboarding between Japan and Canada with non refundable accommodation!) so I paid the amount and Lodged my request for a refund at the time but there goes my spending money for Japan.I completed my trip and returned home when I received a small ($133.66) refund, I enquired once more with customer service as to the reason for such a small refund when I was awaiting a larger refund amount, I was informed this was the refund of the seat costs on the initial ticket that was cancelled. So it seems they cancelled my first ticket, and re booked it under the correct name... not that they "changed the name" on the original ticket!The customer service person had a look and saw that I had lodged a request for a refund and confirmed that the amount of $1922.39 was being processed and was in the hands of the Accounts department but that they had no updates for me just yet, this was the 26/02 so just under a month from when I paid the extra amount.I didn't hear back from anyone in customer service or the accounts department until I successfully contacted them again on the 22/3 when I was told I had a case number and that the refund had been approved and would be paid in the next 5 days.Nothing.10/4 I rang and spoke to someone again who told me they would organise for someone from Accounts to contact me back in the next 24-72 hours.18/4 I rang and spoke to someone who gave me an email address to use so I can escalate things myself.So far everyone I had spoken to had promised to escalate the enquiry and organise for someone to contact me back, all the while saying that the refund was being processed and it would simply take another 3-5 days to appear!19/4 I used the email provided to me by the Customer Service representative from the day before and the email bounced back:"Your message wasn't delivered to ***.support because the domain flightsonbooking.support couldn't be found. Check for typos or unnecessary spaces and try again"This is the address copied across from the body of the email they sent to me!So I rang up and said I had been given an incorrect email address, the new customer service representative told me that there was no refund and the case had been closed on the 22/3 but he would get someone from Support and Refunds to contact me and gave me another email address to use..."Please note that we do not support any requests via this channel and we couldn't register your query in our support system"Worst SCAM company!*read before responding gotogate

We have an entire month long trip booked in Europe, hotels & everything!! I don‚Äôt need a refund at this point I was our flights!! We ended up calling the airline directly and not mentioning a 3rd party. The airline itself easily rebooked our flights. And by the way the entire itinerary had not been cancelled, the flights home had been changed only‚Ä¶we were still on the same flights leaving to Europe but no one from goto could bother to tell me that! STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY if you don‚Äôt want added stress!!

Review: I'd highly recommend that you DON'T use this company. I bought a Qatar Airways flight for my son from London to Phuket and paid EXTRA at booking to have a FLEXIBLE ticket. Review: I am writing to lodge a complaint against Booking.com in partnership with GotoGate.**1-** I made a reservation with you through the Booking website for an air travel from Funchal to Bangkok, with a layover in Dubai.**2-** The departure was scheduled for May 12, 2024, and the return for June 7, 2024.**3-** However, the airline responsible for the connecting flight Dubai - Bangkok, TAP Air Portugal, canceled the flight, informing us of the occurrence on February 10, 2024, mentioning in a official email it was due to the lack of payment from the travel agency(GotoGate).**4.** We contacted GotoGate to inquire about possible alternatives, it was mentioned there were no more seats available and the only acceptable option being a full refund of the amount paid, which was ‚Ç¨1,908.20 (one thousand nine hundred eight euros and twenty cents), providing the necessary data for this purpose, I have the official chat Interaction with the virtual assitant named Shashank in PDF to proof it was promised to me a refund, **15 of March 2024**.**5.** However, I have been awaiting the aforementioned refund since March 15, 2024, with no updates of my promised full refund.**6.** Gotogate is responsible for the correct execution of all travel services included in the contract.**7.** If a service cannot be performed as planned, for example, if a provider cannot provide a scheduled service or does not provide it as planned (e.g., ensuring transportation to or from the destination), it must resolve the problem at no additional cost to the customer. In 15 of March the virtual assistant advised me to buy new tickets from a different airline (which i did to guarantee I would have flights to my holiday destination).**8.** In this case, because GotoGate was unable to find a flight that would allow for the complete fulfillment of the contract, it is considered resolved with the consequent refund of the amounts paid, i don‚Äôt want a ree-boking since there was no alternative flights and I was advised to buy another tickets from Funchal to Bangkok and return also.**9.** From all the above, it follows that we paid you the amount of ‚Ç¨1,908.20 (one thousand nine hundred eight euros and twenty cents), which must be fully refunded to us. With our best regards.( I am filing a complaint close to European Comission and a lawyer. I have all the necessary attachments and evidence).

Review: Please don't use Gotogate. We had the worst experience with our flights to the United States. Gotogate contacted us a few weeks before our flight and let us know that the airline changed our flight. They suggested a new flight or gave us the option to cancel. We chose to cancel. Beware of their offers. I have read many reviews with the same issue. It seems to be a strategy of this company.

Review: My experience with GoToGate / booking.com has been extremely frustrating and disappointing. After my flight was cancelled, I had to wait two weeks for an alternative route to be approved, during which GoToGate / booking.com failed to communicate with the airline. By the time they attempted to book a new flight, the options were limited or unavailable. Moreover, their customer service team provided unhelpful, stock answers, and there was no way to escalate my concerns or submit a complaint. I'm still waiting for a refund for the cancelled flight, and GoToGate / booking.com is trying to shift the blame to the airline, which is unacceptable. Overall, I would not recommend using GoToGate / booking.com due to their poor communication, lack of support, and failure to resolve issues effectively.

Review: You will probably be shocked by the lack of customer care.  It is Organisation Neglect. This is my letter to them....Sunday , 15 April, at 23.53, I called to  highlight your flight errors for my booking. You changed all my premium economy seats both ways to economy seating.For my well-being, the economy seats are not suitable for me, and besides, I've paid over 2K for these seats.AGENT 1The agent clarified that it's an error on your part. Apparently, when I extended my return flight, keeping it as premium economy, you changed all my flight seats to the economy.Agent 1 promised me an escalated call back regarding errors made on your part. My flight was booked for 16th April at 19hrs, hence the escalation.You have acknowledged it is an error on your part and that you would take full responsibility to fix it. I was instructed to wait for a call back.NO CALL BACK RECEIVED.Monday 16th April at 11.30hrs I called again.AGENT 2 I was advised that AGENT 1 had NOT escalated my urgent query, even having recorded on your system my urgent situation and that it needed to be acted upon urgently, he made an error by not escalating it.Agent 2 apologised for Agent 1 mistake and errors in my booking, and that she would make sure to escalate and noted on their system that it is a PRIORITY for my flight will be departing in 7 hours' time.She also promised I would receive a call back and sort out my booking. Not to worry, all will be fine for I'm to depart in a few hours' time.NO CALL BACK RECEIVED 18hrs, I called againAGENT 3The agent apologised again and said the email AGENT 2 had written a PRIORITY email to the flight team and promised this time it would be dealt with.   In our conversation, there was no offer of an alternative flight, only to wait for a call back promising they would call back quickly. Obviously and strongly, I expressed my concerns so far. I have not received any information nor emails on how "you will fix this. "..NO CALL BACK RECEIVEDI left without knowing  if I would fly.The impact of neglect from you has put me in a precarious position not only emotionally but also other areangement and bookings whilst in Japan.NO CALL BACKTues 14.27hrs talking for 51minsAGENT 4Apparently, the flight team did not read the email sent by AGENT 3.Agent 4 says, " The flight team didn't call because they thought I was on the flight to Japan"!!! This obviously doesn't make any sense as none of the agents instructed me to go to the airport. I was to wait for a call back..and then he said "They didn't call because of their opening hours"!!!I'm was instructed again to wait for a call back.16.12hrs NO CALL BACK.It is beyond belief and outrageous how I've been treated.Words can not express the anguish, stress, and trauma I've experienced with your partner. Gotogate.com as a third-party travel agent is not fit for purpose.üö©There are only two solutions. I'm also taking this my situation to ATOL, my Lawyer, and Social Media. üö©I more than expect to be flown 1st Class for ALL THE  flights I've booked with you. And for my Journey stay, NOT TO BE SHORTENED.üö©Compensated for ALL FLIGHTS INCLUDING PEACH AIR DO AND JAL AND HOTEL BOOKINGS INCLUDING JAPAN RAIL PASS. Including the mental torment and indescribable stress and trauma your lact of action and care has caused.UPDATE as of 3rd May 2024Gotogate.com cannot find my doctors letter on their system even though I received a confirmation of receipt.  Copies were also sent to management and yet no one can find it.Having to communicate directly with Ana HQ, they have instructed gotogate.com to Urgently reimburse me fully. Unfortunately I constantly having to chase gotogate.com. They replies are "we're working on it" Quite frankly that is not good enough.The stress and my mental health is at an all time low. I'm deeply traumatised. The compensation is a very small amount.Gotogate.com are not ensuring my refund is urgent. It is also obvious there is no clear communication between the departments.The truth is often stretched to save their own hides.I will be seeking advice for support.I'm not one to take to social media but I'm understand now why people do. I shall follow suit.Gotogate.com replies on trust pilot are accusatory and empty. It is outrageous.

Review: Gotogate and its other brands put us through a price increase hell for 4 hours. What is supposed to be an exciting experience, one which is anything from cheap, turned into a sudo-traumatic nightmare. These companies are just evil, leveraging all kinds of IP tracking techniques to bleed you dry for every penny they can get from you. To hell with the lot of them! They take people to card verification and then increase the prices, regardless of market price.

Review: I booked a flight through gotogate at a cheap price (recommended by kayak.com). Everything seemed ok, got the reservation number and email confirmation from gotogate. but after a couple of hours gotogate emailed me again and said it hadnt gone through. They recommended to book directly with the airline - West jet- and said I would get a refund. I decided to book through booking.com instead as they gave me a better discount. To be fair, gotogate emailed me quickly and processed refund within 48 hours. I think there was an IT problem  with that flight because I kept checking with West jet to see if my new booking with booking.com had gone through. After 24 hours i called booking.com who said it hadnt gone through but sorted it straight away. Lesson: don't be sure the ticket purchase has gone through until you can login to the airline's website with the reservation code and check the booking is there.

Review: Completely Unregulated FraudMy partner and I booked flights to and from Cuba through Gotogate. We spent the additional money to guarantee additional legroom for the flights where we were able to book through the Gotogate system (the long-haul leg outbound was only able to be booked through Iberia directly- by the time I worked this out with no help from Gotogate who just said they couldn't book that leg, it was too late for extra leg room but as it was a daytime leg, my partner and I agreed this was low risk). We both double checked the seating and were happy to go ahead. The reason for this (particularly on the return leg) is that, in addition to being 6'4" tall, my partner has epilepsy and one of their triggers for seizures is a lack of sleep. The return flight from Havana was overnight so it was imperative that we make sure they were as comfortable as possible to get as much sleep as possible. When we boarded the flight, we aimed for the mid-rear bulkhead as that was where the seats on the seatplan we had booked from were located, only to find that they were in fact standard legroom, mid-aircraft seats and absolutely nowhere near where we had expected them to be. As the flight was full, the aircrew were not able to move my partner to an extra legroom seat and so neither of us slept. When we boarded the short haul flight from Madrid to London, we found that our anticipated overwing exit row seats were actually, again, standard legroom (gallingly, one row behind the extra legroom row).When I complained to Gotogate through their chat function, they accused me of making the error despite the fact that it was for medical grounds and, frankly, I wouldn't be so stupid (no-one wants to be in the air for eight hours wondering if their partner is going to have a fit just to save a few ¬£¬£). When I queried this and stated that they had put my partner in danger, I was told it was to do with the airline and that, unless I could provide screenshots of the seating plan I booked from months previously, they couldn't do anything. I then requested that they send me the seating chart and price plan that was being used and valid at the time of my booking. They refused. When I stated that if they could not provide evidence that it was me that had made the mistake then they owed me a refund, the agent closed the chat (on this occasion, I have screenshotted the whole convesation). Having investigated, it is clear that Gotogate is completely unregulated and so I'll be reaching out to the office of fair trading in order to obtain refunds for the seats at the very least. I didn't anticipate spending the whole journey home from a wonderful holiday in tears because of a scam booking agency but here we are.

Review: Stumbling on people‚Äôs experience here made me remember mine some years ago where I was scammed by GOTOGATEThey converted my ticket to an Open Return ticket valid for about 2years as I could not make the original travel date. When I was now ready with a date to book my travel, GOTOGATE became suddenly unwilling to help despite several frustrating calls and emails which lasted about 3months. It was obvious they did not want to rebook my flight because they were not going to make huge money from it. They kept tossing me about with flimsy excuses, ranging from a request that I book over the phone, and when I do so, I‚Äôm told to either wait for a call, or call the airline myself to rebook, or the airline system are down, or they can‚Äôt see my booking!‚Ä¶ you just name it!They systematically frustrated my efforts to rebook my open return flight until I had to give up and abandoned my ticket with them, thus purchasing a new return ticket as my chosen date was now near. Review: Customer service does not respond After my booking my flight in January I wanted to move my outbound flight forward one day. Gotogate makes you use their chat/call service to change a booking, however, for two days there were no operators available to respond via chat/phone (their words) and often after waiting on the chat for 45 mins I simply got cut off. On my third attempt I was told that they were unable to advise my about changing my flight and that their "internal support team" would email me. That was 36 hours ago.
