Review: My flight was cancelled by the airline in 2021 over 2 years later and a lot of fighting I still have no refund of over ¬£600 and I will not get it. I foolishly trusted them and initially agreed for them to chase the refund. Despite months of chasing and hours of phoning them it was only July 2023 they got through to the refund team of the airline and requested it. The airline refused the refund stating it was down to 'customers choice' - of course was not and should have been disputed by Go to Gate as they had all the evidence and were the ones to have told me the airline cancelled it. Did they email me or call me with this update? No they updated it on my original booking on the go to gate website which of course I never go on or needed to anymore or communicated with them about it. Now chasing up they tell me the airline says too much time has gone. They did not advocate for me, I had to spend hours begging them to do so, when they did they did it wrong and because of their error I now don't get my money back. Do go to gate have it? Do the airline? When I quite understandably got upset and appealed to the go to gate staff who told me it had gone on for too long and I had to go to airline myself (they already told me I can only go through go to gate) he hung up on me. Fantastic. Enjoy your sad little life Go to Gate! I've just received an email from the person who hung up and stated 'we have been told you want to reschedule your booking' so clearly they haven't read or understood any of my situation and didn't listen/understand anything I told them over the phone - once again, please don't book with them!!I'm lucky I'm not dependent on it or hadn't been saving up for that once in a life time trip and had other means. But please save yourself the bother and heartache, if they can't respect their customers and get a simple refund process correct- what else wrong could happen?

Review: Gotogate is a partner of booking.com and is responsible for all flights booked there.Since I booked the wrong flight and it could not be canceled, I did not take the flight I booked on January 8. According to the law, if you do not take a booked flight, you are entitled to a refund of all taxes and fees (which is usually the largest part of the booking). I have been trying to get this for almost 4 months now. Without success! At first I was asked to contact the airline directly, but they referred me back to the booking portal, from booking.com I was referred to gotagate. I have now written to them via the contact form, describing the case and asking for a refund of all taxes and fees. To date, I have not received a refund, even after repeated enquiries. They are supposedly waiting to hear back from the airline. However, it seems that gotagate is done with a one-time request to which there is no response. Despite repeated requests to contact me only in writing, as I am traveling around the world and phone calls would be unaffordable, they kept trying to call me. Does gotagate want to sit this one out?

Review: All seemed good - until you need their help. I made a simple mistake - bought the SAME flight twice. It was a complicated multi-destination vacation, I was arranging 6 flights for 3 people, and by mistake booked one flight twice. Simple solution, right - I immediately contacted the airline, please cancel one of the two flights! Of course, airline sends me to my travel agent who I booked it with, GoToGate. Their chat agent tells me, I need to get 'authorization to cancel' from the airline. Back to the airline - they say, no, there's no such thing as authorization, GoToGate should very simply contact our helpdesk, we'll cancel it, reimburse you! Back and forth for 3 weeks, I spent literally hours on hold with airline, chatting with GoToGate. I find out GoToGate never contacted the airline with this simple request, going in circles, very painful experience, my $400 absolutely unnecessarily wasted. When you buy the same thing in a store, you go back, show receipt, you get money back. Same thing here, I have all receipts - airline ready to help me - but had to go through GoToGate who were sending me back to the airline (that's NOT how it works in the travel industry). It really felt like I was dealing with amateurs, absolutely non-willing to lift a finger. Folks, always buy direct through the airline - then you get what you need without this hassle.

Review: We booked flights from Birmingham to Athens for July 2024, through gotogate, a friend travelling with the same airline booked direct, he found out direct from the airline that the flights had been cancelled and received a refund within 4 working days. I rang gotogate and sent a number of emails, it took them 3 weeks to acknowledge that the flights had been cancelled. They acknowledged this on 07/02/24, at which point I requested a full refund. It is now 31/03/24. Since then I have sent almost 20 emails and made a number of phone calls requesting an update on when I should receive our refund, their response has been that they are under staffed and are struggling to get response from the airline and therefore can‚Äôt tell me when I will receive my refund. Appalling customer service and I feel I‚Äôm at the point where I won‚Äôt be receiving my ¬£600. Any time soon, due to this I am exploring legal options to recoup this loss.

Review: i wish there was an option for zero star. We booked return flights for 4 people via gotogate, and then the airlines switched the times. We called gotogate to cancel, were assured it would happen within the week and no mention of any fees. 10 days later, when we call up to see what was happening - they told us that there would be be fees from the airline - $160 per person, per way - coming to $1280, not counting their own fees of $360. I was horrified by this - especially when i called the airline directly, and was told that when the airlines adjust the flighttimes significantly, it can be cancelled for free, but that it would have to be done via gotogate. I called back gotogate who assured me a callback within 24 hours - 10 days and i'm still waiting. You can't get through to anyone who can actually help you. My flights are coming up in 2 weeks and I've yet to hear anything. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!Edit: The answer from GotoGate is unbelievable. I am am TRYING to request a full refund from your agents, which according to the airline should be free - and the answer I got - after 3 weeks - was that it would cost $1,600 for this! THAT is the point of my review. After escalating the request and being promised a callback in 24 hours - it's been two weeks and nothing, whilst the flight dates are coming up and we have not been able to make other arrangements as they keep ignoring us.  And they have the cheek to answer publicly whilst ignoring the point entirely. This company is awful, I think their policy must be to ignore these in the hopes that we'll eventually give up and go away. Honestly, the amount of aggravation and time spent on the phone to customer service agents who refuse to help me is beyond compensation at this point.

Review: Stupidly booked flights through booking.com  who outsource flights to GTG. My flight home was cancelled hours before the two weeks deadline avoiding a compensation claim. Alternative flights were offered which i accepted. This was 13 days prior to my retun to Madrid from Saigon. Wanting to ensure I was on yhe alternative flight i followed up with GTG on eight occasions by email as I had no phone service over the following 12 days Using a borrowed phone I also managed to call twice. Always the same response we have referred your case to the concerns team. On the occasion of the second phone call I was informed that I would definitely get the confirmation of booking the next day. This was of course untrue.Eventually the day before the flight i was informed there were no seats on the plane  so I was abandoned in Vietnam  no further assistance from this "Trsvel Agency". I managed to book another night in the hotel and a flight to London the day after I should have travelled. The additional expense for hotel in Saigon plus overnight in London and flight back to Spain are not covered by the airline and GTG decline any kind of compensation for their lack of service or follow up with airline regarding substitute flight. Lesson for me-always book with Airline direct and never go near this this very unprofessional company again

Review: I recently had an exceedingly frustrating experience with Gotogate while attempting to book a flight found via Google Flights. The initial price listed was reasonable and prompted me to proceed with the booking process on the company‚Äôs website. However, this process quickly became cumbersome due to the excessive amount of information requested, significantly slowing down the procedure.Despite this, I diligently filled out all required fields, including sensitive credit card information, expecting to finalize my booking at the advertised price. Yet, upon selecting the payment option, I was confronted with a sudden and unwelcome surprise - a pop-up notification informing me of a price increase, approximately 20% higher than originally advertised.This unexpected hike not only wasted a substantial amount of my time but also felt like a deceptive practice, leading to a loss of trust in Gotogate. I ultimately decided against completing the booking due to this disheartening experience. It is disconcerting to encounter such practices, and I hope my feedback prompts Gotogate to adopt a more transparent and customer-friendly approach in the future.

Review: TERRIBLE! DO NOT USE GOTOGATE THEY ARE THIEVING LYING POS. I made a reservation from Amman to Tel Aviv in July of last year. I also made a reservation from Tel Aviv to Cairo in July. Since then a war has broken out so we are unable to travel to Tel Aviv, Israel. I called in December to get the flight from Tel Aviv to Cairo cancelled. GREAT! Flight cancelled, refund in my account within two days. I also called in December to get the flight from Amman to Tel Aviv changed, to go from Amman to Cairo. No problems, was charged $506 extra to change flight & was told within 2 days will receive a confirmation email. A week and a half goes by without a confirmation email. I then receive an email from them saying they were unable to change my flight and a refund would be issued within two weeks. Two weeks had passed, no refund. Which was strange because the last cancellation I had was with the same airline and I got that refund in two days, but nothing with this one. So I called them, they said I needed to wait maybe another week. Waited another week - NO REFUND! So I called and they said they were waiting on the airline. I said well can you refund me my $506 extra I paid for new flights that you could process. Sure - refund was in my account within two days. However still no refund from original flight. It‚Äôs now mid March and I have rang almost every week if not two weeks to ask what the hell is going on. Assured everytime my request is being escalated blah blah blah. So I called Royal Jordanian airline direct. They said they hadn‚Äôt received any RA (refund application) number from Gotogate & when they do receive it, the refund only takes 72 hours. So I called go to gate again and demanded I speak to a manager. Was told manager is off site they‚Äôve escalated it & would be called back within 24 hours.It‚Äôs been two weeks since then and still nothing. Called Gotogate again & all the sorrys and other crap they can come up with and yet still NO ANSWERS. Absolute pack of thieves. DO NOT USE THEM! They are SCUM!

Review: It should be NO star actually. Will NEVER use this agency any more.My first time to write online review. I have to tell you DO NOT use this agency! Extremely BAD experience. Because of health reason, I would like to update my mother's tickets to open tickets (an open-status ticket type at Turkish airline, which will charge 200 dollars later for rescheduling and of course need to plus fare difference if any). The agency said that the tickets that i have are already open tickets and i can wait until later after the departure date to reschedule. Then, I felt strange (if i miss the flight then it will be my own fault right, logically?). Then i decided to call the airline for verification. The Turkish airline told me that what the agency said was NOT true - my tickets are still "up-coming tickets" not "open tickets", and it is likely that the agency just wanted to cheat more money, because: (1) first, no-show on the departure flight - charge 400 dollars, (2) then, reschedule a new flight - charge 200 dollars. What is worse, often, when you will decide the new date and call them for reschedule / issue new tickets, the agency TOGOGATE will say that they cannot find your ticket any more in the system because that you have miss the original flight. So, you will lose all the money! Oh, that sounds very dangerous - then i decided to cancel the flight, because that I do not trust the agency any more. So i started asking how to do cancellation instead. Then, the agency told me different fees to pay - even the same service person on the phone told me three different sums / amount of fees just within 30 minutes. I was told that I cannot cancel the flight tickets myself or cancel it with the airline. By then, i had spent 2 hours on this back and forth. Too impossible to stand... So i decided to cancel the flights, with whatever fee that they wanted to charge. In the end, the cancellation cost me 900 dollars for my parents' two tickets. I asked the agency phone service for an email confirmation regarding this, because of zero trust on them now. They said that they sent to me twice, but i got only once. If i did not insist on seeing the email confirmation before hanging up the phone call, i do not know what would happen later. We will need to see what will happen to the refund later. Will update here as soon as i know.To sum up, I have been flying internationally with different airlines and various agencies for 20 years. This is the first time I felt extremely awful and trapping experience with the agency's service. NO gotogate cautiously, at least in my life! to mark it with the first review in my life here!

By the way I am a regular travellaer 7-9 times a year and never had issues with other travel website.Recently, I made a booking through their website for a flight, the following day I received an email that my flight has been cancelled and asked me to confirm so I can receive all my money back. I called them and they confirm verbally as well as by email I will get back all my money in 10 working days. After 3 weeks I was shocked as I only received one quarter of my ticket price. Upon contacting their customer service, I was met with 5 staff unhelpful responses and a lack of transparency regarding the reason of the refund, they asked me to contact the airlines which I refused as I got the ticket from Gotogate nothing between me and the airline . Despite providing all necessary information and documentation, I received no satisfactory explanation or resolution to the issue. I kept receiving an automated email kept asking the same every time for PDF file which I did it from first email. They did it in purpose as they don‚Äôt want to give the rest of the refund. It is evident to me that Gotogate Travel Agency engages in deceptive practices, promising services they cannot deliver and leaving customers stranded without recourse. My experience has left me feeling cheated and frustrated, and I strongly advise others to avoid booking through this agency to prevent falling victim to similar scams.

Review: One of our connecting flights returning from New Zealand was changed by the airline which made it impossible to make the next flight! Go To Gate informed us a month before the date of travel by email of the change, all good.We contacted them the next day to see if we could change dates, times etc and waited, and waited, a couple of phone calls to jog their memories untill 2 weeks prior to us flying it got to the point we hadn't heard anything so decided to cancel the whole holiday which was one of the options on the original email from Go To Gate.Now the fun starts!Phone call after phone call requesting that the flights be cancelled were answered and we were assured that the request had been put to the airlines until the day before we were due to travel when the last person we spoke to said 'I will need to notify the airline that you won't be turning up for your flight tomorrow'.....'WHAT!'.....the request for the cancellation of the flights was made two weeks before we were due to fly so why was there a need to notify the airline we weren't flying, they should already have known!Alarm bells are starting to ring!Anyway we get to 5th January (after a fair few phone calls in-between where we told by any number of advisors that as the matter had been escalated to their refund department they can't help us and to be patient!) joy of joy a refund had been received by Go To Gate and the payment would be processed back to our original payment method, usually within 6 days or if not they would contact us! Now there is no indication of how much money we are getting back, just one of the airlines or all 3 that we had to book to get us there and back but you cannot speak to the refund department!So here we are 69 days later, another dozen or so phone calls and emails and STILL no refund! There is no complaints form to complete, we were promised an email with a form attached....yep you guessed it, it never arrived....the threat of small claims court proceedings solicited quite a quick response but no further on and still another half a dozen emails with the standard we are dealing with your request!Go To Gate you are a joke of a company and I will be telling everyone to stay well clear of booking with you!We look forward to your response from our small claims court proceedings!

Review: Outrageous & unacceptable behaviour by GotoGateMy order number: MLCQ9SI am expressing my utter dismay and outrage at the outrageous and utterly disgusting behaviour exhibited by GOTOGATE in handling my case as a disabled passenger. Despite my repeated attempts to resolve the matter, I have been met with nothing but ignorance and negligence.I provided a cancellation notice for my order number MLCQ9S on December 16th of last year due to my wife's denial of boarding caused by a transit visa confusion. Despite this, GOTOGATE has continuously ignored my pleas for assistance. Their response, dated December 24th, 2023, was nothing short of inadequate and dismissive.GOTOGATE initially agreed to refund the return tickets, only to later backtrack on their promise and shift the responsibility onto WhizzAir and Saudi Airlines. However, both airlines have unequivocally stated that the refund must be processed through GOTOGATE, contrary to GOTOGATE's claims.I have tirelessly called and emailed both airlines, only to be met with frustration and dead ends. GOTOGATE, in a blatant display of irresponsibility, has washed their hands of the matter, despite being fully aware that the refund must be paid through them.This unacceptable behavior has caused immense stress and financial strain on me and my family. As a disabled person, I rely on the integrity and efficiency of service providers like GOTOGATE to ensure my travel arrangements are handled with the utmost care and professionalism. However, their actions have demonstrated a complete lack of respect and disregard for my rights as a passenger.I demand immediate action to rectify this situation. GOTOGATE must honor their commitment to refund the tickets as promised and provide compensation for the distress and inconvenience caused. Failure to do so will result in further escalation of this matter to the relevant authorities and regulatory bodies.I expect a prompt and satisfactory resolution to this matter. Anything less would be a clear indication of GOTOGATE's disregard for the well-being of their customers, particularly those with disabilities.Sincerely,Abdul Kalam

Review: I do not recommend to book through Gotogate and I won't do it anymore. I have booked my trips multiple times through Gotogate, but today I got a message of the cancellation of the first flight on my trip.First time I contacted the chat of Gotogate I got only one option to rebook the flight, by delaying 1 full day the departure, and duplicating the stopovers and the total duration of the flight. i asked if there were flights before the planned departure. I was flexible with up to 4 days earlier. The response is that they checked and there were no options. Obviously I declined their proposal and I did my own search with the airline. I found multiple options for the same flight as original ( or very similar with less than 30 minutes difference) for the 3 previous days. I contacted again the customer service via their chat function. This time the agent gave me the option to flight the next day, exactly same flight (so only 1 stopover instead of 2 proposed earlier) and half the duration of previous option. I informed the agent beforehand that there were options for the days before but the agent offered only the option to flight the day after which was not convenient for me. The agent wanted to charge me a fee to check other flights before the date. I found this very shady. The fee is not reimbursable if the airlines declines the rebooking. Therefore, I don't recommend to book throught Gotogate, because if there is an issue, they see an opportunity to get more money from you. At the end what seems cheap, might become more expensive. Note the difference in prices today is not that much, so it is worth to go for the airline directly. Less headache and less waste of time.

Review: Avoid this company. if a flight is cancelled, it is impossible to get them to book a new flight. Instead, they will try to force you to accept a refund and buy a new, more expensive ticket. You will receive incomprehensible emails with fake rebookings, when you meet at the airport, nothing is booked. You may try to call them, and you will reach a call center in India that will put you over from person to person 5 to 6 times and takes up to an hour before you reach a person that assures you that they will book you another flight and send you an email within 24 hour with the details, but you will never receive an email, or it will contain bookings that do not exist. The customer service told me after 5 times of calling them that I needed to directly contact the different airlines because they don't have access to the site. Therefore, this platform is absolutely useless- they don't even try assisting you and push you over to the airlines directly which actually can't even speak to you if you didn't directly book through them. I attempted writing several emails to gotogate, and also attempted calling several times and have received no response. Review: On September 5, 2023, I bought a multi-destination ticket with Gotogate travel agency for the Dubai-Jeddah (15/10/2023) and Riyadh-Dubai (22/10/2023) routes.This is a tourist trip. During the purchase process, on the Gotogate website, there was no reference to a flight or flights specifically dedicated to a religious pilgrimage. The same was true of the confirmation email from Gotogate.The cost of the ticket was 389.99 GBP which was paid with my card for a total cost of 470.25 EUR.On October 13, 2023, I received an email from the airline operating the flights (Fly Dubai) informing me that the Dubai-Jeddah flight was a specific flight reserved for pilgrims with "Umrah" visas or GCC citizens only, which I therefore could not take.On October 13, 2023, I called Gotogate customer service to complain about this unacceptable situation. Gotogate had sold me, without any prior information, a Dubai-Jeddah ticket requiring a specific religious visa. This is not the case for standard Dubai-Jeddah flights for a citizen holding a Schengen passport, which is my case. Despite my complaint, Gotogate's customer service department refused to admit they were wrong. The advisor offered to change the Dubai-Jeddah flight for another non-religious flight on the same day with the same airline (Fly Dubai) at a time compatible with my obligations, paying a supplement of 198.34 GBP, or 229.32 EUR (at the average exchange rate of the day 1 GBP = 1.1562 EUR). Faced with this constraint, I had to accept and received confirmation by email.Still on October 13, 2023, after receiving confirmation by email, I received a call from Gotogate's customer service department informing me that the ticket could not be issued and that there was no other flight available on the same day (15/10/2023) at a time compatible with my obligations. Despite my protest and the mention of the confirmation, Gotogate's customer service department left the file in abeyance.On October 14, 2023, I called Gotogate customer service again. The advisor again told me that there were no flights available for 15/10/2023 at a time compatible with my obligations. The advisor then confirmed that I could book another ticket with another travel agency or airline and that I would be fully reimbursed by Gotogate for the booking, i.e. GBP 389.99 + GBP 198.34 = GBP 588.33; this call was presumably recorded by Gotogate.On 15/10/2024, I booked a similar ticket with my card directly with Emirates for a total of 862.15 EUR.Despite Gotogate's customer service commitment on 14/10/2023, I received no refund by 01/03/2024, i.e. more than 4 months later. This is obviously shocking, scandalous and unprofessional on Gotogate's part.This misadventure represents an additional cost of 862.15 EUR (new Emirates ticket) + 229.32 EUR (modification requested by Gotogate having no effect) i.e. 1091.47 EUR.I therefore demand a full refund of my additional costs from Gotogate.@ Gotogate. Without immediate action on your part to reimburse me for all incremental costs (1091.47 EUR), the next step is a formal legal complaint for scam, false information. Reservation MHMSM7. Your detailed response is expected shortly.And a word of advice to potential Gotogate users: please run away from this dishonest agency.

Review: I booked a flight with Royal Jordanian through Booking.com.  Apparently they used Gotogate.I booked 2 business class airfares and paid 3392.87 GBP on the 31st May 2024 for flights in September 6th and 11th.  Booking.com order was OBHYAF. A couple of weeks later I got an email from RJ, saying there had been a change to my flight, it was now economy class, and have a nice flight!  No offer of a refund for price difference.  I contacted Booking.com and said I wanted business class, they said they could not do that (plane was economy only), I said I wanted a refund of the price difference, they said RJ would not do that.  I said I wanted to cancel and get a refund, they said OK, they would process that.  I got an email saying flight had been cancelled and a refund would take about 2 weeks.  This was in August 2023. A couple of weeks later I got an email from gotogate saying RJ had changed our seat numbers back to originals so our booking was all good.  However, the class was still economy.  And in the meantime I had booked new flights with Turkish Airlines (who were fabulous, I will say).So, then started a protracted discussion with Gotogate, which could only be done by me ringing their UK phone number (why? to prevent people ringing?)  They promised me numerous times that they were cancelling the flight, but it did not occur.  I contacted RJ direct, who were not very helpful, but did tell me that the booking was still active.  With that information I managed to get Gotogate to actually cancel the booking.  They said I would have to pay a fee, plus airport taxes (why?  I wasn't flying?).  The last contact I had was the 5th of September 2023.  It is now February 2024 and no refund and no contact. Absolutely terrible "service".Update, after I posted this review, booking.com and gotogate say sorry and please give us another chance, but still don't give me back my money. AMAZING.

When I reached out to Go to Gate customer service they offered to cancel but wanted to charge me ¬£204 cancellation fee.  To make matters worse, they also sent me an email saying they had to cancel my requests for check-in luggage, so now they expect me to fly with 4 kids and no luggage. Review: Purchased tickets through GTG and decided to change the itinerary - when calling customer service I inquired into whether changing the itinerary was possible and was assured but customer service that we would be refunded but there would be some fees - I took this information to my travel partner before confirming and we decided to proceed. Well that's when things took a turn; the next customer service agent said that we would not get any refund and all the fees we had to pay would be more than the refund should have been but they would cancel the flight for us anyway. I insisted this couldn't be the case as I had been told previously that although there would be fees, we would get some funds returned. I requested the call be escalated and was told there were no supervisors/management working that day but since another team had confirmed I would get a refund they would honor that. They said they would have a manager call me the next day - not surprisingly there was no call, so I called back and had another agent who also said there would be no refund even after I was told there would be one, and then told that the agents would honor what the first agent had said. I was told again there was no management/no supervisor on to escalate to and that they would call me back. Now on day three, still no phone call so I call back again and get a fourth agent who reads the notes on file and says that there may be a small refund but there are fees - which is what the first agent said. After 4 phone calls to GTG - no return calls from them and over 4 hours on the phone I was finally told I would get a refund and I got the information in writing. They told me I would only get about $130... I ended up getting almost $350. Do not work with this company, they will waste your time and jerk you around. Totally unprofessional, they could have saved so much time and aggravation by sticking to their word from the first agent.

Review: This company had not paid for our luggage to be included on our return home despite having confirmed in an email that it was included - we had certainly paid for it!After two hours of online chat with a customer service rep called Nancy, the company agreed to reimburse us up to ¬£375 and we should pay ourselves - it was just too late for them to do anything so close to our return flight. We asked for email confirmation of this which could not be provided (who knows why??) So took screenshots of the conversation and went ahead and paid the ¬£270 required making sure I got receipts and paperwork showing it had not been included.On my return I contacted the company to request my refund with everything I had as evidence. Everything seemed to be going well then they asked (again!!) For proof of purchase and I filled in a form. Having not heard anything for two weeks I chased it up, only to be told my claim couldn't be made because I had no invoice from the airline - who ever gets an invoice at a check in desk?? I did have a receipt and credit card  statement showing the payment to the airline They never asked for this and presumably wouldn't have even bothered to get in touch had I not reached out first.I replied to the email to be told this case was now closed.Disgusting, thieving company who should not be allowed to sell incomplete services. I will also be contacting Skyscanner from whom I found this 'deal!'Please avoid them like the plague - I should have looked at the reviews and paid a bit more to go with someone who knows what they are doing.

Review: Booked a flight on Booking.com (which we love to use!) and did not realize that Booking.com switched us to "Go to Gate" (GTG).  The airline cancelled our flight and scheduled us on the next flight AFTER the cancelled flight. We wanted the flight BEFORE the cancelled flight.  We contacted GTG and told them what we wanted.  We know that there are seats available.  Then the problems began.  All of this is on recorded lines.  We were told that GTG would send our request to "their support team".  Strange that the agent does not have access to something like SABRE? Consumers should know that the agent you speak with in customer service apparently cannot do anything but send it to "the support team" - so do not expect an immediate response.  The agent told us that the support team needed to contact the airline and obtain "authorization" to make the requested change.  We subsequently tried to make the change with the airline, and they told us that GTG can make the change immediately and no authorization is needed because there was a flight cancellation. We believe the airline.  GTG told us that the authorization would take 14 business days to arrive from the airline.  We do not believe this either - and the airline agent laughed when we asked if this were true.  The change can be made immediately - it does not take 14 days.  We asked to speak to a supervisor at GTG.  One GTG customer service agent stated "GTG does not have supervisors".  We challenged.  Then the story was "there is no supervisor on duty now".  We asked to escalate to a senior agent.  We were told there was no one to escalate to, but then the story changed to "someone would call".  We asked to be transferred.  Then we were told that a supervisor will call in 48 hours. The story keeps changing.  We gave them a number to call (the number on the reservation was going to be unavailable).  Days later, when we called to check they told us they called the unavailable number - and (surprise!) - it was unavailable.  We asked about a refund.  We were told that the airline would have to Authorize a refund and that they would cancel the current request (we are now waiting FIVE calendar days for the support team to actually process our change) and then restart a new request - and that airline require 15 business days to AUTHORIZE a refund request. (The airline states that if a flight is cancelled refunds are process immediately and NO AUTHORIZATION is needed. So, we are better waiting the additional (apparently MANDATORY 12 more business days). We notice that GTG monitors these postings. How about intervening and process our requested change?UPDATE March 3, 2024After 14 business days they still did not change our reservation and I called.  SURPRISE!  They actually can change reservations without sending it to their support team.  Then I asked for the seat selection I paid for.  They will not assign a seat and will not refund the money.  They stated that if you pay for seats and there is a cancellation the payment for the seats is forfeited. Booking.com takes no responsibility for Go To Gate and appeals there are of no value.

Spent over 4 days calling both GTG and the airlines involved - GTG blatantly refuses to contact the airlines' travel help desks to make the change, which both airlines said they would accept. GTG agents were quick to share that I would lose my $5000 ticket - bad luck - after refusing to contact the airlines to rearrange the booking - blatant lies about how they cannot change my ticket, putting the onus on the airlines. Not only am I about to lose my purchase (and trip!) that is scheduled for next week, my travel partner can now no longer travel as I am clearly not going anywhere, courtesy of GTG - a total of over $11,000 lost as the other ticket was also purchased through GTG - and they DO NOT CARE! Deplorable customer service, no product knowledge, no communication - other than reading scripted messages. Truly the worst experience in over 3 decades of regular business travel -  this warrants legal counsel. This is theft!

Review: I am writing here to express my extreme dissatisfaction and concern regarding the handling of my refund request by Flybillet.dk, related to bookings that have been explicitly authorized for a full refund by LOT airline due to their admitted mistake.Despite multiple confirmations from LOT that no refund request has been made on behalf of my booking‚Äîcontrary to the information provided by Flybillet.dk, including a supposed e-tracking number and a copy of an email from your customer service‚ÄîI find your company's actions not only misleading but also ethically questionable. This discrepancy is not only alarming but also indicative of a failure to perform a basic service that has been promised to me as a customer.I have incontrovertible evidence that Flybillet.dk has not only failed to initiate the authorized refund process but has also inappropriately extracted taxes from the tickets and allocated these funds for your own financial benefit without my consent. This action is unauthorized, unacceptable, and I presume, illegal.Your continuous assurance of processing my refund without any actual progress compels me to consider all available legal options to resolve this matter. This includes, but is not limited to, legal proceedings to ensure compliance with the consumer protection laws of Sweden, Denmark, and any other applicable jurisdictions.This situation is wholly unacceptable and demonstrates a blatant disregard for customer rights and corporate responsibility. I urge Flybillet.dk to rectify this matter by processing the full refund for my order and for my partner's, as authorized by LOT airline, without further delay or deceit.Should Flybillet.dk address this issue promptly and satisfactorily, I am willing to reconsider the public airing of this grievance. However, my patience is not limitless, and my commitment to seeking justice in this matter should not be underestimated.I expect an immediate response with a resolution plan that acknowledges the gravity of your company's oversight and outlines steps for rectifying this unacceptable situation.Sincerely,Christian Porsmose StenderPS:I insist on receiving a direct email address and a designated contact person for confidential communication of my booking details‚Äîthis request comes in light of the serious nature of my complaint and the insufficiency of your current security protocols, which inappropriately depend solely on a booking number and an email for account access, meaning i cannot just put this information here. Let this serve as a clear instruction: do not direct me to your standard customer service line again, as such responses have proven futile and dismissive time and time again. My name, Christian Porsmose Stender, is included in this communication to underscore my expectation for a resolution that transcends the inadequate and repetitive guidance previously offered.

Review: Be aware that GoToGate and Mytrip are the same company so avoid both at all costs. Firstly you'll be on hold for ages if you try to phone them and their "chat service" is a farce as they will keep you waiting for hours. Also, they're offline totally on weekends. Avoid at all costs!! They are a major red flag.My advice is to use Skyscanner to see that airlines are available, but yhen go and book direct with the airline because if you have any issues - and you will eventually- you'll have a far better chance of getting it resolved in a professional manner. There's never a massive difference in price anyway!!

Review: This company does not deserve any star. I would urge trading standard, consumer direct or civil aviation to look into this company. It's a scam company which it's not a member of any aviation group. My flight booked in the UK was cancelled in March 2022, (reference LIRRVQ). Since then I sent dozens of emails chasing the refund, but every time the reply was "Kindly note that we have escalated it to the concerned team". Most recent email, simply got no reply any more. Same issue in 2023, a ticket purchased through Booking.com without knowing gotogate was the affiliate company. Again it got cancelled with no refund, fortunately this time ticket was purchased by credit card, hence was able to claim it back through credit card company. In addition, this company at that time charged ¬£100 admin fee for two checked luggages (called airline, they actually charge only 8 Euro per luggage), and a unfair term that if flight is cancelled, this fee would not be returned. Guess this is one of the reason that flights booked through this company frequently cancelled. Skyscanner is also failing to carry out KYC check to allow such a scam company appear in their search engine. A quick check online, not difficult to see how many victims are out there. Another friend booked a ticket through booking.com in Thailand last year, had a same issue and yet to receive any refund.A kind advice, stay far away from this company and any its affiliates. Don't purchase ticket from Gotogate! Don't buy ticket through Booking.com as well. Having been using booking.com for years, I now completely stopped any business with them.

Review: I booked a flexible return ticket with Gotogate and decided to change my return date. This became a nightmare.I called a booking.com customer rep by phone to change my return ticket. She asked me to pay an extra fee for the change of ticket which I paid over the phone by card. She told me that I would receive a confirmation by email for my new booking.24h after I received an email asking me to pay a new extra fee ÕÑ'as ÕÑ'fare hike''that was never mentionned before.I refused to pay this unlawful fare hike. I sent an email as response arguing:"As a company selling products to customers, you must inform your client of the price they have to pay so that they can make their decision. Once the agreement is made on the price and payment is done, the price can't be changed afterwards."My email was left unanswered.I started an online chat with the customer support. He answered that he understood the situation but didn't have the power to cancel the extra fee. I asked him to speak to a supervisor and to send me a copy of the chat I had with him. He said we would send it and I would receive a phone call from a supervisor. None of these engagements were respected.I called customer service again, this time by phone. I asked the customer rep to speak to a supervisor. He checked my file, saw that a request for a call back had been lodged and assured me that a supervisor would call me back ASAP.I've never received this call.When I started to do my check-in online for my flight happening the following day, I couldn't do it without paying the extra fare which I was never informed about. I was forced to pay it in order to board my plane.The story gets worse...When I tried to do my online check-in 24h before my return trip, my ticket still appeared as scheduled for the initial date. Not only they forced me to pay a hidden fee, but they didn't even bother changing the booking after I had paid it!!!I chatted one more time with your customer support online. The person assured me the modification would be done and I would receive my plane ticket within 3hrs max. I explained how important it was to me in order to prepare my trip to the airport to receive it ASAP. 5hrs later, I still hadn't received the plane ticket. It was not even visible on your website!!! I called back and the customer rep assured me I would receive it on time for my plane. He couldn't even give me the departure hour.I never received it no more that I received any message from the customer rep service which was one more time useless on chat and unaccountable for their engagementsThis whole practice of increasing the price afterwards and putting me in a position in which I am forced to pay or to lose my whole flight was unlawful. Not even making sure that the change of booking had been made, or being able to give me information on my reservation was unprofessional. Of the various engagements taken by the 5 customer reps I talked to, none of them were respected. All together this was purely and simply bad customer practices at best. It's unimaginable from such an established company as booking.com. This whole thing cost me hours of time and stress. What a terrible company!!!I requested a refund as compensation. I will edit this review if they honor my request.

Review: AVOID GOTOGATE FOR ANY BOOKINGS!They claim themselves as a Swedish company, but they operate from some remote locations where customer service is zero.FLEXIBLE TICKET:This company lists features to book, including flexible tickets. Honestly, this is misleading. These tickets are only flexible for once. CONTACT CENTRES:You would never reach them even on their premium numbers. As of today, I have been attempting to reach them over the last 6 hours on both chat and telephone. I have several videos captured as evidence.A BETTER SOLUTION:Please book directly with the airline. There are also physical travel agents who are genuine. I am shocked that SkyScanner even lists GotoGate on their website.I believe that #GOTOGATE is a scam company operating under other holding companies, which lets it offer substandard services in the UK and EU. Please check the reviews on Twitter by searching #gotogate and also on other sites on Google before you take your bets with your money.

Review: I booked a round trip flight from Vietnam to Koh Samui via booking.com because I just had good experiences with hotel bookings, so I thought let's give a flight booking a try.A decision I will forever reget, I have never experienced such a bad customer service before. 1 week prior to the departure gotogate.com informed me that the return flight was not possible anymore because of a change in the airline timetable. I was given the choice between a cancellation and the confirmation of a suggested alternative. I immediately confirmed the alternative and got the response from gotogate that they requested the reservation but needed the confirmation from the airline. I never heard from gotogate again, until I reached out proactively to them a few days prior to the day of the flight. What followed then was just the worst. They told me every day (only when I reached out, they didn't contact me from their end) that I will for sure get the confirmation within the 24 next hours. But I never got anything. And every day, instead of enjoying my vacation, I contacted them via chat again to  get an update and they just realized every time that the alternative they should book for me was now not available anymore. So they offered a new one - which the airline would need to confirm. So we were running in circles, going through the same process again and again. I was stranded on Koh Samui and in the end I then when they offered me a new alternative again (meanwhile multiple days later than the orginal one) I chose cancellation instead of confirmation of the alternative and booked a completely new flight on my own for immediate depature.I have to add they had stopped responding via chat or email days before and my boyfriend in Europe had to call them because I didn't want to spend a fortune on phone calls from Thailand.That was in March 2023. Ever since I have seen no money. I have written them around 10 times for an updates, getting always they same reply "we are still waiting for the authorization of the aireline, we will refund you as soon as the request has been approved".I'm not sure if they are actually criminal and have received the money already of if they just refuse to do their job to get my money back. I am sure I will never see my money and even if I ask for an update in 10 years they will write that they are still waiting for the authorization.I will try to involve a lawyer to make sure they don't get away with it.What makes me the most angry is that I would still sit on the island if I hadn't contacted them all the time. They just ignore their customers, they don't care if the flight alternative they requested is never confirmed, they don't care at all and give standard answers and promises that are completely stupid and wrong.

Review: I used GoToGate to book my flight to/from Guatemala City to Roatan Honduras.   The Guatemala to Roatan segment was fine and went well, however I received an email from GoToGate that there was a problem with the return segment and hence was cancelled (by the airline). After hours and hours, days and days, discussing with Gotogate Customer Service, where, honestly, one employee is more incompetent than the other, still nothing. Reasons why Gotogate Customer Service is the worst:- NONE of the phone numbers work, so you are forced to connect with an employee via chat- Every time you connect via chat you wait for approximately an hour to speak with a new employee that understands nothing about your case and tries to finish the ticket as fast as possible by giving you wrong and, well, unhelpful information. - You cannot speak to a superior, you have no direct contact person responsible for your case, you are simply pushed around. - The employees working at customer service have no idea about the cases they are working in. They continously give out wrong information because they do not read the file carefully. In many cases it was obvious that they were lying to try and get rid of me. - The employees working at customer service left the chat multiple times in the middle of the conversation, so that I had to start all over again. After months of logging in to the chat weekly and after a while daily, I was finally contacted by Gotogate by phone, as I had asked for from the beginning. Yogesh - apparently a dispute resolution employee - admitted to me that Gotagate made a mistake, as they cancelled a flight that was not refundable and was actually not cancelled by the airline. While first admitting that the mistake was clearly made by gotogate, he started haggling. First, he said we would only receive 10% of the ticket price. Then he tried to raise it to 50% and after a very onerous conversation I made clear to him that there was no legal basis for them to refund lass than 100% of the paid price. He then promised me that my refund would be confirmed within two days. That was two weeks ago and, again, I have not heard back from Gotogate. I am back at my routine, where I have to spend hours talking to employees who do not have information about my case, send me standard phrases, having the audacity to ask me to be patient, promising call-backs that never happen and so on. I will now proceed to write bad reviews in every homepage where Gotogate is known, because honestly no one deserves to be treated like Gotogate treats its customers. They are very quick to take your money. After that they only waste your time.

Review: Customers of the excellent Booking.com should beware that booking flights through that system are directed through Gotogate. But Gotogate (a separate company) have an unreliable online booking system, and a communication system that cannot be trusted. For example, errors never showed up because email confirmations never gave the full complete details of the passengers on the booking. Their system made a mistake by missing off a surname, which meant that the airline would not book a passenger in when checking in at the airport. Leading to great extra cost for new flight. Gotogate staff were unsympathetic (and cut us off during a phone call from a foreign country) and have refused to refund the costs. A pity that Booking.com have linked themselves to such a company. I am going back to booking flights directly with airlines.

Review: Flight time got changed multiple times (not their fault) and on the third change it was considerably earlier and I could no longer make that flight. I called then to cancel the flight within flight rules. I was told after waiting on hold for 1.5hrs that they would process it and it would take 5-10 working days. I then booked a replacement flight for my trip. After 10 days I had heard nothing from them, so I called back (2hrs on hold) to be told it was in process. 5 more days pass‚Ä¶ I look online and see there should be a confirmation email of the refund being processed; I had not received one. So I called again.2.5hrs on hold!!! Was told it was in process. I called a total of 12 times because I was not receiving confirmation of the cancelled booking. The last time I called was 1 week before the flight, where I was explicitly told that it was all in process and that the airline had a backlog of up to 13 weeks and that was why I had not received any emails because they were waiting for the reply from them, but that I shouldn't worry the flight time is approaching as my application was put in previously‚Ä¶ I wait 15 weeks. Still nothing. Call again, about a the refund. They say they will look into it‚Ä¶ I then receive an email for refund application for a no show for a flight‚Ä¶I call them about this. End up escalating all the way to managers. Who simply apologised and said it was too late to process the refund.So basically, despite calling 12 times and speaking to different people each time; nobody even processed the cancellation due to flight time change.Over ¬£600 it cost me having to pay for 2 flights; feel absolutely tricked in a long con. Of course because of the elapsed weeks, I couldn‚Äôt go through the credit card company. And when I requested transcripts of our calls, they omitted the calls where it was stated explicitly that I would receive a refund, and only sent the calls where it was ‚Äòimplied‚Äô.Meaning I couldn‚Äôt take it further. They‚Äôre not worth the hassle. If you want to take the risk of useless service; pay on your credit card and deal with it straight through them.

Review: Once again, we have been saved by the amazing support of Singapore Airlines for providing my friend with an alternative within the same day. Thank you for that :)In the past, I wrote a post/story about our horrible experience with the "Etraveli Group Supersaver/GotoGate" Well, guess what? It's still as horrible as usual, and the reviews aren't lying either. Isn't it a sign from the customer to do something to improve your customer experience?So, I have booked several tickets on Booking.com (without knowing their partnership with GoToGate) from Amsterdam to Ho Chi Minh City for a few friends of mine. The departure date would be the 30th of January, arriving on the 31st in Ho Chi Minh City. However, there was a certain flight from "Singapore to Ho Chi Minh City" that didn't meet the requirements with a minimum layover of at least 1 hour and 30 minutes. Therefore, action was required from our beloved travel agency, but they came up with this unreasonable proposal:Please find the alternative option below:Mon, 29 Jan - SQ323Departing: Amsterdam (AMS) at 10:25Arriving: Singapore Changi (SIN) at 05:55Wed, 31 Jan - SQ8536Departing: Singapore Changi (SIN) at 07:20Arriving: Ho Chi Minh City (SGN) at 08:30Yeah right... While all my other friends had another proposal:Mon, 30 Jan - SQ323Departing: Amsterdam (AMS) at 10:25Arriving: Singapore Changi (SIN) at 05:55Wed, 31 Jan - SQ178Departing: Singapore Changi (SIN) at 09:50Arriving: Ho Chi Minh City (SGN) at 11:00When looking on their website Booking.com and GoToGate, there were many alternative flights remaining that day, like the one proposed to my friend. But yeah, their laziness won't end here because we received the following email from "etraveli/supersaver/gotogate or whatever you want to call them":"Please be informed that as per Singapore Airlines' schedule change policy, we can rebook the passengers only on the same fare type originally booked.Kindly note we rechecked the availability, and since the preferred flight does not have the same type of fare available, we are unable to rebook you on your preferred flight; the only option available is the one offered to you, which is also subject to seat availability.We request you kindly reply with your preferred selection from the two alternatives offered in the initial email so that we can proceed further with your request, or you can contact the airline directly to check about the available flight options."Of course, blame it on Singapore Airlines again, even though they were the ones who were 'ABLE' to correctly change that particular flight to a reasonable one, and yes the fare type was the same.After all these years, they still want you to contact the airline directly because they are incapable of fixing it themselves.So, still, my advice is (still): Avoid the Etraveli Group at all costs. Buy from Singapore Airlines or any airline directly. I would rather pay 10% more for a ticket than have a bad customer experience.

Review: Absolutely disgusting company that I will never even look at again. Terrible customer service, impossible to speak to anyone that can access any useful information other than reading the scripts. I booked flight tickets with them in March 2022, which got cancelled by Lufthansa. Gotogate sent me a text and an email about the cancellation and didn't do anything further whatsoever. I had to reschedule flights by myself directly with Lufthansa, but one of the connection flights was cancelled again by Lufthansa, which left me no other options other than cancelling the whole trip in the end. Lufthansa paid Gotogate the full amount of my flight refund, but Gotogate did not inform me nor transferred the money to me. Everytime I rang Gotogate or emailed them, all I got from them was repeated answers that my tickets were non-refundable. Lufthansa was also useless helping me. My battle with Gotogate is over now, I contacted my credit card company and sorted the money refund with them. However, it was absolutely disappointing and disgusting experience with Gotogate. 100% dishonest and irresponsible company who wants your money but is not interested in providing a quality service. What stunned me more is that this company has been around with this attitude for sometime now and nobody in the company (I contacted many people in the senior management of Gotogate, and of course they simply ignored) gives shi*.

Review: When I searched for flights, I found that this company had the cheapest prices, but their customer service is terrible. If you need a ticket for a specific date and want to avoid any uncertainty, this company may work for you. However, reaching out to them only offers two options: a 24/7 chat or a phone call. The phone call option involves waiting in a queue for hours, while the chat connects you to someone in under 30 minutes, but after about 15 minutes of waiting. The chat service they use does not provide notifications when an agent is connected, so if you switch to another tab while waiting, you may find that the chat has been disconnected when you return. This process can repeat for hours until you decide to keep their chat window open for over 20 minutes and stare!

Review: Booked a flight from Pittsburgh, PA to Lancaster, PA for my daughter during the Thanksgiving holidays and after she sat in the airport for more than five hours, Southern Airways Express cancelled the flight.  We have been trying to get a refund for more than six weeks now and Gotogate keeps saying they are trying to get a refund from Southern Airways Express, and it's apparent they don't refund until if/when the airlines refunds them even though the flight was cancelled.  You'd think this is a no-brainer for customer service and good business practices, but it isn't.  We finally filed a dispute with our credit card company, but lost the dispute because of Gotogate's Terms and Conditions.  We obviously didn't read the full T&C, but buried in 12.2 and 12.3 it states "...we can only refund payments where we have already received such from the applicable Service Provider".  In this case Southern Airways Express.  Just beware that there is a high degree of risk that you won't get a refund from Gotogate if the flight is cancelled by the airline.  Lesson learned for us this time and will now purchase directly from the airlines instead of using a obscure, online travel company like Gotogate - fool me once....  You definitely get what you pay for with this travel company.

Review: I made a booking via booking.com on 6th jan which was handled by gotogate. This was a non cancelable ticket. I first reached out to gotogate as the first name and last name of passenger had got swapped. They could not guarantee that the name correction can be made successfully, which was truly a bummer. It is also the only reason I am giving them a star less. The csr suggested to cancel the booking offering a full refund. They could offer full refund within 12 hours of booking I was told. Once cancelled I could rebook again with the correct name. They processed cancellation on 6th Jan. On 8th Jan ingot confirmation that the refund was processed by the airline and from gotogatea side. I was told it will take 2-5 business days for refund to appear in my account. To my surprise, I already have the refund in my account. This is the fastest I have had a cancellation and refund processed for air travel. I don't intend to down play the bad reviews that gotogate has received, and they have received a lot. Needless to say I was very nervous after reading these reviews. I just want to put my story out.

Review: I work as a scientist at a Swedish university and often travel for conferences, usually purchasing tickets directly from the airline. However, due to positive experiences with booking accommodations through booking.com, I decided to try booking a flight through them as well. On November 7th, I bought a flight ticket via booking.com (Reference number 40-433341504). Realizing an error in the date immediately, I canceled the booking and made a new purchase. I contacted booking.com to explain the situation. They informed me they were requesting a full refund from the airline, a process typically taking 7 to 10 business days.After this period, I reached out to booking.com's live chat and telephone support, learning that the airline had not responded to their refund request, and they couldn't confirm the refund duration. When I directly contacted the airline, The airline has explicitly stated that they have not received any payment and have not issued any tickets, thus indicating that there is no refundable transaction available. I promptly informed booking.com via email and phone. However, they claimed the airline was unresponsive and couldn't provide a refund timeline. It has been two months already, and they still don't know when they can issue the refund, continuing to claim that the airline is unresponsive.During a conversation with booking.com customer care, an officer named MAJA stated, "Please wait for this message before contacting us regarding this issue again, as it may affect your place in the queue." I found this concerning, and I consider this flight reservation company affiliated with booking.com to be engaging in fraudulent behavior. I've already warned all my university friends and colleagues against booking tickets through booking.com or SWEDISH gotogate. If anyone faces similar issues, I suggest initiating a chargeback through the credit card company.

Review: I can fully validate other "customers" experience. Except it gets worse. Booked a flight, airline changed their flight times, 6 months ahead of departure date. I needed to cancel due to this issue.. expecting a full refund or well... ANY refund. They do not let you talk via chat, physical letters or email. Always phone calls... and this is important for this scam of a company. Spoke to the Indian call centre, after two hours of asking where is my refund, which was difficult due to broken english, told me to wait.. then started swearing about me in Hindi to her "colleagues"... except I understand Hindi. When she came back, I asked her if she believed my dad was a dog and I was the white son of a dog? She put the phone down quickly... Racism... fantastic! Like thousands before me, no refund, sent in a letter to their "headoffice". No response. Chargeback from Credit Card initiated. Remember when I said you can't talk via a recorded means? The scammers have thought of this, it's so they can LIE to the credit card company! So now, ¬£¬£¬£'s down the drain.. with the only prospect a court case. AVOID!

Review: Jan 15: Issue solved! It took almost 7 weeks and immense pressure from our legal advisor, the Skyscanner support team and myself! NEVER AGAIN!Jan 6:Received another payment request. Replied and explained that the error is on their side and that it was fixed for our friends free of charge. Waiting again now.Jan 3:It's been over 5 weeks. Received 2 emails with the same invalid tickets. And another email 15 minutes later with a link to pay over 656‚Ç¨ !!! to change the tickets. And another email 5 minutes later asking me to ignore the first emails and another link to pay 656‚Ç¨ !!! Replied and explained that the error is on their side and that it was fixed for our friends free of charge. Waiting again now. The claim with the European Consumer Centre is open now and a lawyer has reached out to GTG.Dec 23:Received an email with the same invalid tickets. Called in again, explained again, waiting again...Dec 18:Wow! This is not for the faint of heart. I wanted to add a star because finally our friend's issue was solved and their daughter now has an adult ticket that Japan Airlines confirmed she can travel on. But then I compared my son's new tickets and her's and realized that my sons still have a CHILD ticket! All GTG did was change the title from "Mstr" to "Mr". Japan Airlines confirmed that they cannot travel with these tickets. Called in again, explained again, waiting again...Dec 16:I am taking away a star again since the issue is still not solved for our friends. They received another message today re asking them to pay for the change of ticket even though the error is not on their side and our change of ticket was done for free. Just called in again and gave them all the information AGAIN! This agent didn‚Äôt see the other agent‚Äôs note from Thursday! What on earth?Dec 14:I received an email with a confirmation that my change request has been closed but without any details or tickets attached so I called them and they forwarded me the tickets. My kids have been booked under a different PNR but they show as adults now. Our friends' change request is still stuck but the agent explained that since the passport shows the middle name of their daughter which they didn't enter during the booking (middle names are not mandatory) GTG asked for the name change and the fee. He escalated the case and finally linked both requests together. I have to admit that this agent was extremely efficient, patient and throrough (the first one since I started calling and chatting 2 weeks ago). Big shout out to him! I am adding a star for this. Now waiting for the change to happen for our friends and we should be able to close that nerve-wracking chapter!!Dec 12: It's been 2 weeks. Our friends and myself have sent in our children's passports as requested by GTG. I haven't received any feedback. Our friends received an email today asking them to pay 190‚Ç¨ plus 40‚Ç¨ fee for changing their daughter's NAME on the ticket!! Wow, just wow. Called them back and they apologised and promised to fix it. I opened a claim with the European Consumer Centre to get legal assistance now.Dec 5: It's been a week. Our friends received a call from GTG asking them to look at their emails and immediately hanging up. No email so they had to contact them to ask for a resend. The email asks to send their daughter's passport for a name change. I guess it's a standard text. Passport sent by email, now waiting again. I didnt' receive anything, no call, no email so I contacted them and they sent an email asking for my son's passports. Sent them and now waiting again.Dec 1: Still waiting for a solution. It's been 4 days. I have been contacting GtG daily but there has been no progress. I have been asked to wait and nobody can tell me how long.Nov 27:I booked a return flight from Frankfurt to Tokyo with Japan Airlines through GTG for myself and my family. Through some weird system error, my 2 teenage sons have been booked as children even though I entered the correct dates of birth during the booking process. They both now have an invalid child ticket and Japan Airlines confirmed they will not be able to board as they need an adult ticket. Our friends who booked the same itinerary have the same issue with their daughter‚Äôs ticket. We opened claims with the GtG customer service who confirmed they have escalated them to the department in charge but they are unable to provide a date for this to be resolved. Between our 2 families we have spent over 9000‚Ç¨ so this situation is more than stressful! We actually tried to simulate a booking by entering our kids as adult passengers and the GtG system will not even allow that! It triggers an error message saying adult passengers need to be 18 and over! I sincerely hope GtG will resolve that issue in a timely manner and with no extra charge. I will update this entry over time.

Review: First, I‚Äôd like to recommend all the viewers of this to never book through booking.com. If you need assistance, you will be on your own! It is a stressful path of agony and suffering that have ruined my New Year‚Äôs Eve. Sunday (New Year‚Äôs Eve) I have a flight from Copenhagen to Malaga with Swiss Airlines that I bought through Booking.com. Thursday, I realised a mistake in my name on my flight. Thus I immediately called customer support, who directed me to the airline. Then when I called the airline, I was informed that this was the responsibility of booking.com.I reached out to booking.com (again), They let me know that it was possible to change the name indeed, however I had to pay an extra fee. They sent me a link (via gotogate) and I paid this fee. I waited half a day, then they called after figuring out that due to having included my frequent flyer ID the name change was not possible, therefore I had to pay the difference in price for a new ticket and thus I had to pay a higher fee. I complied. Friday I called them to get an update and I was told that the name change was in process, but they would not specify how long it would take. I called them again, I was told I needed to pay yet another fee and they would send a link - at this point I decided that they probably was not going to be able to do the change. A few hours later I tried to access the link but it had expired. I called them again and was told they would send me another link, but she could not tell me when it would come nor if I was able to make my upcoming flight on Sunday - she just told me that I should call them again in a few hours. When I called them again, I was told the complete opposite by the customer service worker - he said that the payment had  been processed and only the last technicalities. I asked him why his colleagues had told me the opposite before, he said he was sorry and that it would all be okay. I just had to wait and call in again. I asked him to get in writing what he had told me, which he refused. He could not give me any time frame, but simply told me to wait. I went to sleep and this morning woke up to an email from booking.com. They wrote they had been calling me diligently and due to the flight being in 24 hours, and they were unable to get hold of me to confirm the name change, they would not be able to do this. They mentioned they would refund the extra fees I had paid. Furthermore, they tell me to contact the airline directly, but when doing this, I am informed that Booking.com has cancelled my ticket. Thus, I have paid for a product and extra fees that I haven‚Äôt received. To sum up: their costumer service workers are puppets that cannot provide any real information. I request anyone not to believe any word they‚Äôre saying as they are not there to help you but there to shut you up and get done with the case. Furthermore, they cannot provide any real customer services and they try to wash their hands clean by saying they call ‚Äúdiligently.‚Äù Now, I have wasted three days of trying to sort my problem out, all while they should‚Äôve told me in the beginning it wasn‚Äôt possible instead of explaining the inability being due to me missing in action. Furthermore, they have cancelled my ticket (that I have paid for and that they won‚Äôt refund) in the process, so I can‚Äôt even try to correct the errors myself.

Review: ORDER NUMBER: 40-395579334NEVER book a fly ticket with Gotogate. It was my first time and I didn't know Booking was partner with Gotogate. Usually I book on Expedia and Ebookers and there is never a problem. Due to the war I had to cancel my business class ticket from Tel Aviv to Cairo via Amman worth USD 950. I could cancel for free (Royal Air Jordan policy) but Gotogate take upfront USD 150 to cancel. AND...I called and wrote at least ten times and they won't give me my money back. When you speak to them eventually, after many cut lines while waiting for hours on the phone, they have a foreign accent and their English is not clear, and they anyway keep repeating the will send my money back once they get it from the airline. They even told me to call the airlines directly...which I did but they won't talk to me as I did not book through them. And GOTOGATE knows that. My friends booked same ticket via a travel agency and have been refunded THE DAY AFTER. So I am sure GotoGate HAVE RECEIVED the refund from the airline. They know that they can hold the money in their account before sending it back to my credit card, It pays actually around 5% so it a good income. As reading many reviews I can tell the story keeps repeating itself. GotoGate....I won't stop writing on all possible websites about you until I get my refund.

Review: Flight search through Kayak.co.uk came up with a flight ticket which was suitable for me. It showed three options. Gotogate, Booking.com and somethingelse. As the reviews for GotoGate are not great, I opted to book through Booking.com. It showed that 3 tickets are availble at 10.30 in the morning. I tried to book at 3 pm. There was only one ticket left. I filled in all information and attempted card payment. Towards the end of this exercise, I saw a message that the booking has failed and I should try again. There is still one ticket available. I tried again and this time it went through.  I had several emails from Booking.com and it also said that the actual booking was done through GotoGate, which their sister company. After four days, incidentally I was checking my credit card transactions, wherein I was charged twice for the flight ticket by Booking.com. I am disgusted that:Their system wrongly displayed a message that I should try again, even when the booking has actually gone through. I have a doubt that they are practicing cheap tricks to extract money from customers, and especially taking advantage of non-returnable tickets.Their website is fraudulent. They give wrong messages and compell customers to book again. The available number of tickets shown by their system is also a fraud. When one ticket was shown as available, if the booking has gone through all right, how can it show the number of available ticket as one again?In the end, after 24 hours of banging my head against a wall, they came up with a solution to cancel one of the bookings, after charging a penalty of ¬£255. Inefficient systems, inaccessible customer service, Fraudulant messages on the system...All this costed me ¬£255. Rubbish website.  I am still not clear whether I was dealing with Booking.com or GotoGate? For all practical purposes they both are rubbish. With Booking.com I had another experience similar to this while booking a hotel accommodation.Please, Please avoid going anywhere near these.

Review: Gotogate is a legitimate business in which they offer one of the better pricing available for your flights. If no problem arises in which you need to change flights or ask for customer service, then it is great. However, when problems do happen, the customer service is horrendous. For expensive and long flights, may be best to avoid them if problems arise as they won't help you as much. Due to my heart condition I had to postpone the flight the same day. The chat is not available 24/7 as they say. My flight was 9pm and I started trying to use the chat at 6am and no one came. A couple hours later, I tried again. I had to wait 30 minutes for someone and when that person came, the rep wasn't helpful. It took me another 3 tries and spent 2 hours waiting for them to help me. By then it was 1pm. The last rep charged ~$100 for airline flight change and another ~$45 for their service fee. The charge was immediate and yet they did not submit the request til 7pm, which is past the airline's cutoff time. I did not know about this until today's flight as I now had to pay another $150 to airline directly for no show fee of the previous flight. So in a nutshell, if you need to change, please call them rather than use chat. Or better yet, deal with the airline directly even if it's $10-20 more. I just lost $150 thanks to their speed of customer service. 2 stars because they offer good price but when problem arise, it's more expensive than other options as they can't help you.

Review: Three years, I've been waiting to get refunded. During COVID my flight got cancelled. Airliners (and ticket providers) were legally required to refund passengers for these events during this time. The airliner even guaranteed money returns. But ordering it via FlyBillet means they will have to process it. I've called and emailed, over a dozen times. Emails get unanswered, and my phone calls I'm being put in hold for one or two hours only to hear "are you still here? I'll need to ask my boss" , to which they just hand the phone to their next colleague who says they'll process it and you'll receive an email.Emails which I never receive, nor the refunds.Stop using an Indian call center whose KPIs rely solely on how fast they close tickets. Either restructure your approach or your CS partners. Your CS structure is an absolute nightmare. I will make sure my own, and any business I do business with, will never use your service and I will use your CS structure as an example of how to destroy your company goodwill.6N7XRG // LFAN2O // 7 December 2021Unreal you're still so terrible as company and support after so many years and feedback from customers.Edit: I hope it's clear this is a different experience than my previous post where they left us stranded.
