Review: It's been over 17 month I did not receive refund of the cancelled ticket. Additionally, I have received worst customer service from Gotogate.com. I booked a return ticket from New Delhi to Washington D.C. on 9th June 2022. The booking details are Passenger Name: SYED ANZAR AHMAD SHARFI, Order number: LO3F1I, Booking references: Flight: 1X65KY, e-Ticket number(s): 0655269618476, Check-in Ref.: OFCEDL(SV), Travel Dates: 20th July 2022 (Starting From New Delhi via Riyad) - 21st September 2022 (Starting from Washington D.C. via Jeddah). On 5th July 2022, due to some personal reasons, we had to cancel this ticket after discussion with the gotogate.com customer service and paying airline cancellation fee of 54 USD and a handling fee of 39 USD per person which was to be deducted from the refund. Ever since I have been waiting for the refund. I have reached gotogate customer service serval time, just to speak to a new customer service agent who had no clue what was spoken with their previous colleague (no case notes). Which so far resulted in no refund. Each time, I have been told that refund is pending with Airline which is yet to be cleared. Once cleared from Airlines you will receive refund, the customer service only manage the Airlines tickets and do not deals with refunds(it is deal with different backend team which cannot be reach out by the customers). I am not sure what kind of business you are running where reconciliation takes not just weeks but months or in my case over year. I am still waiting for my refund and request gotogate for the refund.

Review: Spoke with a customer service agent called Ritesh about rebooking a flight.Booked via booking.com and it seems somehow the booking in the background gets made via gotogate. 1. First time I called after about 40 mins on hold the agent cannot find a price for flight change2. Second time explain the whole thing and again and mid-call it disconnects3. Call again third time and speak with an agent. First of all he struggles to understand a simple request like change a flight from date x to y and give me a price. A few times he gets months confused (someone in company needs to listen to recording of phone call). Finally tells me can't find the same flight - guess what I'm live on both the airline website  and gotogate and same flight available for all 3 date options I gave him. He can't explain why can't get the same flight even though it is clearly available to book both via their website and airline website for the same date4. Offers me an inferior route with over 12 hours layover for guess what around 2.8x the price at which I can buy a brand new ticket!! 5. When I say look I can buy a brand new ticket for almost 1/3rd the price you date change - he tells me that ticket pricing is dynamic and changes by the minute. I tell him yes but I'm seeing live prices on your website and the airline - he just repeats it is dynamic pricing6. Ask if I can speak with someone else - puts me on hold and says no one available7. When I ask can I then somehow complain so the case gets looked at - he says send email. I ask what email address - says you can find it on website but I will not give you the email address!!I'm not expecting a free change of date and fully well expect to pay any fare difference but it cannot be almost 2.8 times what a brand new ticket will cost me.

Review: Do not use this company to book your flight. I had used them as i thought it was the same quality service as booking.com however GOTOGATE is terrible.A month before my flight i had received an email that the airline had rescheduled a part of my flight and I was to either accept the change or request a refund. I went on to accept the change. I waited 2 weeks and still hadn't received my new ticket. As time was going I called GOTOGATE for an update they said they were in communication with the airline about my case and will issue me a ticket as soon as they got authorisation. They requested i wait - which i did. But then a week to my flight still nothing. On the last week I called everyday and was given the same instructions. 2 days before my flight they apologised and said all they could do is give me a refund as there were no more seats on the flight I had booked on. This refund would be issued in 10 working days which didn't help as I needed to fly in 2 days. I refused and got transferred. Upon speaking to someone else they managed to get me the e-ticket number - logged onto the airline website and booked a seat. I got confirmation of my flight 1 day before my flight !! This was solely down to my refusal to get off the phone until i got my ticketOn a separate booking (same trip) My brother got on the first plane to the first destination but whilst we were there they cancelled the second flight to the second destination without communication. Long story short - just don't book with them !!

Review: My experience with Gotogate, through a booking with Booking.com, was highly disappointing. I had two flights, reference numbers 40-426610651 for a trip on 22/12 and 40-426599407 for a trip on 03/01. When a refund was necessary for boarding tax and extra luggage, my dealings with Booking.com, starting 11/12, were filled with empty assurances and no effective resolution.Further inquiries with the airline revealed differing responsibilities for refunds: the airline for the first trip and Booking.com for the second. Despite this clarity, Booking.com‚Äôs handling of the situation over 10 days was marked by poor communication and a lack of satisfactory response.This ordeal leads me to strongly discourage using Booking.com or Gotogate for flight bookings. The inefficiency and frustrating customer service for issues related to ticketing are stark contrasts to their competence in hotel bookings, suggesting a significant area for improvement in their flight booking services.

Review: Booked a flight through GotoGate via Skyscanner. There was a ridiculous number of unnecessary extras that they try to sell you as you try to book, making it very confusing and easy to accidentally opt into something extra. I did however deliberately pay extra for window seats. I was unable to check-in on-line (presumably because I booked with Gotogate) so it was only on arriving at the airport that I discovered that I did not have a window seat. I tried to contact Gotogate subsequently, but they make it all but impossible to communicate with a real person. I waited over an hour on their live chat, but eventually gave up. I went back to the chat record later and saw that someone had finally responded saying I would get a refund, and then closed the chat. I have received no refund. I assume that my return flight will have the same problem but seem unable to get any assistance from Gotogate to address this.

Review: Booked and paid for business class flights for 7 people for Christmas and a few days before we are due to fly they change the booking to all economy tickets. We contacted customer services and they are very unhelpful ans insist we had only booked economy tickets! Luckily we took screenshots of the booking which prove we bought business class and our seat numbers and luggage allowance on the confirmation show business seats and luggage allowance. Nonetheless they are insisting we booked economy. It's essentially fraud as they are selling and making us pay for business and changing it at the last minute and pretending we bought the cheaper fare (and gotogate pocket the difference!). Very unfair to do this to a group of 7 as now we have lost out business seats and left feeling cheated and out of pocket. Wish we had booked with the airline directly.  The customer service were so rude and cut the conversation by sending a message saying we have not written for 3 minutes so the conversation would end - the message was sent seconds after the previous message and while we had been messaging back and forward without delay (again we have screenshots to prove this). So cheeky to lie like that. Avoid this company at all costs!

Review: I've been a fan of booking.com for several years, for booking hotels mostly. This year, booking.com partnered up with gotogate.com to start providing flights. This was exciting for me, as it meant I'd have both flights and accommodation all under one umbrella.I had booked another family flight via gotogate for the summer and while it wasn't a great experience dealing with them, it wasn't too bad either.Hsving said that, I believe partnering with gotogate has been an abysmal disaster for booking.com and as of today, I've cancelled all bookings (hotels and flights!) I have with booking.com as a result, based on three issues:1) when I pay a premium to ensure flexibility of my tickets (especially when bought 6-9 months ahead), it's so I don't have to have a headache down the line. This is on top of the actual airfare and it goes to the agent, not the airline (I still need to cough up fare difference if any!)2) when I ask to change dates (based on said flexibility), I do not expect to get a quote for a fare difference that is 110% of the original fare paid and all legs get bumped down to Economy from Business class?!?!?. Now I know it can happen, but imagine my surprise when I go direct to the airline (within an hour of the revised quote) and was able purchase the same tickets for less than 50% of the fare difference I got quoted by gotogate? That was the first break in the trust I'd always had in them.3) so I go ahead and cancel the tickets, processed the refund (minus the extra bit paid to gotogate for flexibility). As you can imagine, it's a fair whack and I've had to buy new tickets for the same journey. Got an email confirming refund will be done within 14 days. All good.......Two and a half weeks later, I'm chasing up as to why my refund hasn't been credited? I have to go through chat each time - same old same old' "it's being processed"; at this point, I'm patient (these things happen) and get follow up emails that you can't reply back to (unmonitored mailbox from individual-signed emails, that you keep replying to but get no responses or even a bounce back response that it's unmonitored).Almost daily follow ups and its a different person each time, with the same pat responses.1 week after the SLA for when my refund should be in my account, every person I chat to tells me the same "it's been escalated and prioritised as urgent", but no follow up and no response and no feedback on whats actually happening.You might get someone random emailing you that they tried to call you (even though no such call was made), but also from an unmonitored mailbox that you cannot reply to or debate whether such a call was ever made!)Here's the funny thing, I've dealt with the airline in question for almost 10 years and even in the most contentious or difficult situations (very rare), they usually refund within 7-10 days in my personal experience.Get on a chat with gotogate/ booking.com and they close the chat on you if you insist on getting concrete answers vs. pat responses; when you call and insist on escalating to a manager since this has been pending for more than 3 weeks with no movement, they conveniently hang up on you.At this point, I've simply cancelled all bookings with booking.com and want nothing to do with gotogate, seeing as this is the level of service they've now devolved into.It is especially galling to see this level of abysmal customer service from gotogate, with no ramifications or accountability at any level of the organisation, and what feels like being abetted by booking.com to boot.25Dec23 - follow up: I thought it beneficial to add a follow up since my initial post. I took the liberty of going directly to the airline last week, to get to the bottom of gotogate's assertions that the refund was pending with the airline....according to the airline, that's untrue and gotogate could have refunded my money to me at any point in time. When I relayed this to both booking.com and gotogate, the latter hasn't had any response for me. Booking.com started following up with me, but then tansferred the issue to gotogate and have since washed their hands off this. No surprise there.

Review: I booked a flight in Brazil. The flight got rerouted 2 weeks before departure and I never accepted the changes so I contacted customer service by then to cancel the flight and refund: simple task. It took me 3 times across 2 weeks and uncountable waiting hours during my holidays, passing the case from one department to another, getting useless answers by email avoiding the cancellation and refund confirmation, asking me to contact them back to discuss. Finally the confirmation from them to cancel and submit a refund, was 'completed' the same day of departure!! after another painful waiting time. Unfortunately, a few weeks later, again another useless email asking to contact them, so after a couple of hours and several teams involved, someone confirmed me that the cancelation rules of the flying company had fees over the price of the refund, leaving me with no solution and no money, and just a suggestion of contacting the flying company myself. The feeling left is they did not wanted to cancel the flight and get the refund on time.  They don't care about refunding money at all. Such a pain contacting them every time. On the top of this, after confirming by the customer service agent to send me all the transcriptions of my conversations during the process, this was never delivered except the last conversation with the conclusions. I had used them in the past, and if everything goes as planned is ok, but if something happens is just not worth it and you are on your own and became a waste of time. They have lost a client, never again.

Review: Do not use GotoGate. I cancelled my return flight due to a change in work schedule. The airline confirmed they would provide a full refund to the cancellation. However, 4 months later, Gotogate still has not returned my money. I have called them over 15 times over the past 4 months trying to get my refund, but they say I "need to wait a little longer". They constantly lie to get you off of the phone, saying a manager or their refund department will call back with more details. They told me this every time I called and I never received a call back.Gotogate claimed the airline had not refunded them and was not responded to their request, therefore they could not refund me. However, I reached out to the airline directly (airline responded within a 12 hrs), and the airlines provided proof that they refunded Gotogate on Oct. 4 (December at the time of writing and Gotogate still claims the airline has not refunded them). This seems to be a common experience for others as well.4 days ago I contacted my bank to charge back my funds and I have received my money back. Gotogate still withheld their service fee for processing a refund so it is clear they were holding my refund and once my bank got involved, they processed it.If anyone else is having a bad experience with getting a refund from Gotogate, contact the airline directly to see how much of a refund you are owed and if Gotogate does not refund you in a reasonable amount of time, go directly to your bank.To any potential customers, do not use this service. Their prices aren't the lowest, and the headache is not worth the small amount of money you will save.

Review: I booked flights via Booking.com and was told weeks before I was due to travel by Go To Gate that my flights had been changed and that as there were no good alternative route the whole booking had to be cancelled. I agreed to be refunded. Since then I have had nothing but lies, copy-and-paste emails and hours of terrible call centre chasing: I fly tomorrow with no money as I am waiting on a ¬£1200 refund and had to go into debt to replace my flights. I have explained over and over that it is not safe for a solo traveller to go anywhere without funds, and they do not care. They took weeks to even process the refund from the airline, and claim they cannot pay me back despite being a huge corporation; ¬£1200 is a huge amount of money to me, it‚Äôs nothing to these companies. Call centre goes nowhere, they will not transfer, they will not escalate, there is nobody to complain to who can actually do anything. An absolute scam. I will never use Booking.com or anyone else working with GTG again.

Review: We regret to say that if we could assign zero stars, we would. This company is not even worth one star; it's rife with dishonesty. We strongly advise potential customers to carefully consider our experience before opting for their services.We purchased tickets through them, only to face unexpected flight time changes and a disrupted connecting flight schedule. In response, we promptly submitted a refund request. And we have also received a confirmation of our flight cancellation and confirmation of their process to request for refund. However, it has been six months, and their responses have been consistently misleading. They claim to be waiting for the airline's input and direct us to check with the local airline head office in China.Fortunately, we have a friend in China who went to the head office on our behalf. Shockingly, there is no record of our refund request in their system. This level of service is not only the worst we‚Äôve encountered, but their customer service is also filled with deception.We implore anyone considering their service to exercise caution and be aware of the potential pitfalls. It's a regrettable situation, and we hope our experience serves as a warning to others.13/12/2023 Respond to the reply : I am disappointed to be accused of causing delays in my refund process due to sending multiple inquiry emails. Is it fair to consider my follow-up emails as the reason for the prolonged handling and response time?I submitted my initial flight cancellation request and refund request on 25/5/2023, immediately addressing a flight time change.It's been seven months since May 2024, with numerous follow-up emails yielding no updates or responses on the progress of my refund. Your silence on my case raises concerns about your handling of the situation.There hasn't been an apology for the oversight in processing my refund request. Despite firm replies claiming it was in progress, a revelation on 30/11/2024 from China Southern Airline's headquarters indicated that no refund claim was filed.Upon checking with China Southern Airline's headquarters in Mainland China, they confirmed not receiving any of my ticket refund claims. Could you please clarify which of my emails contributed to delays in your workload?As per your 13/12/2023 replied to me , I recently discovered that my claim was only filed on 11/12/2023 after I lodged a complaint again to you on 4/12/2023. To address this discrepancy, I intend to follow up with the China Southern Airline office in mainland China again. Because it‚Äôs crucial for me to confirm the accuracy of the information provided and ensure that my refund claims have indeed been really filed in .I urge you to cease baseless accusations.

Review: The Booking.com has been our number one for booking service for many years.¬†I have booked accommodation multiple times using their site and have never had an issue until this year.But in April 2023 we purchased a cruise starting from London, UK in June 2023. Therefore, we also booked 2 days accommodation in London via Booking.com to ensure that we will not be late for our cruise.So, I thought I could trust them also for¬†flight¬†booking too. It was late evening and I didn't check any reviews about their flight service. This was my great and also regrettable mistake.I used Booking.com website to purchase Malaysian Airlines flights for me and my wife from Australia to London and also return flights in the late August back to Australia.The booking process was quite simple; select flights, ensure correct luggage allowance, select seats, and finally get all details with charges on the "check and pay" screen before paying. As per a good practice I saved the "check and pay" screen page for my reference.After paying by a credit card we soon get an emails from Booking.com confirming the flight with the airline booking reference number. It seems that all needed was well done.However, this is the first time we have encountered problems at the airport at check-in time because the Malaysian Airline personnel refused to process our two suitcases. I was showing them our "check and pay" ticket information with two 20 kg checked bags included....They checked our tickets on their airline system and informed us that they have a different version of tickets on their system, which includes only the "Light economy luggage allowance" without the checked bags although our "check and pay" screenshot showed two 20 kg checked bags allowance.My wife and I were surprised,¬† shocked and also devastated at this time.The airline personnel indicated that I am not the first customer with such a problem.Trying to help us, they advise us to repack our suitcases and pay over 1500 AUD for the excess luggage in order to continue our flight to London.The¬†Booking.com and GoToGate¬†didn't deliver us the flight tickets as per details of our "check and pay" order.Our claim for compensation was diverted to GoToGate.com but after 3 months waiting the GoToGate refused to compensate us for the incurred cost of over 1500 AUD paid for the excess luggage although obvious deficiency in their service system (probably software problem and/or their service being¬† located in India, many other customers experience similar events as per many reviews for Booking.com and GoToGate).Be aware that the Booking.com includes many other partners and therefore their service quality is deteriorating. And do not trust some reviews made by commercial hired website agents/contractors providing services for TAs as these could be misleading. Even Trust pilot.com rating for these two TAs mentioned above might be too optimistic.ü§îHence, based on my experience and also other customers included in the productreview.com.au or au.trustpilot.com I will not recommend their flight services even to my enemies.And finally, maybe there is a new role for the Trustpilot.com to inform ACCC on such frequent events involving such TA with substandard quality service?

Review: Avoid like the plague.I booked a family flight from Manchester to Thailand in January, In the summer and unfortunately for one of the passengers, a spelling correction on Apple device has meant that the first name was incorrect. I have raised several requests to have this corrected, Saudi Airways do have a policy where 3 letters can be corrected, however it can only be requested by the agency who booked the flight, in this case GotoGate.Having raised so many requests I was promised that it would be requested to the airline and resolved in good time ahead of my flight not to worry. I have been following that up this week, receiving replies that there is no specific update, but that it is in hand. I then received an email today basically saying, sorry it is not possible, speak to the airline, if you want to rebook let us know. To say I have been stonewalled is an understatement. I have asked for escalation, to be able to speak with the booking team directly etc. No, only allowed to speak to the customer representative, who knows absolutely nothing, cannot even provide a request reference that GotoGate used when requesting the name change with the airlines, nothing. Just a sorry, we cannot help you attitude! How is it possible that something a simple as correcting 2 x letters of a first name of a ticket, first requested months ago, can be such an impossibility.I will never ever book via GotoGate (or probably any agency) in future and will always book with an airline direct. Beyond useless. And now I have to hope and prey that within 24 hours of flying the airline will be able to update the name. If not I will lose ¬£¬£¬£ thousands in hotel fees, have 4 x absolutely distraught children and a wife, who are looking forward to seeing relatives for the first time pre-covid.Beyond useless is how I would describe GotoGate. As much use as a chocolate fireguard. No wonder the ratings on TrustPilot are abysmal.To add insult to injury the email address they gave me to raise complaints (a telephone number was an impossibility.,..what a surprise) no longer works! Sums up this absolute shower of a company. Customer service is a farce.

Review: Well where do i start?.I have always had good service from booking.com so i thought i would book a flight using them. Review: Initially, I did not even know that I was booking through GoToGate, because I was doing my booking through Momondo. Anyway, the booking went fine, cheap, quick, and confirmed in minutes. However, the ticket was one thing but the seats were something else what was charged around $30 each per person per flight. But OK even that is not so bad. All of the hassle started when the airlines shifted my return flight one day before original date. This was not acceptable and I decided to rebook. Initially, it seemed just fine, paid the requested amount for the rebooking and chose the flight offered during the conversation. One day passed but my information on the official airline app did not change. Figured it would take more time so gave them another day to resolve it. Tomorrow still nothing. Started the chat and I was reassured that all is good, they escalated my case to make sure all is taken care in time. Two days later still nothing. This time I was fortunate enough to be in the states and I found their phone number and started riding it twice a day minimum to make them do the rebooking. The answer they gave me every time was that the airliner would not send them confirmation of the rebooking and they are escalating my case. This took 6 days and they all read their scripted material without hickup. Kept escalating my case, if it was a stick it would reach the moon. The last day, hours before the flight I called and demanded my rebooking to be finalized, which eventually made them to lift the authorization to be transferred to the airliner. At this point the airliner resolved my problem in matter of minutes and rebooked me for the requested flight. So my conclusion is that GoToGate is most certainly in debt with the airline company and could not do anything or just did not care about my problems, either way not good. I consider myself very lucky not to lose my flight. Heard many people had worse experiences with them.Absolutely do not recommend as travel agency. I ended up having to deal with them because I did not check before how they did their business. It is not worth to lose sleep over few tens of dollars more with good and verified agency. Avoid GoToGate.

Review: We took the 'flexible' ticket option on our internal flights in Vietnam. Having the option to make a single change of date seemed to be worth the additional cost. Our plans did change, and we requested a change - same flight, just two days later; and before the specified time limit. We were subjected to the same prevaricating tactics described in an earlier post - they spent a couple of hours checking flights, rules etc. Finally took a rebooking fee from our credit card, which we assumed meant that we had been rebooked. We then received an email informing us that there had been 'technical difficulties' in making the rebooking, and offering us the 'option' of receiving a refund of the flight part of our original booking, together with the rebooking fee. The only other option, which would be implemented if we didn't respond to their email within 10 hours, was for them to close the case! We were left with having to make our own reservations. Still waiting for the refund.Updated, after Gotogate's response: still no refund as of 5th December.

Review: We (2 adults and a child) had booked flexible return ticket from BLR to LHR. Full adult fair was paid even for child while booking originally. We travelled BLR on to LHR on 2nd Jan 2022. It was Vistara for domestic and Virgin Atlantic for international sector.Due to covid, the ticket was made open ticket for the return segment (LHR to BLR) to be used by 31st Dec 2023. I have been contacting their office for last 4 weeks and must have discussed with several of their call centre agents. Nobody was able to complete the re-booking. Every time they gave some excuse for not resolving the issue. The issues they reported were:a) Child is over 16 years now when booking was made the child was 15 years old. For that I told them full adult fair was paid while booking itself hence it was not an excuseb) No flights available for the dates i requested. Then i challenged them as the seats were available in airline website as well as other travel agent websites for the dates i requested, then they use to say they would discuss with airline and get back. They never used to get back hence then when i called them next, told them, book any day in November for 2 passengers and for 1 in December then they said they need to price the ticket. I told them it was flexible ticket that they should charge me extra (I had paid extra Rs 42,272 while booking as mentioned in their invoice which is apart from airline ticket charge). On 4th Nov an agent called Ayesha came out with the most laughable solution, that is to rebook, she asked we had to pay Rs 340,000 per passenger extra for November journey and additional Rs 240,000 for December journey per person. When I pointed to her that the current price on the same airline website or other travel agents shows almost 1/10th of what Ayesha quoted, she asked me she can't help which is their company policy and airline is charging them, she asked me to speak to airline directly. I told her that it was basically by over quoating, the travel agent or airline or combination of both denying my right to have return journey when i have purchased flexible open return ticket (By paying premium price while booking).I asked Ayesha to arrange immediate refund for the price paid for flexible ticket which was travel agent's product but not airline's, and also ask airline to refund for the return journey ticket price as it was booked through the Gotogate. She kept on saying it was not possible to refund. I told her there are no terms and conditions which say they can't refund when they can't provide retun ticket having taken the money from my card. Finally she said she would escalate to concerned department and hung up the phone (perhaps disconnected itself but she didn't have the curtesy to call back to mention the call got disconnected. She neither emailed the summary of discussion nor called us back with an update. Its been a week since the discussion and my emails to customer service are bouncing back.Basically I lost ‚Çπ 354,411 which is equivalent to ¬£3465.66 in today's conversion rate plus cost of my time wasted.

Review: We booked a journey with several layovers to Australia. Over the space of a few months our flights were changed several times - this is fine because there are so many flights it makes sense some are cancelled. However, after the 4th or 5th reschedule, one of our layovers was reduced from a few hours to 50 minutes. This made us nervous as any slight delay in our previous flight and we miss the rest of our international flights and we're stuck in the wrong country. We called several times and I was transferred 19 times over the space of 3 hours. Each time I had to re-explain the issue to the new person, who would then say they were transferring me to the "correct" department, and the loop continues. I called the airline to see if we could be put on an earlier flight, and they said there are flights every hour between these two destinations and we could be put on an earlier one, but since our flights were managed by GoToGate, and they refused to do anything at all, we could not change our flights.Well, our concerns were correct, because the flight was delayed by 1 hour. Fortunately they held the flight back for us, but we had to run to the gate. As a result, our luggage was lost and we ended in Sydney with no luggage for several days until they arrived.Honestly just avoid booking through this company, it's worth the extra money to go through the airline and not deal with the stress of calling the most useless support line ever.

Review: I am deeply disappointed with the customer service provided by this ticketing agency. I purchased my tickets in full three years ago, and the airline canceled the flight. During this extended period, the lack of reasonable updates and communication has been astonishing. I have relied solely on their website for information.Despite making multiple calls to the agency, I received nothing but empty promises. They assured me that my issue had been escalated on numerous occasions, but no one from their end ever bothered to contact me.Now, after three years of waiting, the resolution they offer is to deny my refund because the airline supposedly did not pay them the required amount. This means I am left with nothing, despite having paid for the tickets in good faith. I find this extremely unfair as a customer.Moreover, it is clear that the agency has shown no intention of taking responsibility for resolving the matter with the airline, which is, after all, their role as a third party ticket seller. To make matters worse, my recent call to their agent was met with rudeness as they told me to contact the airline directly.This level of service is completely unacceptable. I strongly urge others to exercise caution when dealing with this agency, as they have demonstrated a lack of commitment to their customers' interests and well-being.

Review: I dread the day I booked a flight with gotoggate, after several anxiety attacks, calling every day for more than a week, several times per day mind you, I am still nowhere near where I need to be. I got a flex ticket, which is the biggest scam ever, and every time I have called to change it 1 of 2 things happen, either the system is not working (this is the case when the ticket prices are good) or I have to pay 300-400 $ to change it. They keep coming up with different information every time I call, firstly I was told I could change either the departure or the coming back or both at the same time, now they are telling me I cannot change only one of them, it has to be both. When I was finally given some sort of decent price to change my ticket, I was having connection issues so I asked if this information could be saved for me for 15 minutes which was what I needed to get home and make the payment. I was assured that this was not a problem and everything was saved for the next representative to send me directly to payment. I tried responding back and got an auto reply stating I need to go "contact". I had tried again and the response I got was"You have replied to a question that has already been closed and concluded. You are welcome to send us a new question through our contact form. You can find this under ‚ÄúContact‚Äù on our website". - Last year, I paid extra for a special meal. Review: Horrible experience costing me thousands! Booked a flight through Booking.com (which I'll never do again now thanks to this experience), turns out it was actually GoToGate that did the booking. Everything seemed fine until I was notified by the airline that a flight had changed to 24 hours later. This was an unacceptable change so contacted support. They advised there was an alternative route that occurred on the same dates as the original booking but had to put in a "request" to rebook it. After a week, contacted again to check the status. New person had no idea what I was talking about and would make the "request" again. Followed up a few days later and was told the request was rejected. So I opted to have the flights cancelled. As this was a change of over 3 hours, I am entitled to a full refund if I decline the change. They told me they can't refund me until the airline refunds them and that they don't know how much it will be. This sounds like their problem not mine and should have provided me my full refund on the spot. An email received said to track your refund check your booking, but now my booking doesn't even come up when searched. I engaged my bank to perform a chargeback from these scammers. I have also had to pay thousands more to rebook the same flights elsewhere. I regret ever making a booking with them. Booking.com has permanently lost a customer for all booking types and I suggest everyone else stay away too.

Review: I guess if you don't have any issues with your flight its easy to say these agents are great are great, but the test is when there is an issue. Gotogate are as dishonest as they come, we had our flights cancelled, & they were to rebook us, 2 weeks latter nothing had been done. We were then told after many many phone calls the proposed flight was full, I guess because they had done nothing in the mean time which is why there were now no available flights !!!,So they were to re book us Singapore to Christchurch NZ, from 2 days later than planned. We were at Singapore airport when we received an email from Gotogate saying the new flights were also cancelled, & they were not prepared to do anything else to help, all they said is you can apply for a refund. We went to the airline counter & they said everything was booked out for the next 5 days. We were stranded, My wife was in tears, & Gotogate would not help, we asked could they book us on another airline, & they were not interested in helping.At the airline counter, they said the flight was not cancelled but was full, they looked up the detail & said Gotogate had cancelled the flights shortly after they had booked it, Why ?Gotogate like all third party travel agents should be avoided, life is too short to have these sort of problems. We were able to book on another airline for the same original dates,

Review: Booked flights 6 months in advance, 8h layover, long but still ok. Outbound flight ok, but then before return they change the flight now it's 20h+ layover, something nobody in their right mind would have booked in the first place, or not at the same price! How is it even legal that they can change like that?Called support for hours, they refuse to change for a different flight saying there's nothing else (only same flight on different days, when other airlines are flying), I ask for refund, they refuse to tell me in advance how much is the refund, it ends up being only 25%, well below an expected ~50%. Now I have to buy another set of tickets, one-way, at the last minute so even more expensive, and didn't even get refunded entirely for the flight I didn't fly. I can't believe airlines and these ticket companies have such customer-hostile practices. They shouldn't be allowed to change bookings, but if they exceptionally do, they should be obligated to refund + more for the inconvenience because now you can't find other flights at the same price/times.

Review: If I could give no stars I would. Flight got cancelled in Croatia by Wizz air, booked through go to gate. Wizz air were quick to issue the refund but could only do to the account that the booking was made under which was made and only had access by go to gate/booking.com. Wizz air confirmed with me in July the money for the refund has been sent to go to gate and that I needed to sort it with them. Now end of October still no refund, I‚Äôve called once a week since July, only to be read the same script about how they‚Äôre processing the refund, how they don‚Äôt have the money from Wizz air, how they‚Äôre really sorry for the inconvenience, how the case is a priority and how I just need to wait it out! Thankfully last time I spoke to them I ask for a full record check, proved I had the email from Wizz air saying go to gate had the refund and then weirdly enough they were able to see that on their accounts (there was officially stunned silence at the other end of the phone). I got this in email proof from go to gate too that they had the refunded money and would be sorting it to be sent to me.  I then got a few emails asking for bank details but What a surprise no refund. Called again only to be told the same scripted spiel, they had no money sent from Wizz air blah blah blah but as soon as I told them about the email they sent the last time proving they had told me they had the refund (after 20 mins of letting them lie) they decided oh no it will be with you in a few days (again this is now in email) I highly doubt that money will be with me in a few days. This company is fraudulent and will not sort of provide any form of refund. However they can feel free to hire me since I‚Äôve wasted so much money calling them up ans having to listen to the same scripted lies over and over again that I‚Äôll be good to go with no training needed.

Review: I purchased a ticket to Buenos Aires through them that came up through kayak.com. Their website indicated that everything would be refundable within 24 hours. After booking, I checked out the website of the airline that they had booked me on. I was able to get their most premium option plus an extra bag for less than gotogate had charged (they charged me $75 for one bag, whereas it was included in my price on the airline's site and and extra bag on top of that was only $50). Thinking I had 24 hours for a full refund, I booked and then went ahead and looked back at the website. They were going to refund me minus extra "third party" services I had selected ($40). Initially, I was just curious if I could still access these services, given that I am going to be traveling on the exact same flight, so I sparked up a chat. The person ("Mai H") did not respond to my questions at all. She said that the "non-refundable services were non-refundable." I f***ing get it, but if they're non-refundable, then why can't I still use them? They also shouldn't offer these things while saying everything is refundable within 24hours. Lies. 2nd of all, Mai said that they would also be taking $100 off because that's what the airline charges for cancellations. If that's the case, then they also should absolutely not be advertising 24hr cancellation. Pissed, I called the their listed phone number. The person on the phone at least was able to respond to my question about the services (they're associated with the booking, which honestly is bullsh*t in this scenario, but w/e at least he HAD a clear response), but was still telling me that the amount they would be able to refund was less than what their website was listing. I have just cancelled through, the website, and am hoping the full amount stated there will be refunded because otherwise they are fulllll of false advertising.

Review: EDIt - in response to the company response. Excuses and misunderstanding the problem!!! We did not have a problem with the change. We accepted it. The problem is that our son was NOT booked on the new itinerary!!! And he was no longer booked on the original either! Therefore we paid for a leg of the journey and he had NO booking!!! This would seem to be your fault and not the airline!!! NEVER USE THIS COMPANY or BOOKING (dot com) to book a flight. This happened in August and STILL NOT RESOLVED! We are down ¬£800. We booked a return flight from Edinburgh to Lilongwe passing through Doha and Addis Ababa in June 2023. Two weeks before the flight we received an email saying the flight from Addis to Lilongwe was no longer available and a new booking had been made via Blantyre in Malawi to Lilongwe. When my 20 year old son arrived at Addis Ababa to catch the flight to Blantyre he was told he had no booking. They eventually found his name on a list on the flight directly to Lilongwe but apparently it was not confirmed or paid for. THIS WAS PAID IN FULL ON BOOKING. After fruitless attempts to resolve it with Customer Services on the phone while he was standing at the desk, he had no option but to buy a new return ticket from Addis Ababa to Lilongwe. This cost nearly ¬£800. My son is a student. He was on his way to volunteer in a hospital in Malawi!! The original flight that we were told was not available in fact was available and he was on it. PAID FOR TWICE!!! We spent HOURS of time on the phone to this company only to be told that they were contacting the airline about a refund and there was no option but to wait. Meanwhile there were issues with the return flight because of the fact that he was counted as a NO SHOW for the flight that he was told he was not booked on to. Again it took hours of phone calls (direct to airlines in the end as this company refused to help) and stress to finally make sure he was accepted on to the return flight from Addis Ababa to Edinburgh. Now that he is home we have just received an email saying that the airline (Ethiopian) are denying the refund and if we want to continue pursuing it we have to contact Customer Services again. We have proof all this which we have already sent to them with no acknowledgment. Even as late as the return journey the confirmation was still showing the flight via Blantyre which he was NOT booked on to. Unbelievable incompetence and lack of service.

Review: I booked my flight, price at check out showed 99,290 Thai Baht, however, once I clicked ‚Äòpay‚Äô the amount that charged on my card notified on my bank statement was 146,290 Thai baht. Review: I AM TELLING EVERYONE WHO WISHES TO USE THIS COMPANY FOR BOOKING TICKETS IS TO AVOID THIS COMPANY AT EVERY COST AND TO NOT DEAL WITH THEM AND PAY THAT LITTLE EXTRA AND DEAL WITH THE AIRLINES DIRECT.IT HAS LEARNED ME A VERY GOOD AND HARD LESSON!!!‚Ä¶I booked my tickets online via booking.com to later find out that this company named Gotogate is behind the bookings.I booked my tickets on the 4th of May 23 as my family were going in the summer holidays.I paid the full amount and in July less than 48 before the flight we get a message saying that the tickets have been cancelled.From the 4th of May 2023 till today being the 16th of October 2023, it‚Äôs been 6 months and I am still waiting for the rest of my refund. As in late August early September they partially refunded me half of the ticket.Being passed over from one person to the other is an absolute ridiculous way of being treated inhumanely as possible. These companies have call centres in India and the language barrier being another issue. When u ask them you get told that someone shall call within the next 48hrs or an by an email update. Not a single call or an email to be updated, alternatively I‚Äôve been calling them and the airline to be told that all the responsibility falls upon GotoGate.Ive been calling GotoGate and the airline back and forth for the refund, they unnecessarily made me call the airline direct who helped me as much as they could, but said that because that I had booked through GotoGate and not directly through them,they could not issue me with a refund. But helped me through by keeping me informed that they had processed theRefund and for what ever reason GotoGate isn‚Äôt refunding me the money that was entirely GotoGates decision. I called GotoGate on Friday to be told that no one had put any information on the system for the refund to be generated. I also got told that I shall be receiving the refund in 3/4 working days. I‚Äôve just had it enough with this company and would urge any person who wants to fly with this company directly or through booking.com to avoid it like the plague.The aftermath of dealing with this company is no less than living a nightmare. I got told that the outbound ticket got cancelled but the inbounds were good to go, when I told them if they couldn‚Äôt fly my family out how could they fly back in?..They not just spoilt my families holiday but the whole experience was a harsh lesson these cowboys taught me. Review: My airline changed my flight twice.  I called GoToGate, who I booked the tickets through, and expressed my concern that I wanted a full refund, specifically because I had paid $1300 for seat upgrades that I was no longer guaranteed to have.  I mentioned this several times, and not once did the agent inform me that GoToGate would not refund this LARGE amount of money.This is AGAINST the refund policy of the US Department of Transportation, which states, "A consumer is entitled to a refund of fees paid for an optional service (for example, baggage fees, seat upgrades, or in-flight Wi-Fi) if the consumer was unable to use the optional service due to a flight cancellation, delay, schedule change, or a situation where the consumer was involuntarily denied boarding."

Review: I wish I wasn't having to write this review, but here we are.I booked an around-the-world trip with GoToGate.com, to arrange flights from UK-AUS-CAN-UK. I booked early, and there were a few re-arrangements of flights as months went by; as to be expected when you secure a ccheap booking for a flight of this length.However, what resulted was a cancellation of my ticket, meaning I had to self-fund my way to Singapore to pick-up the remaining flights. There was little-to-no-help from the agent to help resolve this issue, meaning the week before I was due to fly I was scrambling the internet to find alternative flight arrangements.26 hours before I was due to return to the UK from Canada I checked the ticket issued on my app. It was all clear, and stated I could check-in 24 hours before the flight departure time. However, when I tried to check-in 2.5 hours later (i.e. 23.5 hours before the departure), the flight had disappeared from my booking. There had been no communication from GoToGate.com that this was getting cancelled, nor were any flight re-arrangements made from them. Instead, I had to contact the airline directly to make a new booking. By this time there was no room on my original flight, because GoToGate.com had not issued my ticket with the airline. As a result I had to return back to the UK 1.5 days later than planned, resulting in lost hours and therefore lost wages.My frustrations with GoToGate.com are 2-fold. Firstly, their customer service was not up-to-scratch. I was constantly told to contact the airline myself - is this not what I paid an agent fee for? Secondly, there was an inability to re-arrange flight bookings, meaning that if I had not resolved the situation myself, I would've missed out on the entire trip.As the agency work with airlines, I have been told that I will not be eligible for a refund as the flights ran as scheduled. That is understandable, however my issue is with GoToGate.com directly, as it was them who did not issue the tickets in the first place. I have been told that there is no process for compensation from the agency, and that I have no claim. As a result the onus is on me to look into Legal Acitivty, in order to bring damages against GoToGate.com, as I am entitled to partial refund of my trip.

Review: WITHOUT PREJUDICE!I‚Äôve paid $109 for an e-visa from the Simple Visa ad as recommended (apparently) by GOTOGATE. I have twice been sucked into (duh) using Simple to NOT get an e-visa. About 10 minutes of keystrokes, after 6 hours of my struggle, I gave it up. Simple now expect to get $109 for 10 minutes "work" and my visa has cost $212! Older folks like me, think three times about using Simple Visa because it's NOT! I hesitate to use the word scam! Yet, they got my $$$$s (twice) and I get a refusal! Simple appear to be based in Paris, France, I could not find an Australian address.

Review: My partner had booked a ticket Hanoi-Amsterdam, Amsterdam-Jakarta, Turkish Airlines. She had to cancel these flights early June 2023 due to family circumstances. You are kindly requested to be a bit more patient and you will be contacted by the respective team once your money is sent to your account‚ÄùIt is today 30 September 2023, four months after the cancellation, more than a month after Turkish Airlines confirmed that the money has been transferred to Booking.com / Gotogate; the money has still not been sent to our bank account.Several hours after I submitted above review Gotogate gave a reaction, see below, wherein Gotogate falsely blames the airline. Review: I wrote a review on 25 July regarding the preposterous delay to my flight refund, which was cancelled on 16 February 2023 - 223 days ago!Imagine the lawsuit if you owed a company ¬£1,732 for this much time and ignored their letters. On 28 July, I was informed that the airline had refunded the money back to Gotogate and now I would just have to wait a few days to receive the ¬£1,732.06.Repeated calls resulted in mixed messages. Some operators would try to tell me "we have not received the refund" until I gave them the exact dates and times that I was told otherwise, and they would return to "oh yes I can see now... please wait a few more days".This company is trained to mislead you and delay you until you eventually give up. But ¬£1,732 is a huge amount of money that, because it has been taken from me and is now being withheld, is causing problems in my personal life. I will not give up on this case but I am increasingly frustrated by the complete lack of care by customer service for my situation.They have had my money for 2 months, which I'm sure they are gaining interest on, and are all but refusing to give it back to me. I am repeatedly told "the case has been escalated to the highest department, I am escalating it again now" but when I call back, a colleague tells me "sorry but there is no update from your last call, so they didn't escalate it. However I will do it now."Until the next day when I call again to verify, and find the same answer. It just feels like they deliberately send you in circles until they eventually get to keep your money.Now that the initial excuse of "we haven't received the money from the airline yet" can't be used, and the blame can't be passed, they seem even more unwilling to help to resolve the situation. The department that deals with refunds cannot be contacted, no complaint information can be given, and I am forced to continuously get back in touch with customer service. I am asked every time: "please, you don't need to call us, we will be in touch with you in a few days" but I have never - *NEVER* - been informed of an update without first having to call to drag it out of the person on the phone. There has been no proactiveness from anybody at Gotogate and nothing has ever been told to me that didn't take four phone calls to find out.So, they are not asking me "please, don't call, we'll get in touch with you" because they are busy and processing the issue. They are asking so I stop calling, forget about the case, and with no evidence of intending to give me any information.223 days and counting. I hope I will not be writing this at 8 months, 9 months, 10 month intervals, but I will pursue this for years if needs be.Please, save yourselves the stress - avoid these thieves and book direct.EDIT SINCE GOTOGATE'S REPLY BELOW:Gotogate have confirmed they have received the refund from the airline as of 26th July. This has been corroborated by multiple staff members at Gotogate. Therefore the comment below regarding "it takes __ to get the money back from the airline" is irrelevant. The money is now in Gotogate's account and has been for two months - still, nowhere to be seen for me.It's a ridiculous response that goes to show their carelessness for customers. They clearly did not read my original review and just pasted a quick, easy and redundant answer.I hope their answer below confirms my warning to stay well clear of these crooks.

Review: Do not book with this company - it is absolutely not worth any saving they may offer. I booked a flight to Athens in June 2022, the flight was cancelled by Wiz air. Wiz immediately processed my refund to GoToGate, the booking agent. However they denied this and said Wiz air had to transfer a refund to me personally, this was not true. After chasing GoToGate relentlessly (there is no phone number, all comms have to be over email), they responded 11 months later telling me I had to pay an admin fee for any refund and they gave ME bank details to transfer MORE funds into. GoToGate have a .co.uk email address however all customer service is outsourced to India. It has now been 15 months since my flight was cancelled and I haven't received a penny.This is possibly the worst company I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. Their customer service is genuinely comically bad - it is really non-existent. I have never once wrote a customer review on any company, however I will feel the slightest satisfaction if I can persuade at least one person to not give their hard earned money to this awful organisation.

Review: I want to share a recent and horrific experience with Go To Gate that I endured so you can avoid a similar nightmare. I booked a flight through Go To Gate for September 22, 2023, only to be denied boarding at Riyadh Airport due to an airline policy change. Aegean Airlines promised a refund in front of witnesses, but it never materialized.Stuck at the airport, I was forced to buy another ticket, enduring six hours of anxiety before finally getting on another flight. Go To Gate offered no support during this ordeal.When I contacted their customer service, they were not just unhelpful but shockingly rude, denying any responsibility. Despite requesting a final response, I received neither an answer nor a promised chat transcript.My fellow travelers, avoid Go To Gate at all costs. They issue tickets without confirming boarding and scapegoat customers. I will report this to regulators to prevent others from suffering the same fate.

Review: I ordered a ticket 6 months before my journey. 5 days before my trip started, flybillett cancelled my whole trip because the first of 3 (6 in total) flights were cancelled. I could easily have been rebooked on the first flight and kept the rest of the flights.After 10 calls back and forth between flybillett and the airline, Flybillett finally agreed to rebook to the day before my original flight. But it turned out they had not done it properly, so I could not check in. I discovered this 12 hours before my flight. I even went to the airport, and they could see that my flight was not done properly by Flybillett. Whenever I called Flybillett customer service, they said they were on it and I even got an e-mail asking me to trust them and not contact them anymore on e-mail, phone or social media. But they never did anything. I just managed to get on my flight after calling the airline, who issued a ticket a few minutes before the flight closed. Alltogether I probably had 15 individual calls to the customer service, who just transferred me on to a next one or said that they would take care of it, without actually doing anything, or referring me to the airline, who said that Flybillett had to contact them directly.I have travelled a lot, but never experienced anything like it. Stressful journey..

Review: I don't like to leave bad reviews in general, but I feel I have to make an exception here. Following the earthquake in Morocco, my flight with the airline needed to be cancelled/rescheduled. I called Go To Gate and found it disturbing they were asking me to contact the airline directly and request vouchers, given I had booked with Go To Gate not the Airline. Having called the airline they were extremely helpful, and advised I would have 15 days to reschedule and this information would be published soon on their website, which it was within 24 hours.What followed was what appears to me Go To Gate using my voucher for themselves. They refused to acknowledge the information in the airline website for all agents saying they'd 'email them'. This was strange given on my first call the excuse was the airline hadnt published anything. When they did, Gotogate decided it now required an email. I made over 20 calls requesting the 15 days grace to reschedule, they kept repeating what appeared to me to be  scripted lines and not even responding to my concerns above choosing to be silent and at the end repeating the same line again. I was also given assurances it'd be dealt with though I realised this would be highly unlikely given my experiences.As soon as the 15 days passer they magically called me and advised the time had passed.I travel frequently, and they will not be getting my business again in future. Essentially over ¬£500 they have missed many more bookings worth alot more. So that's not very clever.And in addition I want to warn others, both verbally and online.1 star, but it give -10 if it was possible

Review: They hide the credit card fees and surprise you after making the payment. They charged a huge fee for my Amex payment.Also beware of the currency tricks. Nobody reads a fine print on a separate page when doing an online purchase. People just check the final price before hitting the Pay button. Unfortunately, I now must go to a higher court to prevent them do this to someone else or at least show a pop up warning when you hit the purchase button saying something like "the selected payment method will incur additional charges of x amount and the total withdrawal from your card would be xx amount".

Review: Dear Gotogate Customer Service,Main Concern: Paid for Business class, refunded with economy class with unreasonable delays.I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the level of service provided regarding the refund process for my partner's cancelled flight with Air India on the 29th of July 2023. The ticket for this flight was booked via Booking.com, which ultimately involved your company, Gotogate.Below, I have outlined the sequence of events to provide clarity:- 29th July 2023: Flight cancelled by Air India. They confirmed 100% refund eligibility.- 30th July 2023: Contacted Gotogate for refund initiation. Assured processing had begun.- Approx. 14 days later: No refund received. On calling Gotogate, was informed the process would "start now".- Another 14 days: Was told by Gotogate that no refund was seen as approved by Air India. However, Air India reconfirmed a 100% refund approval from their end on 30th July.I took the initiative to bridge the communication gap between Air India and Gotogate, which resulted in a Gotogate representative acknowledging the refund approval. This highlights inefficiencies in your communication and internal processes.After an additional 16 days, I received an email from Booking.com indicating the approval of my refund, but only for 48% of the total amount paid. The refund I received only covered the initial cost of an economy ticket, neglecting the additional payment made for the upgrade to Business Class.Major Concerns:- Inadequate Communication: Clear gaps in communication between Gotogate and Air India resulted in extended delays.- Lack of Proactive Service: Gotogate representatives failed to take necessary actions without external intervention.- Incomplete Refund: Despite all the difficulties, the refund received is only partial, not recognizing the upgrade payment.The ordeal has caused significant inconvenience, both in terms of time and the emotional strain of navigating these complexities while managing personal and professional responsibilities.In this age of advanced technology, including AI, databases, and high-speed computing, such inconsistencies and inefficiencies in service are unexpected and unacceptable.I kindly request the following actions:- A thorough investigation into the discrepancies in the refund process.- Immediate processing of the balance refund, accounting for the Business Class upgrade payment.- An acknowledgment of the inconvenience caused, accompanied by a tangible solution to ensure such oversights are not repeated in the future.Your prompt attention to this matter will be greatly appreciated. I await your timely response.Sincerely,Impacted Customer[Update on 20th September 2023]: Gotogate reply to review states that I am fully compensated, but it is not true, I paid nearly 2172 Euro including upgrade to business class, but refund email only says 942 Euro will be refunded. I am still missing 1230 Euro for the Business class upgrade. This clearly shows that gotogate's accounting system has serious errors. I have confirmation from etraveli.com (a gotogate entity) on the Business class upgrade which was paid on 26th July, 2023.I would request Gotogate to look into this matter properly, or I have to use my receipts, tickets and ask EU or CZ Customer Protection agencies to raise a legal claim Dispute along with reasonable compensation for wasting time and efforts.

Review: Request a chargeback from your credit card provider. If you didn't pay by credit card, make a small claim online for a ¬£50-¬£80 fee and they will settle in full including the fee and 8% interest per year (which you must specify) - no solicitor/lawyer involved. It took 1 month to settle my claim and be paid in full + fee + 8% interest, which is faster than their complaints procedure. Go to the Citizens Advice website for further guidance.Gotogate is a trading name owned by the company Flight Network UK Limited (company number 10329158). When you file your small claim online, address it to Flight Network UK Limited T/A Gotogate.They also won't respond to a GDPR Subject Access Request, so you can report them to the ICO if they don't respond in one month's time. 10/10 would sue again.

Review: Buyer beware! Had a recent negative experience with the staff and online customer service circus cancelling flights with the GoToGate (India office). The flights were advertised with a clearly stated cancellation/refund option (the reason the flights were bought)and now GoToGate will not honour this. The agent I spoke with refused to give me their last name, escalate the call to a manager or provide and address to direct complaints. The airlines cancellation rules were not available at the time of purchase only the "dummy" refund promise on the confirmation. This is false advertising and quite frankly stealing. There is no way to make a formal complaint except to physically write to their headoffices/CEO, go down a legal route or to report them to trading standards and action fraud in the UK. Their customer service contacts online divert you to the same office office and workers that have no authority and see no issue with the mis selling of airfare to customers. The majority of staff I have spoken to were unhelpful and disrespectful. They all deserve to lose their jobs. Very dishonourable.

Review: 1 star is too high from these scammers.I had a flight booked via GoToGate cancelled due to COVID and they still haven't refunded me my money!Timeline:October 2020 Email received saying flights were cancelled due to COVID. The email offered Rebooking or Refund or an Open ticket. I requested a refund.November 2020 Original time when I was supposed to fly.March 2021 email sent to GoToGate asking where my refund was. The response was:Thank you for your e-mail and we apologize for delay in response.With reference to your e-mail, we found your booking is under control airline so your case forwarded to our concern department and our team will be open the status. Once we get any update our team will get back to you.They never sent any more updates.Sept 2023 After a chat with a friend I realised I never received my refund. Multiple emails have been going backward and forward with GoToGate constantly saying:"your ticket validity is already expired and not applicable for refund."I found this on the European commission website (I'm unable to share the  URL):The online travel agencies concerned by the action are: eDreams ODIGEO (with brands such as eDreams, Opodo, Go Voyages, Travellink, and Liligo); Etraveli Group (with brands such as Mytrip, GotoGate, Flybillet, Flightnetwork, Supersavetravel, seat24 and Travelstart); and Kiwi.com. The action originally also addressed Otravo that, however, ceased operations in December 2022.Following the dialogue, the online travel agencies made the following commitments:In case of cancelled flights, the online travel agencies will transfer refunds from the airline on to the consumer within 7 days from the day the online travel agency receives the refund from the airline. This will result in a refund in 14 days for consumers having bought their ticket through an online travel agency. Remaining backlogs in transferring refunds received from airlines have been or will be cleared by 30 June 2023 at the latestAs you can see Etraveli, the owner of GoToGate has committed to provide refunds.Basically GoToGate have not done what they promised the European Commission.

We‚Äôre sorry this may have added some stress to your experience and wanted to explain why this happened. Your booking was identified as having been made through a third-party agent who has no commercial relationship with Ryanair to sell our flights.Not only do third parties often add their own fees to our products but they also often provide their own payment and contact details. This means that in the unlikely event that your flight experiences a disruption, we are unable to contact or refund you directly. If you‚Äôd like to see if you were overcharged for your booking, you can use our price comparison tool here.Bookings made on the Ryanair website or App will allow you to easily manage all aspects of your trip and will not require verification. Review: I used to be a travel agent and heard horror stories about go to gate all the time, but I had the impression that as bad as they were, it always had something to do with the customer changing their ticket in some way. So when I saw a cheap ticket and knew there was no way I was changing it, I thought I‚Äôd give it a go.Long story short:-airline cancels that tickets return flight-go to gate don‚Äôt tell me, luckily I check airline website.-no big deal, i call go to gate to collect refund or rebook-g2g are a bit elusive, say airline havn‚Äôt refunded money-call airline, they are baffled and say g2g have the money- call g2g about 20 times, they tell me many different things, but always that i will have a return flight, don‚Äôt worry etc.- getting to be days away from my flight, I just have to buy a new one- call g2g another 20 or so times, really strange lies each time, mostly ‚Äòyour refund will come through in a few weeks‚Äô, but keep hanging up on me, and organise times to call but never actually call,-It‚Äôs been 6 months now, I guess next step is going to consumer affairs?-  btw we booked on Amex, which we assumed would be a great back up, but even Amex with their usually good refund policy are in a grey spot with booking agencies, so no luck there.So if you are thinking g2g are ok if you‚Äôre not going to change your tix, be aware that the problems emerge even if the airline changes the tix.This is kind of minor compared to the massive loss of money and stress of being stuck somewhere, but the call centre people are terrible, really unsettlingly false and difficult to speak with.Update: Please refer to the response from g2g below as an example. Yes I would love to give you a chance to deliver the 'service I expect'.  A wonderful way to do that would be to refund me the cost of the flight that was cancelled, as per the booking conditions.

Review: Airline changed my departure date to the following day which was no use to me and had to cancel via GoToGate as that's where I regrettably booked it through. After 2 attempts, first time via Chat which took over an hour and I had to give up as needed to go out, the second time via a 1 hour phone call where I was passed around different departments 3 times, to be told different things; After asking to speak to a supervisor, I finally got call back (not from a supervisor but the same call handler) and a 90% refund credit that I fortunately paid extra for, as they we only going to refund my outbound flight, not the return flight which of course I could no long use either.  Otherwise I was going to get no refund for the return flight at all.  This wouldn't happen if booking directly through an airline, plus an airline system is more automated so would have happened smoothly, including looking at options to change the flight (if that had been available the same day).  So now I have a voucher to use with a company that I wouldn't touch again - they are under-resourced and using what sounds like an Indian call centre where they struggle with English. How are company's like this allowed to trade?

Review: We booked flights via Sky Scanner with Air Canada via GoToGate as they were marginally cheaper than Air Canada direct. There were 2 sectors from Vancouver to Toronto and then on to Manchester UK, we booked Premium Economy. A month prior to the flight, we were informed the aircraft was being changed and chartered to Omni Air, the new aircraft did not have a Premium Cabin, so we were being downgraded. We were advised to contact GoToGate after the flight with refund authorisation forms from Air Canada to then claim back from GoToGate. When we returned, we received the forms from Air Canada very quickly, we e-mailed them to GoToGate immediately and I contact them via webchat to inform them that we needed the fare difference between premium economy to economy refunding ($811 CAD). We‚Äôve still not received the money, I have contacted them more than 12 times to explain the problem, the only e-mail I have had from them was to say they won‚Äôt refund a spent flight (I was asking for the fare difference from the downgrade not the full flight!). After over a month now, I‚Äôve contacted my credit card company to claim money via a dispute as GoToGate are not helpful and they haven‚Äôt refunded us the money.They have no means of escalation, regardless if you complain. They don‚Äôt care!Update 25.09.23 - Following the response below from GoToGate, they‚Äôve still not been in touch and still no refund. Air Canada have confirmed they refunded the money on 22nd August 2023 to GoToGate. They are thieves and their customer care is beyond dreadful!

Review: Had a very poor experience with Gotogate. Booked return flights from Sydney on Malaysian Airlines. Opted for Checked  baggage of 30kg and paid for it. Hours later got an email saying due to a system error the extra baggage could not be confirmed and that the checked baggage money would be refunded. When I tried to add the Checked baggage through Malaysian website the cost for it exceeded the original ticket price. Called Malaysian and they advised me that this was a scam and that they do receive a lot of these complaints. So called Gotogate a few times to resolve and the only sensible option they could give was to cancel the ticket because it was all within a few hours of the original booking. But they dicked me a so called handling fee.Looks like that this is a earn easy money tactic with some websites amidst some real ticket sales. Tough lesson learnt.Update on 18 Sep 2023: What made it worse was that not only the ticket had to be cancelled and I had to look elsewhere but the fact that there was a so called handling fee. This despite the fact that Gotogate were not able to provide what they had advertised and also that the cancellation was within the same day for which most websites don't charge any cancellation fee even if it was the customer who had changed his mind for whatever reason. So if Gotogate cared about me the Customer in any real sense they should refund me the handling fee...Thanks

Review: Please please do not use Gotogate for airline tickets, holidays - anything.  They are awful.  I have been trying to cancel my airline tickets for almost a month as the airline (Loganair) changed our outward flight, meaning I would have to pay for extra nights etc.  GTG have been utterly appalling. Their system has STILL not updated any changes made.  I have explained the situation to them on so many occasions but they still do not acknowledge that there is an issue.   They have told me I need to deal with the airline, so I have and they have agreed a full refund. But GTG have still not actioned this request.  My flight is less than 2 weeks away and their system still shows the wrong dates.  And still shows that I am flying.  They have said they are on it but the airline has categorically denied any discussion with them.  So here I am ¬£700 down, expected to accept a flight back from Norway when I can't get there in the first place. I implore you do not use them.  Don't believe them when they say they are 'on it'.  Appalling service.  Terrible systems. Not responsive to requests for help. Repetitive with same answers although they have not done anything about it.  Not willing to carry out their duties as an intermediary to airlines.

Review: **PLEASE TAKE NOTICE** THIS COMPANY PUT MY CHILD'S HEALTH AT RISK. DO NOT USE AT ALL COSTS!This is a fraudulent company. I've just reported them to UK Trading Standards and hope to see them dissolved.When reading the reviews I was wary of using them but thought not much could go wrong. I had originally booked with TUI but UK air traffic control issues meant the holiday was cancelled, so I needed a last minute flight to Thailand asap. They sneakily made my buy excess baggage, then said the charges are non refundable. I thought 'you got me but okay". My son suffered with health complications and requires machinery, its very heavy to transport but with the excess baggage, we thought we carry our own and cancel renting some in Thailand.When we got to the airport, we were told by Oman Air that no excess baggage had been added to our tickets and we would have to pay again and double the price (around ¬£400) so we had to leave the healthcare machinery behind, as after spending 5k on a replacement holiday, we had no Sterling left and only Baht we booked to pick up in Thailand. When we arrived in Thailand we were unable to hire out the required equipment until a day before we were due to leave. So we've been unable to enjoy any moment, as were constantly worried my son might suffer an attack.These crooks refused to even refund and then told me that they'd send an email with a form. No email or form arrived.I don't even want the money anymore, I want to see these crooks punished. I spoke to a Sujata Budha who was extremely unhelpful, but this is typical of the company. Nothing beats a parent's love and you messed with the wrong father you thieves.

Review: Awful. Dreadful. Time wasted. Money wasted.This kind of operation should be criminal. I booked a flexible flight (paid the extra fee for free changes). My previous flight was cancelled at the airline (the booking number is no longer valid), Go To Gate's page shows the old ticket and date. No follow up email, no booking apparently and now I'm out the original ticket price and the extra fee with no clue if I have a ticket or not.I say this service shouldn't exist because... they get these prices by buying tickets in bulk presumably. The reason I had to book with them in the first place is because, there was an internet error when I was attempting to book the same flight with the airline, and by the time I resolved it, someone else had booked it. I went to Booking.com and then booked through these crooks, where the same time and date I was looking for was available. Why? Of course because they had bought it up in bulk. Seriously how do these middlemen help? They hinder. If we all stopped using them, we'd be better off.
