They somehow manged to lose our flight that had been changed and the flight that they were going to book us on. We were then told to cancel the whole booking and re-book new tickets. GoToGate then told us that they would start the refund process for us. It has been almost two months and the only time GoToGate have chased Etihad is when we chase them! Incompetence at the highest level. Booking.com will do well to drop them as a partner.

Review: We arrived on time at the terminal and checked in. We tried to check in previously through the app and we could not do it, we looked for the machines at the airport and they did not have the service available for that airline. After 1.30 hours of waiting in line to check in we were informed that we had to do it online and that we had to pay 40 euros per person, we asked how to do it the next time and not have the same problem again and they did not know how to say it and without education they told us that we had to go to pay to another terminal about 2km from the place having the flight schedule on top because the service had been terrible. We went there, paid the penalty and when we asked why we had to go in, they sent us somewhere else, which made it even more complicated for us to get to the plane on time. We finally arrived late for the gate, but since the service was terrible, they were also late. The experience was very bad and we do not recommend this airline.

Review: Terrible customer service!I purchased flexible tickets through them.  I called to change one way of the tickets.  Not only do I think they charged me the full fare for the new ticket (based on the prices from both booking.com and the airline itself) but despite multiple calls and emails, they simply sent the same itinerary back to me without the change.  When I called to clarify, they said "someone will call you".  They could not give me a day or time when someone will get back to me, and the trip is coming up fast.  I will never, NEVER book flights through booking.com again.  Their unresponsive and difficult customer service are deplorable.EDIT- We never actually got the flight confirmation from them. I had to take a morning out of our family vacation to go to the airport and have them search for our booking at the airline customer desk.  At no time did booking.com provide accurate information, and in fact told me that we had changed the ticket (we did not and have the receipt to prove it), and therefore we‚Äôre responsible to figure it out. Buyer beware - we could have gotten the tickets cheaper and had hours less struggle if we had just booked with the airline or through a reputable travel agency.  If you value your time and sanity, don‚Äôt use this company!!!!!

Review: DO NOT book a flight through Gotogate who are in partnership with Booking.com Until now my experience with Booking.com had always been great - that was booking accommodation. Booking a flight however, has been a complete disaster because they use Gotogate.My wife and I had to cancel our honeymoon due to a complication with pregnancy and the airline permitted a refund minus the cancellation fee. However, Gotogate and Booking.com just won't give us any information about the status of the refund. They claim the airline have not responded - but don't even give a rough indication as to how long we'll need to wait. It's now been about 6 months and still nothing.Multiple customer service advisers have said they've escalated it as urgent but nothing ever happens. They show little empathy to our situation, especially considering it's a considerable sum of money that we're out of pocket. Even if they just gave us a rough timeframe that is better than nothing, but they would prefer that we're left in limbo, getting anxiety in the process.Save yourself the hassle and DO NOT buy a flight through Gotogate who are used by Booking.com** Update 5/9/23**I contacted Skyscanner (where we originally found the flights that we'd booked) to let them know that Booking.com and Gotogate were treating us terribly and could my feedback be taken onboard to warn other customers. Amazingly, they contacted Booking.com & Gotogate for me requesting an urgent update and a few hours later Gotogate contacted me to say:'Regrettably, I discovered that the email address used for communication with the airline was incorrect. Consequently, I have re-submitted a full refund request to Qatar Airways.'So for nearly 6 months their customer service team have been contacting the airline for a refund but using the wrong email address! If this is the case then why did the emails not bounce? And why did no one from the airline tell them where to redirect them to? Perhaps they could be lying? I don't know, but based on this information would you trust this company with your hard earned cash? AVOID!

Review: Eventually my rebooking was resolved to my satisfaction and at the end I had a very nice person on the phone. I am curious though, if I will get a refund. But it took me many, many phonicalls, until I had someone on the line, who a), spoke english that I could understand, b) wouldn't always break up - the line is horrible, probably due to ending up in India, c) didn't tell me that I should call back, because they have a technical issue. I was trying to rebook my flight, because I needed an earlier return flight to New York, because of a medical emergency. If I had booked with the airline directly, they would have accepted my letter from the hospital and probably waved the change fee. But not so with GoToGate. I had to pay the full change fee, which was almost 1000.- Dollars. Also, I tried to change it a month before I started my travel, but only had customer service personal on the phone, who didn't give me satisfactory information. When I called a second time, the flight details and price were different, when I called a third time to find out what is correct, the third person told me there was a technical issue, I should call back in an hour. I then called the airline directly and rebooked with them, which was cancelled a few days before the rebooked flight, because they said, I had to go through the agency that issued the ticket. So I did that, but it was so late, that the change fee was horribly high. I also have not received a refund for another flight from them. So basically I will not book with them again, even though the price for the flight was good - and if you don't plan on rebooking or dealing with customer service, you can go with this company. If you are not sure - don't do it.

Review: Book directly with airlines not Booking.Com or GoToGate as these companies withhold refunds.GoToGate is not passing on a refund for a flight even though the airline has written to GoToGate on the PNR to confirm to them that it is due in full. Their customer service is atrocious and I have had to continually call them - they keep telling me they will look into it and call me back but they don't.There is no email address for correspondence and no transparent escalation process or ability to write and record your complaint so you get trapped in a cycle of repetative phone calls with agents who are not empowered to help.I booked with them through Booking.Com thinking it would be convenient but it has been a nightmare.   It feels as though they have a deliberate policy to hold on to refunds as long as possible and their poor service is part of that. Always book direct with airlines. The airline my case has really tried to help me, they immediately took responsibility for the changed flight and swiftly offered a full refund and documented that.  But GoToGate are in the middle and not passing it on.If you google their service you will see many other examples of GoToGate doing exactly this to their customers. I  wish I knew before I used Booking.Com who partner with GoToGate. Even if I had to pay more to the airline it would have been worth it.

Review: Last April I've booked a flight to Lisbon (on TAP) for the 20-Aug and TAP has changed my scheduled, putting me on a flight that I can't take. Basically told me to call again the same number, so that I'd be someone else's problem. I was speechless.They keep talking about policies, when my rights are protected by law, which overrules any policy.I was also told that in some cases the airlines themselves will have issued the refund already, and Gotogate helds the money/vouchers on their end whilst making it very difficult for customers to get it, in hopes that people will either give up or forget about the whole thing, and they get to keep it....bear in mind this is hearsay, but from what I'm experiencing, I honestly wouldn't be surprised.The bottom line is, IT'S NOT WORTH IT. Review: I'm not one to leave bad reviews, but honestly I have to warn you against using this site. I bought international 700 euro tickets months in advance, and two weeks before my trip they notified me that the flight had been cancelled and all I could do was ask for a refund. I did that and bought other flights through another airline. Later, a couple of days before my flight I get an email saying that all I can do is change the flight. I contact customer service and they assure me that my refund is underway and I will get it soon. Weeks go by, I contact customer service periodically only to get the same reply every time, reassuring me that I will get it shortly. I even asked them if they could guarantee that, they said yes. Today, I finally get an email telling me that as per airline rules, I am not getting a refund and there is nothing they can do about it. I just threw my money away. Worst part is I would've happily taken that flight if they hadn't informed me it was cancelled, leaving me no alternative than to make other arrangements. Terrible service, I'm wondering if this is even legal.

Review: I recently booked 3 tickets for me and my two kids. As a single mother at the time of booking I chose to purchase the front row seats as it would be convenient for my kids as they were travelling in the aircraft for the first time. The seating map on the aircraft showed that the seat numbers I got would be the front rows. So looking at the aircraft map I purchased my seats worth $660 cdn. As we boarded the flights (going and coming) I saw that they were actually the second rows not first. I contacted gotogate about them false advertising the seats and asking for a refund but got refused.  If we were to sit in the second row seats then we didn‚Äôt have to specifically purchase the seats as we could have sat anywhere and saved that money. Please don‚Äôt purchase specific seats as their info is not correct/current. At the time of check in it‚Äôs better to ask the aircraft staff for your seats if available and save some money. I would never purchase any more tickets with gotogate and I advice others not to do it either. There are so many other websites/apps that can be honest and give better deals. Review: I got at Gotogate site via Kayak search. After booking tickets + paying extra fee for seats selection it turned out that seat selection was not a "selection" but just expressing the preferences. Let's read Gotogate T&C‚Äú3.1.2 As soon as your requested tickets have been issued, You will receive a confirmation email with a ticket number. This is the moment a binding contract between You and the relevant airline(s) has been concluded.3.1.3 Prices for the flight and seat availability are added directly in the Portal by the applicable airline. If changes are made by the airline that are outside of our control (e.g. price changes, seat availability or something else) and that occurs after a booking request has been made, but before the contract with the airline has become binding (as set out in Section 3.1.2 above), the contract will not enter into force and your payment will be refunded in full..."Excerpt from gotogate->travel-conditions-> Booking processI got email from Gotogate and exact places I've selected.Next, I got email from airline with completely different seats.Ok, (to paraphrase T&C) apparently changes were made by the airline that are outside of Gotogate control and that occurred after a booking request has been made, and AFTER the contract with the airline has become binding.Contacting Gotogate support ended with reply that seat selection is just a preference, and you should contact airline to follow up your case.However, I checked my reservation at airline site, and it turned out that places I "bought" from Gotogate were available (they are still available at the moment I write this review, two days after the booking!)Moreover, seats were allocated not for passengers selected in Gotogate order but for an adult and a kid. Why? There is a family seating policy at airline that let you select seats for adult + kids for free if you select those seats in given section of the plane.I've paid extra money for specific seat selection and although they were available, the booking via Gotogate resulted in seats reservation that are available for free. It was not a fare limitation I can still select preferred seats with my tariff for 50% of cost Gotogate charged me with.You're still reading. It's not the end!Two days after booking I got notification that my tickets are blocked, as follows:Dear XXX this booking, XXYZZ, appears to have been made through a third-party travel agent who has no commercial relationship with airline to sell our flights. Therefore, airline has blocked this booking!...As third-party travel agents often do not provide airline with the correct passenger email address and payment details, we need to verify a passenger's identity before they can manage their booking and check-in online.airline needs to carry out this verification process in order to ensure we can comply with safety and security requirements."I went through online verification without problem- low additional cost is nothing compared with the procedure: you can feel like a person before they go behind the bars (look left, look right, close eyes)By the way, I found out that 3rd party agent had used their own cc number instead of mine.Happy ending, I contacted airline after verification and thanks to their assistance (good service experience!) I managed to assign two places next to each other as I wanted from the beginning.

Review: I ordered a ticket via flybillet.dk thinking that it is a Danish agency and as most of the Danish companies they might also have some Danish values.However, I was completely wrong. I booked a ticket last year, but the airline cancelled the flight and offered a rebooking or cancel with full refund. I choose full re-fund option as rebooking was not convenient, this was on 1st January 2023.I was also informed by both flybillet.dk and the airlines that you will receive full refund. Later the airlines confirmed that they have refunded the money to flybillet.dk. And from past 7 months flybillet.dk is holding my money for no reason even though I contacted them several times via all channels, i am never given any reason from flybillet.dk. This company sounds not legitimate to me.I would advise you all not to book tickets via flybillet.dk . Their service is worse and customer service is useless. They do not answer your question. They do not follow any business ethics and not at all a consumer centric company.Here is the order Number: LMGMO4Remember that I did not cancel the order, the flight was cancelled. Review: Subject: Flight Cancellation Refund Request - Order No: MEF19H I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction and disappointment regarding the recent experience I had with the booking made through your platform.On August 5, 2023, I had a flight scheduled from Vancouver to Toronto with Lynx Air, departing at 11:10 PM. Unfortunately, when I attempted to check the flight status on Lynx Air's website, I was shocked to discover that my flight had been canceled.Immediately, I contacted your customer service through the phone, but I had to endure an extended waiting period before I could speak to a representative. After finally getting through, I was informed that my flight was rebooked, and an email was sent to me notifying about travel documents too. However, upon arriving at the airport for my flight, I was informed by the airline's counter that my name was not registered for any flight, and there was no booking under my name.To rectify the situation, the airline's representative contacted Gotogate on my behalf, and they confirmed that it would take up to three days to investigate the matter. Unfortunately, there were no available flights for the same day, and I had no choice but to purchase a new ticket, incurring substantial financial losses and causing significant inconvenience.

Review: I booked a flight with them, and I also bought the extra option to get the flight refunded for any reason (which I paid an extra 200$ for).After a month, I had to cancel the flight for personal reasons, so I contacted the assistance.Now‚Ä¶Initially the guy said ‚Äúsorry we can‚Äôt refund you anything because that‚Äôs what the airline says‚Äù, which at that point I go: ‚Äúsorry but it doesn‚Äôt make any sense. I paid the extra price to make sure I could cancel the flight in case I suddenly couldn‚Äôt go on the trip‚Äù. So then he says ‚Äúyes sure, since you bought that extra option, you‚Äôll get the full price of the ticket but not the price of the option to get a refund (the 200$ I mentioned)‚Äù which okay, I read it wouldn‚Äôt get refunded, and I would have preferred to lose 200$ instead of 800$, so I didn‚Äôt have an issue with that.Fast forward to a week later, I see a refund of 45$ in my account from the airline. I contact the assistance, and they tell me ‚Äúsorry we can‚Äôt do anything. That‚Äôs what the airline policy says‚Äù.Turns out that they basically just ask for a refund on the airline site instead of you‚Ä¶all for the wonderful starting price of 200$. Idk if they send a golden flying pigeon with a hand written letter in order to request the refund, but this is a very sad strategy from them in order to make more money. I could have at least saved 200$.‚Ä¶In the end, I lost 1000$.This site is a scam.Pay a bit more, but don‚Äôt buy from them. Get tickets on the airline site, or at least from more honest travel sites.

Review: You need to have a way to change the website language that is easily accessible. I struggled because I found your site via the Skyscanner app, which was in English, but then I got transferred to your .tw site because I live in Taiwan and then had no way to change the language. It was ridiculous. The only way I was able to book was to leave the site and search manually. I have spent the last 16hrs trying to buy airfare for my family and it's been truly heartbreaking. We are on the cusp of the 1 month out price increase. We are relocating to the US, so funds are tight. My son starts school soon, but is a minor. I needed to travel with him to Japan to get him on the plane. How do you book a roundtrip flight for an adult and a one-way for a kid? You can't. I had to book either roundtrips and waste half a ticket or book all one-way tickets. Now add the issue of trying to bring my family and difficulty on other sites before yours when it came to credit card processing. Review: I am not one to normally complain , however  I would strongly urge any customer NOT to book through this travel agency. I had booked 3 return tickets to travel to India through Booking .com. Booking.com use this travel agency  as an intermediary to manage their flight bookings. After paying nearly 2900 pounds  for 3 return tickets via BA, and PAID baggage allowance of 23kg per passenger  ,for both the forward and return journey we found  that when  received the tickets from BA a day before travel , the tickets had 23 kg x 2 = 46kg check in baggage for each passenger and NO check in baggage on return. We have contacted BA and were informed that the travel agency has informed them this was the case for our travel, despite our tickets both from Booking.com and travel documents issued by this agency at the time of booking , clearly stating that baggage allowance included with return journey   I am appalled with the service as despite repeated communications to them via email and phone calls , there has been no resolution. The customer services on the other hand have behaved very dismissively to us , and have been looking into this for the past 3 weeks depsite repeated attempts to raise this issue with them, there has been no communication/ resolution. Now with return travel 24 hours away , I have had to pay an additional 240 Euros for baggaage allowance to return to the UK and in addition Pay for seat reservation. I am not one to complain  , but I would warn anyone booking their travel to be wary of this company. please check when you book flights via booking.com that the intermediary is not gotogate, I would strongly urge you to book your tickets directly with the Airlines.  SR

Review: BOOK FLIGHTS DIRECTLY WITH AIRLINES AND AVOID TRAVEL AGENTS LIKE THIS ONE. IF YOU DO USE THIS OR ANOTHER TRAVEL AGENT THEN PAY WITH A CREDIT CARD. THE CREDIT CARD COMPANY WILL THEN INVESTIGATE ISSUES. YOU WILL THANK ME LATER!During Covid I realised that no matter the price, it was always best to book flights directly with the airline so that changes could be made quickly/efficiently.This time, I booked a return ticket from India to UK on Virgin using Go To Gate because the price was so cheap and I did not check reviews (my mistake!). I paid ¬£672.99 by credit card.One week before the first flight, one of the Virgin flights was cancelled. This was not the fault of G2G. I believe everything would have been fine had the Virgin flight not been cancelled.I tried to reschedule the flight but after a number of calls to G2G, being on hold, getting "disconnected", being transferred to various "departments", I asked for a refund.10 days later I got a refund of ¬£648.29, which was ¬£24.70 less than I paid. I asked why this was and all G2G said was this was the refund they got from Virgin and for me to contact Virgin! Why should I do that?! I booked with G2G so surely they can tell me why I paid ¬£672.99 but only got refunded ¬£648.29.I asked for a refund invoice so I could see where the missing ¬£24.70 had gone but no response. I have asked my credit card company to investigate.Compared to the unfortunate experience of others, I suppose I should be happy that I got most of my money back pretty quickly. However I am not happy about the missing ¬£24.70 which G2G can't explain to me.I can guess that below, Go To Gate will respond with the standard copy paste about them wanting to help in future. I don't think so. I repeat:BOOK FLIGHTS DIRECTLY WITH AIRLINES AND AVOID TRAVEL AGENTS LIKE THIS ONE. IF YOU DO USE THIS OR ANOTHER TRAVEL AGENT THEN PAY WITH A CREDIT CARD. THE CREDIT CARD COMPANY WILL THEN INVESTIGATE ISSUES. YOU WILL THANK ME LATER!Update 16 August 2023: As expected, GTG copy pasted their standard reply. Amazing how they were able to respond to me here on Trustpilot but have still not provided the refund invoice. In any case, my credit card company has refunded the ¬£24.70. Adios!

Review: My experience with Gotogate, a partner of Booking.com in Australia, has been nothing short of a frustrating journey. It all began when my booked flight, managed by Gotogate, was unexpectedly cancelled by the airline. I opted for a refund as per their provided options, but little did I know the ordeal that awaited me.From the start, communication with Gotogate was inconsistent and often vague. Despite my inquiries, I received generic responses that lacked specific details about the refund process. As the days turned into weeks, and the weeks into months, my frustration grew as I remained in the dark about the status of my refund.The lack of transparency and clear updates only added to my disappointment. I had expected Gotogate to be a reliable intermediary, but their handling of the refund process fell far short of my expectations. It left me feeling helpless and uncertain about when or if I would receive my hard-earned money back.As the delay continued, it caused significant financial strain. I had budgeted for the trip, and the prolonged wait for the refund left me scrambling to cover unexpected expenses. This added stress only exacerbated my feelings of frustration and disappointment.Attempts to escalate the matter and seek assistance from higher authorities yielded little results. It felt like my concerns were falling on deaf ears, and Gotogate's customer service appeared ill-equipped to handle the situation appropriately.In the end, the experience has left me feeling let down and upset. I had trusted Gotogate to handle my travel plans professionally, but their inability to follow proper procedures with the airline has shattered that trust completely.Overall, the entire process with Gotogate and SriLankan Airlines has been disheartening and emotionally draining. I hope sharing my experience serves as a warning to others to be cautious when using Gotogate's services and to consider alternative options for their travel needs.REPLY TO GOTOGATE RESPONSELike always stupid copy past reply from them. Haven't bothered read the review, proving my point. Thank you

Review: I booked a flight with booking.com (8 May 23). A few hours later, I received an email saying my booking had been cancelled by booking.com (same day) and that I would be refunded in 2-5 days. So I had to book the flight directly with the airline. It is now 21 July, and they still haven‚Äôt refunded me the money (nearly ¬£500) no matter how much I chase customer support (who is run by go to gate). They initially blamed my credit card provider (Amex), but it‚Äôs clear the amount has been charged to booking.com / go to gate and they‚Äôve made no efforts to refund it to date.  I‚Äôve tried emailing and phoning multiple times, but don‚Äôt even bother - the robot lady just says my booking number doesn‚Äôt exist and you just get cookie cutter email replies days later. All I can say is just to never ever use booking or go to gate as I surely never will again - you will regret it when something goes wrong as they will just keep your money and blame the airline (look at all the shocking reviews saying the same!).1 Aug - still no refund, support tells me I should speak to airline myself. Laughable

Review: it's now nearly a month I am going back and forth with customer service to only find out now that even if I purchased a ticket with FREE check-in, they cannot guarantee it's free. What kind of scam is that? I had to pay at Ryanair counter ¬£110 because my ticket was impossible to be generated from the go to gate website, the booking reference was blocked by ryanair as the app recognized it as a booking made by a third party. So 7 hours prior to departure I started calling customer service asking them what was happening and I was repeatedly promised to not worry over the phone by CS that they will be sending me the boarding pass by email prior to departure.The boarding pass never arrived, and at no stage I was informed that the go to gate team was unable to do it for me. Now, 3 weeks later they tell me they are not allowed to do it for their customers!!!So I purchased a faulty product that included a free check-in and I had to pay for their mistakes and lies over the phone. And they refuse to refund me for a service they did not provide and I had to pay otherwise I could not fly. The check-in was never free, as they also told only today me that they are actually aware Ryanair doesn't allow these third-party tickets to be retrieved by customers and we should have paid the check-in service at go to gate in advance for them to send us the tickets!!!At no stage, I was told prior to departure that I had to pay a fee to be sent the boarding passes.You better refund me the money i had to pay or you are proof that you are just here to scam customers.

Review: NEVER book any flight with this company!!! We booked 3 flights from Denmark to Zanzibar, but after some time when we did our check-in we found out that they have cancelled the last flight home from Frankfurt to Denmark. We have payed all and have been in contact with Go to gate many time (calls for hours and mails) but nothing is happening. We got a mail from Go to Gate, where they are saying that it is their mistake and we will get new tickets within 24 hours. It is many days ago and now we're trying to relax on our holiday, without knowing what to do from Frankfurt to Billund. So please if you wanna enjoy your holiday without any stress and bad mood, then always book your flights directly from the flight companies website. Christina, Kurt & Lene Gilling

Review: Giving this gotogate.com an automatic one star is unfair to a consumer like myself that was ripped off by this crooked "travel booking" company owned by flight center toronto I believe. Booked a flight through them because we wanted to support an African airline Rwandan airlines who is also terrible now based on my recent interactions with them. Booked √† flight, there was an issue with one connection. Called a day before to let them know. The agent I spoke to said to me, oh you we can't really do anything till you have actually missed the flight. I said really? He said I had to call after the flight had departed then they could reschedule me. TOTAL LIE, because I called them again the next day before the flight left to tell them that I had bought a whole new flight at √† premium cost to get to jfk , and from jfk I thought I could get to dulles which was my departure airport. I got to jfk with jetblue at about 330am. Before clearing customs e.t.c it was about 430am. My flight from dulles was leaving dulles at 1110am. The only flight from jfk to Washington was to regan international which is still 35m from dulles. So go rent √† car, to drive 4 1/2 hrs. Called gotogate.com again, to inform them that It's likely I won't make it to dulles before the 3hr checking for international flights requirement. Was ready to leave the airport in the rental, and I saw on the departure board that there was a flight from jfk to the same place I was supposed to fly to from Washington with the same airline. So I called gotogate.com again told them and offered to even pay the difference in price which was showing on line as 300+ usd. The agent said, go talk to qatar airlines and explain everything to them. I said why can't you do it, she said because you are already there and only the airline can do it. My flight was by Rwanda airlines but qatar airlines there partner was doing the first half of the flight. So to me it was straight forward, atleast I thought. Decided not to risk my life driving in the middle of the night, tired and I didn‚Äôt know which way, was just going to be at the mercy of g.p.s. Qatar airlines was not opening their jfk counter till 7, so I hoped for the best, returned the rental with a charge, and went to wait by qatar airlines counter at jfk.Qatar airlines opens and they said. "Oh we don‚Äôt sell tickets or do ticket changes here. Your agent gotogate.com should know that. Then I realized what they where doing they were sending all over the place so they could steak my money. I called them back again, by this time I had spoken to them often had to be on hold, keep in mind it is long distance. I called them back again the 11th time, told them what qatar airlines said and the agent said oh how can I help you, I said can you check the notes on my account,  she said there were no notes. I said what, no notes?. She said call Rwanda airlines. ( Anyone reading this should try calling that terrible airline) and see. They have no international number, the number they have listed never has anyone answer. I called back gotogate.com again and now I was kept on hold for 29mins. Then the person came on and said oh sorry we won't refund you because you missed your flight.Ref: MCPYZB as requested.These guys believe they can keep getting away with stealing from people. There parent company Entaveli isn't doing anything about it because they were acquired for some ridiculous amount of money. All money stolen from hardworking people who only wants service and fairness. Everyone who has ever been taken by gotogate to band together and file a class action lawsuit.

Review: I booked a return flight to Goa from London with this intermediary company GoToGate, via Booking.com. They are a terrible company to deal with and have given me conflicting information about cancellation fees. All of their messages which are sent in reply to queries made via Booking.com are automated, i.e. generated by a machine (probably Chat-GPT). They confirmed this in a phone call when they explained why their messages was saying the cancellation fee is ¬£150 per passenger, yet on the phone it is ¬£300 per passenger. Then, most recently, they have told me it is ¬£350 per passenger, after the customer rep spoke to a 'supervisor'. This is despite, when looking at Air India's fare rules, it saying that the fee is ¬£150 per passenger and the same being confirmed when I spoke with an Air India customer rep on the phone (I also recorded the phone call so I have the evidence).I wish I had booked direct with the airline, Air India. I will NEVER use GoToGate again. It is not worth a small discount in the fare. Book DIRECT with the airline. Don't subject yourself to the huge stress in talking with these GTG people and risk being scammed. Booking.com play no part in the communication - all links to 'Help and Support' via their website are to the phone number and messaging service of GTG. I have started a Dispute Resolution process which I somehow found on Booking.com via a Google search and will see if that gets me anywhere. Do not trust GTG - book direct.

Review: A conclusion for those not wanting to read a long review:) look at Gotogate‚Äôs Trustpilot ranking, if I had done so I wouldn‚Äôt have used their service.My experience:The company‚Äôs online chat representative was not able to provide answers to questions that should have been within the realm of his knowledge and the answers he was able to provide have been in direct contradiction with the information provided by gotogate‚Äôs website- the representative did not address that contradiction and sent me to telephone customer support for which I waited for 30 minutes before being disconnected and am now waiting for again.Update: After an extra hour and a half wait on the telephone I had a similar experience with a telephone representative that was both unable to answer basic questions with regards to my journey (such as what happens if the first flight in a single journey ticket is delayed and a thus a connecting flight is missed) as well as letting me know that I have 2 hours to cancel instead of the 24 hours the website clearly stated and if I cancel within 2 hours it will be for a (USD 90) fee not stated in the 24 hour cancellation that the website clearly claimed I have- the representative‚Äôs reply to the blatant disregard of company policy is that the airlines do not allow this and she cannot do anything about it.* I requested to talk to a supervisor and such have been told one will get back to me within 24 hours. After talking to the airline I received information that is mostly reassuring.I have read gotogate reply and although polite it does not change my experience. I wouldn‚Äôt have been able to cancel my flight and get answers in the time allowed for cancelling but the false advertising of a 24 hour cancellation policy and the time it takes to contact representatives (and them being without the knowledge required) will keep me away from using this platform again - it doesn‚Äôt provide the peace of mind that is essential to making travel plans and for travel in general.

Review: TWO LONG HAUL TICKETS' VALUE LOST, GOTOGATE OFFERS NO SOLUTION, HIDES FROM COMMUNICATIONWe bought two tickets for a flight Brussels-Madrid-Sao Paulo-Rio De Janeiro.One ticket for a child, one for an adult.The flight Brussels-Madrid was rescheduled for the adult, not for the child. So the child would have to travel alone, which is not possible.Then the booking for the adult was completely lost. Since the child cannot travel alone, this renders both tickets unusable.Gotogate does not reply to emails properly. Their response consists of ‚Äòwe need permission to process your details‚Äô, then ‚Äòwe need your booking details‚Äô (which you already provided, of course), then ‚Äòwe need the airline‚Äôs permission to alter your flight‚Äô etc. It goes on and on like that. Then no solution in the end.When calling, be prepared to wait forever: first 45 minutes wait to talk to someone, then this person says 'I have to ask my supervisor' for which you're put on hold again for an hour, then the supervisor comes on the phone and puts you on hold again for 45 minutes etc. The result: several calls of 4-5 hours length (!!!!) and no solution. Mind you, these are international calls to Finland, with the appropriate price tag. In the end they just put you on hold forever (more than 2 hours on hold) until you give up and hang up the phone. Or they disconnect the line. Their way of solving problems...Last episode in this soap: an email from Gotogate that they solved the problem by rebooking the flight for the adult‚Ä¶ departing 8 months later, from Stockholm instead of Brussels! Can you believe this? The mail ended with the question if we needed any further support‚Ä¶@Gotogate: I‚Äôm providing you with the booking details and the email address used for the creation of the booking in the private comment section, so don‚Äôt come with the excuse that you can‚Äôt do anything because you lack these. I will not accept this abuse and will take legal action when needed.

Review: I recently booked a flight through Gotogate.co.uk in partnership with Booking.com (Booking Order number: 40-381575513) for a trip on 1st July. However, my experience with this company has been nothing short of a nightmare.From the moment I made the booking until the day of the flight, I attempted to make changes by contacting Gotogate customer care more than 20 times. Shockingly, they were utterly unhelpful and simply advised me to contact Qatar Airways. But even Qatar Airways couldn't make any changes because Gotogate.co.uk had booked my flight with a promotional fare.Frustrated, I decided to cancel the flight and contacted customer care to inquire about the penalty for cancellation. Initially, I was informed that the penalty would be ¬£58. However, just two days before the flight, when I called to confirm the cancellation penalty, I was informed that it would be ¬£109. But to my astonishment, when I actually canceled the flight prior to departure, they charged me a whopping ¬£189. When I questioned them about this sudden increase, they casually mentioned that the fee was higher because I cancelled within 3 hours of departure. This information was never conveyed to me beforehand. Instead, I was assured that the penalty would be ¬£109 regardless of the timing of cancellation.I attempted to escalate the issue by contacting the higher authorities and requested to listen to the audio recordings of our previous conversations, but I received no response whatsoever. Now, I am left with no choice but to consider filing a formal complaint with the police if I do not receive a proper response from them. It is alarming how they continue to shift blame onto the airlines for fare increases while their customer care remains utterly helpless.I received an email stating that an airline cancellation fee of GBP 189 per person would be deducted from my refund on Jul 1, 2023, and I am yet to receive any refund from them.In summary, my experience with Gotogate.co.uk has been absolutely horrendous. I strongly advise against using their services or booking through Booking.com. They provide no assistance, mislead customers with incorrect information, and are unresponsive to complaints. Save yourself the stress and frustration by avoiding this company altogether.

Review: Order M2X8R21st change on 6th June, found out flight time change by email from the airline, not from flybillet. Duo to this, we no longer could make it to our connecting flight. Contacted flybillet and rebooking was processed. 2nd change on 12th June, found out by logging into the airline‚Äôs My Booking page, that our return flights disappeared all together. Contacted flybillet, and they have offered us another rebooking routes, which did not suite us. Requested the previous flights back, only to be told it is not available. (I wonder then, why I could still see them available for purchase elsewhere). Had to agree on another flights back as a result.3rd change on 24th June. Email received from flybillet, informing us that our flights have been cancelled. In the email they have offered us 1 option - to request for refund. As I was not offered an option to rebook, I had no choice but to request for refund, which I did. 2 weeks has passed, not a word from flybillet. I had followed up again via chat today, and was offered an option to rebook. I do not understand anymore what is going on with this company. In the email, I was NOT given an option to rebook. But now they are offering me!? Too late, I want nothing to do with this company and I just want my money back and move on. None of these happened due to our mistake/faults, yet we have been treated like rubbish. Lack of internal alignments (each time you contact them, be aware your call will be passed around with long waiting time, and you will have to explain them your whole story over and over.) and lack of sympathy (we receive no word of apology every time we follow up) amaze me. Cherry on top is that our requested flight for rebooking, still is available for purchases today elsewhere. But apparently through flybillet, there are no flights available, only option for us was to refund, and refund takes forever with no updates.I strongly advise everyone to stay away from this company, they are scammers.

Review: This is the first and last time I use GOTOGATE service. On March 31st, the airline unexpectedly cancelled my flight, and I was assured that I would receive a refund. However, it is now July 6th, and I have yet to receive the promised refund. This prolonged delay is completely unacceptable and goes beyond any reasonable timeframe for a refund. I am deeply disappointed, as I have never encountered such a prolonged wait for a refund, especially considering the circumstances in which I was forced to purchase a new ticket out of my own pocket, costing me ove ¬£600. I strongly advise against using this service, as my experience has been nothing short of a highly frustrating nightmare.

Review: Booked a long-awaited holiday to Japan via Booking.com. Before we flew, I checked my documents and became concerned that I didn't have any baggage allowance for the return flight, so I queried this but was reassured that I did indeed have the same allowance for both flights. On booking in for the flight home, we were informed my suspicion had been right, and there was no baggage allowance for the journey. I showed the agent the email conversation where it confirmed we did have it, but obviously they have no power to overrule it so understandably I had to pay for it there and then.Registered a claim shortly after we got home, which was answered very quickly and I was informed that a system error had deleted the baggage allowance from the journey. They requested confirmation of the baggage charge, which I sent in and received a prompt response through GoToGate that they would honour it and credit me shortly. I was very happy with how efficiently this had gone. A couple of weeks later, there was no sign of the refund, so I wrote back to request an update. Then two weeks later. Then a month later.... This has been going on since January and we're now in July! Each and every time I have had a formulaic response just asking me to be patient - well I'm sorry, but my patience is more than used up! It was not a small amount of money to be shelling out after a trip like that, especially right before Christmas. They need to get this sorted asap before I am forced to take my concerns to the appropriate ombudsman.

Review: Avoid at all costs!!!I never dealt with a more unprofessional company.  I booked flexible tickets for a return trip from Dublin to Faro via Lisbon on Air Portugal.  I couldn't use the outward flight but wanted to retain the return flight.  Even with the flexible ticket they cancelled my complete booking with no refund.  When I tried to reschedule the flights to early next year they wouldn't let me, using an excuse that Air Portugal were now using a third party airline for the Lisbon - Faro leg.  Also they won't let you reschedule a flexible ticket on-line you have to phone them.  My opinion is that they train their staff to be deliberately unhelpful and slow to the point that you hang up in frustration.  I repeatedly asked to speak to a Supervisor or Manager and was refused. I will never use GoToGate again under any circumstances. No matter the extra cost, book directly with the airline.
